Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.




Siamo alla ricerca di profili junior entusiasti e motivati da inserire nella nostra Business Unit specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence e Big Data.




Percorso Formativo: Durante lo stage, i tirocinanti seguiranno un percorso formativo strutturato per fornire competenze tecniche e professionali nel settore IT.




Ecco una panoramica delle principali fasi:




Studio Teorico:

Sistemi di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Linguaggi di programmazione: .NET 2012, C#, Python
Introduzione ai concetti di Data Warehouse e Business Intelligence
Fondamenti di Statistica inferenziale e Machine Learning
Approccio conoscitivo all'AI generativa




Autoapprendimento:

Accesso a libri, corsi online e video training
Esercitazioni pratiche e quiz di autovalutazione




Contestualizzazione Funzionale:

Apprendimento pratico tramite progetti reali
Utilizzo di tecnologie come Windows Server, SQL Server, MongoDB, Visual Code, Visual Studio e strumenti di BI come Power BI




Lavoro in Team:

Interfacciamento con un team e un referente di progetto
Partecipazione a meeting di stato avanzamento lavori




Requisiti necessari:

Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica (indirizzo Data Science/Machine Learning)
Conoscenza teorica di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Utilizzo avanzato del pacchetto MS Office (Excel, Word)
Flessibilità oraria e capacità di lavorare in team
Dedizione allo studio e forte volontà di apprendere




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
Opportunità di crescita professionale
Supporto costante da parte di un supervisore esperto
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti innovativi e di alto impatto




Sede di lavoro: Milano




Contratto: tirocinio retribuito di 6 mesi finalizzato all’assunzione.




Se sei appassionato di IT e desideri iniziare la tua carriera in una realtà dinamica e innovativa, inviaci il tuo CV all'indirizzo cvannunci_mi@lynxspa.com, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679) e riportando nell'oggetto il riferimento all'annuncio.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Azienda & Valori: Il nostro cliente è un'azienda leader nel settore dell'Oil & Gas, impegnata nella sostenibilità e nell'innovazione tecnologica. Si distingue per l'adozione di strategie mirate alla sicurezza e all'eccellenza operativa, con un forte impegno verso l'ambiente.




Titolo della posizione: Specialista in Inserimento e Analisi dei Dati (M/F/D)




Finalità del Ruolo: Il candidato ideale supporterà le operazioni quotidiane attraverso l'inserimento e la verifica di dati accurati nei sistemi gestionali del nostro cliente.




Tasks e Relazioni Funzionali:

Interne: Collaborazione con il team amministrativo del cliente per l'archiviazione e la verifica di documenti.
Esterne: Interazioni con partner internazionali per la raccolta di dati, richiedendo una discreta conoscenza dell'inglese.




Funzioni Primarie:

Inserimento e verifica di dati in database specifici del settore.
Supporto nella generazione di reportistica per il management.
Gestione dell'archiviazione documentale, sia digitale che cartacea.




Formazione e Competenze:

Diploma di scuola superiore, preferibilmente in ambito economico o tecnico.
Esperienza pregressa nel ruolo, idealmente nel settore Oil & Gas.
Discreta conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Hard Skills:

Proficienza in Microsoft Excel e familiarità con software gestionali.
Capacità di gestire grandi volumi di dati con precisione.




Soft Skills:

Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli.
Capacità di lavorare sotto pressione e rispetto delle scadenze.
Competenze comunicative e relazionali.




Cosa Offre il Nostro Committente:

Contratto a Tempo Indeterminato con una RAL massima di 35.000€.
Benefit: Assicurazione sanitaria, contributi per il benessere, opportunità di formazione e crescita professionale.
Flessibilità: Possibilità di lavoro ibrido fino a due giorni alla settimana.




Trattamento dei Dati Personali: I dati personali dei candidati saranno trattati nel rispetto delle normative vigenti (GDPR). L'invio del curriculum implica l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali per finalità di valutazione e selezione.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
HTML:
Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay’s key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support;
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement;
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making;
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights;
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data;
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes;
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation;
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay;
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.

You’ll be great for this role if:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech;
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling;
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses;
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way;
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas;
  • You’re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000€ (Gross Annual Base);
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day;
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences;
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team;
  • Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role;
  • Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office;
  • Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay’s values and assess cultural alignment.

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with experience in the Insurance sector?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Show more
HTML:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with experience in the Insurance sector?


We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.


Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.



What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!


Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.


Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.


What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

  • Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
  • Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
  • Organize and structure data for analysis.


2. Data Analysis:

  • Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
  • Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
  • Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.


3. Data Visualization:

  • Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
  • Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
  • Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.


4. Reporting and Presentation:

  • Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
  • Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
  • Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.


5. Data-driven Decision Making:

  • Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.


6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

  • Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
  • Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
  • Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.


What do you need to bring?

  • Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
  • Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
  • Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Supporting all Franchises (Medical Care / Dermo-Cosmetics & Personal Care), the Data Analyst is a key Business Partner for the General Management. The position is based in Brussels.


Main Responsibilities

  • Data analysis and reporting: Maintain and update existing dashboards (weekly and monthly) to ensure stakeholders have real-time access to key business metrics.
  • Improve, simplify, standardize, and automate existing dashboards, reports, and KPIs.
  • Identify inefficiencies in reporting processes and propose innovative solutions for improvement.
  • Ideally, leverage scripting (e.g., Python, SQL) to streamline data extraction, transformation, and automation of manual processes.
  • Business Development Support: Collaborate closely with stakeholders to monitor and enhance brand/portfolio performance (e.g., market share, sell-in/sell-out analysis).
  • Analyze channel performance, providing insights into the effectiveness of various sales and marketing channels (pharmacies, e-commerce, direct-to-consumer).
  • Ad hoc and Corporate Projects :Act as the go-to analytical resource for ad hoc requests from sales and marketing teams.
  • Design and develop new dashboards to meet evolving needs, using advanced tools like Tableau.
  • Collaborate with HQ and business teams to ensure data accuracy, proper integration of systems, and alignment of analytics initiatives with business goals.


Profile

  • Education : Master’s degree in data analytics, statistics, business engineering, computer science, or a related technical field;
  • Languages : Fluent in French and English; knowledge of Dutch is a plus;
  • Strong proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI);
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, with advanced Excel skills;
  • Knowledge of ERP systems (preferably Dynamics AX) and CRM platforms (preferably VEEVA);
  • Familiarity with ETL tools and processes such as Alteryx;
  • Ideally knowledge of SQL for database querying; experience with scripting languages such as Python;
  • Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive and solution-oriented mindset;
  • Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in data handling and reporting;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and team player;
  • Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment;
  • Stress resistant, ability to meet and establish tight deadlines;
  • Problem-solver with “can-do” mentality, able to both pragmatically define solutions and capture and understand all relevant details when necessary;
  • Ability to analyze vast amounts of data;
  • Ability to see the big picture while focusing on the process and procedures necessary to produce deliverables.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keystone Solutions is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team of consultants. This dynamic position involves providing expert data analysis support to a client organization as part of Keystone Solutions consultancy services. As a Keystone consultant, you will tackle critical projects, working closely with our client to drive data-driven decision-making and deliver actionable insights. This role offers a unique opportunity to grow your expertise across diverse challenges, supported by Keystones robust professional development programs.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:


Data Collection & Preparation: Gathering, cleansing, and organizing data from various sources to ensure high-quality inputs for analysis.
Analysis & Insights Generation: Applying statistical techniques and analytical tools to extract meaningful patterns and insights that support business objectives.
Visualization & Reporting: Creating clear and compelling data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Collaboration with Stakeholders: Partnering with client teams to understand their data needs and translate findings into actionable recommendations.
Process Improvement: Identifying inefficiencies in current data processes and recommending solutions for optimization.
Support for Strategic Initiatives: Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Requirements:

To excel in this role, you should have:


Education: A Bachelors or Masters degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView.
Familiarity with database management and ETL processes.

Analytical Abilities: Strong quantitative skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets.
Soft Skills: Excellent communication, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
Experience: 4+ years in a data analytics role, preferably with exposure to diverse industries or projects.


Why Join Keystone Solutions as a Consultant?


Diverse Client Projects: Work on varied and challenging assignments across industries, enhancing your professional expertise.
Professional Growth: Access to Keystone Solutions continuous learning programs, certifications, and mentorship opportunities to support your career ambitions.
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence in delivering solutions to clients.
Impactful Work: Play a pivotal role in transforming client operations through data-driven strategies and actionable insights.
Career Advancement: Build a strong foundation for long-term career growth within the consultancy realm, with opportunities to lead complex projects over time.



About Keystone Solutions:

Keystone Solutions is a leading consultancy firm specializing in delivering high-impact solutions to our clients. We pride ourselves on fostering a supportive environment where our consultants thrive while solving real-world challenges. As a Keystone consultant, you will represent our values of excellence, integrity, and innovation at every client engagement.

Ready to advance your career as a Keystone Data Analyst Consultant? Apply today and take the next step in a rewarding consultancy journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
I am currently searching for an experienced freelance Data Analyst to join an exciting client of mine based in Brussels




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analysing, interpreting, and transforming data into meaningful insights that inform the decision-making processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, and operations, to support strategic initiatives and help them meet their business objectives. This position requires a detail-oriented individual with strong analytical skills and an ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support project goals.
Create insightful reports, dashboards, and visualizations to track project performance and KPIs.
Identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights to support decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Present findings and data-driven recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and integrity across all analysis processes.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst (freelance experience preferred).
Proficiency in data analysis tools like SQL, Python, or R.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex insights to a non-technical audience.




Fluent in Dutch or French and English.




The Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Opportunity to collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team.
A chance to work on diverse and impactful projects.
Start date ASAP




If you are interested in this position, Please Apply Now !

Title: Data Analyst (NL + ENG)
Description:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Data Analyst

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Hybrid: 2-3 times a week on the client´s office

Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium

Mandatory Languages: One of the national languages (Dutch and French) must be the mother tongue, and the other language must be understood and readable

Job Description:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to transform raw data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. The successful candidate will analyze large datasets, create visualizations, and support teams with meaningful interpretations of data trends.

Responsibilities:


Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to uncover insights and trends;
Create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to support business objectives;
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs);
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular quality checks;
Identify areas for process improvement based on data-driven insights.



Requirements:


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4-6 years of experience in Data Analysis
Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Python, or R);
Experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau, Power BI, etc.);
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail;
Ability to translate data findings into actionable recommendations;



What We Offer


DKV Insurance
Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
Continuous and personalized career progression support
Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.



At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

Title: Data Analyst _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

Le service corporate Strategy & Legal joue un rôle majeur au sein de la SNCB au niveau du suivi des engagements de la SNCB en tant que prestataire de services publics dans les différentes activités principales de la SNCB. Par ailleurs, ce service staff joue également un rôle central dans la préparation, le suivi et l'évaluation de la stratégie de l'entreprise.

En tant que Data Analyst au sein du service Corporate Strategy, vous soutenez la SNCB dans le développement de modèles stratégiques en mettant l’accent sur l’analyse et la visualisation d’ensembles de données complexes. Vous collaborez avec différentes divisions pour veiller à ce que nos modèles soient coordonnés et cohérents et vous contribuez aux décisions stratégiques qui façonnent la SNCB.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

En tant que Data Analyst, vous assumez les tâches et responsabilités suivantes :


Analyser et interpréter les ensembles de données multivariées pour fournir des pistes stratégiques.
Exécuter des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et soutenir les analyses de transport.
Développer des visualisations et rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI afin de présenter des résultats de manière plus claire et accessible.
Réalisation d’analyses en Visum ou être disposé à maîtriser ce logiciel.
Collaborer avec d’autres data analysts et data engineers au sein de la société pour garantir la qualité des données et garder une cohérence dans l’utilisation d’ensembles de données entre les divisions.


Un job fait pour vous ?


Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie). Une première expérience professionnelle comme data analyst est un atout.


Par ailleurs, vous disposez des compétences suivantes :


Orienté résolution de problèmes, orienté équipe et disposé à soutenir la collaboration transversale au sein de la SNCB. Vous êtes capable de vous adapter en fonction des besoins du projet et des stakeholders internes concernés ;
Connaissance de techniques d’analyses multivariées et expérience dans la gestion et l’analyse de données géographiques ;
Vous avez une bonne connaissances de Python ;
De préférence, connaissance dans la modélisation des transports et maîtrise de Visum ou prêt à acquérir cette connaissance ;
Expérience des outils de visualisation et d’analyse des données tels que Power BI;
Bonnes aptitudes de communication et capacité à formuler clairement des idées complexes sur les données ;
Vous êtes créatif et orienté résolution de problèmes ;
Vous êtes avide d'apprendre et motivé à découvrir différentes activités de la SNCB.


Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui fait la force de la SNCB. C'est pourquoi la diversité et l'inclusion sont essentielles à nos yeux.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez soutenu et entouré de chouettes collègues. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13eme mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillerez à Bruxelles, à deux pas de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et pourrez télétravailler régulièrement.

What’s next ?

Nous voulons que vous vous sentiez bien parmi nous et que vous obteniez une image aussi complète que possible du travail, de vos collègues et de notre entreprise. C'est pourquoi nous prévoyons plusieurs étapes pour mieux faire connaissance. Toutes les étapes sont planifiées successivement, sur une période aussi courte que possible.


Vous pouvez postuler via notre jobsite
Nous examinerons votre CV et lettre de motivation avec grand intérêt et, si nécessaire, nous vous téléphonerons brièvement pour vous poser quelques questions supplémentaires et tester votre connaissance de la deuxième langue nationale. N'hésitez pas non plus à nous contacter !
Afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, nous vous inviterons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité en ligne. Lors de l'entretien, nous (le manager et les collègues) ferons plus ample connaissance avec vous et nous nous pencherons sur votre motivation, vos compétences, votre expérience et votre vision de la fonction. Bien entendu, vous pourrez également nous poser toutes les questions que vous souhaitez pour vous faire une idée précise de votre futur emploi.
Un deuxième entretien sera peut-être organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous ferons alors une proposition de contrat.
Vous commencerez votre nouveau job !


La procédure préliminaire peut éventuellement être interrompue ou adaptée pour des raisons fondées.

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq : 49738

Sur le contenu de cet emploi :

Bart Wuyts

M : bart.wuyts.851@belgiantrain.be

Sur la procédure de sélection :

Florence Servais

M : florence.servais@hr-rail.be

T : +32 2 432 54 60

  • Développer des visualisations et rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI afin de présenter des résultats de manière plus claire et accessible.
  • Réalisation d’analyses en Visum ou être disposé à maîtriser ce logiciel.
  • Collaborer avec d’autres data analysts et data engineers au sein de la société pour garantir la qualité des données et garder une cohérence dans l’utilisation d’ensembles de données entre les divisions.

Un job fait pour vous ?

  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie). Une première expérience professionnelle comme data analyst est un atout.

Par ailleurs, vous disposez des compétences suivantes :

  • Orienté résolution de problèmes, orienté équipe et disposé à soutenir la collaboration transversale au sein de la SNCB. Vous êtes capable de vous adapter en fonction des besoins du projet et des stakeholders internes concernés ;
  • Connaissance de techniques d’analyses multivariées et expérience dans la gestion et l’analyse de données géographiques ;
  • Vous avez une bonne connaissances de Python ;
  • De préférence, connaissance dans la modélisation des transports et maîtrise de Visum ou prêt à acquérir cette connaissance ;
  • Expérience des outils de visualisation et d’analyse des données tels que Power BI;
  • Bonnes aptitudes de communication et capacité à formuler clairement des idées complexes sur les données ;
  • Vous êtes créatif et orienté résolution de problèmes ;
  • Vous êtes avide d'apprendre et motivé à découvrir différentes activités de la SNCB.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui fait la force de la SNCB. C'est pourquoi la diversité et l'inclusion sont essentielles à nos yeux.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez soutenu et entouré de chouettes collègues. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de :

  • Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13eme mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
  • Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
  • Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
  • Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
  • Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
  • Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.

Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillerez à Bruxelles, à deux pas de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et pourrez télétravailler régulièrement.

What’s next ?

Nous voulons que vous vous sentiez bien parmi nous et que vous obteniez une image aussi complète que possible du travail, de vos collègues et de notre entreprise. C'est pourquoi nous prévoyons plusieurs étapes pour mieux faire connaissance. Toutes les étapes sont planifiées successivement, sur une période aussi courte que possible.

  • Vous pouvez postuler via notre jobsite
  • Nous examinerons votre CV et lettre de motivation avec grand intérêt et, si nécessaire, nous vous téléphonerons brièvement pour vous poser quelques questions supplémentaires et tester votre connaissance de la deuxième langue nationale. N'hésitez pas non plus à nous contacter !
  • Afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
  • Si le case study est concluant, nous vous inviterons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité en ligne. Lors de l'entretien, nous (le manager et les collègues) ferons plus ample connaissance avec vous et nous nous pencherons sur votre motivation, vos compétences, votre expérience et votre vision de la fonction. Bien entendu, vous pourrez également nous poser toutes les questions que vous souhaitez pour vous faire une idée précise de votre futur emploi.
  • Un deuxième entretien sera peut-être organisé si nécessaire.
  • Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous ferons alors une proposition de contrat.
  • Vous commencerez votre nouveau job !

La procédure préliminaire peut éventuellement être interrompue ou adaptée pour des raisons fondées.

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq : 49738

Sur le contenu de cet emploi :

Bart Wuyts

M : bart.wuyts.851@belgiantrain.be

Sur la procédure de sélection :

Florence Servais

M : florence.servais@hr-rail.be

T : +32 2 432 54 60

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Description

This is a full-time remote role for a Data Analyst at RKM HIRING. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data, creating data models, and communicating insights to stakeholders on a regular basis.




Qualifications

Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics skills
Strong Communication skills
Data Modeling expertise
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, or Mathematics
Experience with tools like SQL, Excel, and data visualization platforms
Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Le business des produits financiers (leasing, crédits, assurances) vous intéresse ?

Le secteur automobile et les défis futurs de la mobilité vous passionnent?

Vous avez déjà une première expérience dans le monde financier ?

Vous recherchez un nouveau défi et vous désirez exercer un job vous permettant d’exploiter pleinement vos talents en matière d'analyse financière ?

Dans ce cas vous êtes peut-être notre futur(e) collègue !




Stellantis Financial Services est la société financière des marques Peugeot, Citroën et DS, Opel , Fiat, Alpha Romeo,Abarth, Fiat Professional, Jeep, Maserati, construite en Joint-Venture avec la Banque Santander et présente dans plus de 10 pays Européens.

Nous proposons une large gamme de produits de financement dédiés à la mobilité : leasing, renting, crédits, assurances, ainsi que toute une gamme de services associés.

Nous accompagnons le développement des ventes de véhicules de nos marques via notre réseau de distribution.

(*) Stellantis est devenu le 4ème groupe mondial dans le secteur automobile et rassemble 14 marques automobiles




Votre fonction :

Création, analyse , communication et présentation des rapports en interne ainsi qu’en externe.
Plan d’action pour résoudre les problèmes liés aux diverses activités de la banque.
Communication aux autres services des risques liés à leur activité.
Contrôle de la performance de toutes les activités d’un point de vue risque même si celles-ci ne sont pas en lien direct avec le risque.
Production des chiffres des clôtures mensuelles.
Création du budget.
Réalisation des prévisions fin de mois
Piloter le risque de la banque et contrôler la performance vis-à-vis du budget .
Participation à la mise en place des différents projets liés au Risk.
Relation avec les audits internes et externes.
Responsable du risque opérationnel et polyvalence avec les autres fonctions du risque
Effectuer le traitement, l'exploitation et intégration des données dans un data warehouse (SAS)




Votre profil :

Master en ingénierie ou en mathématique
Excellente connaissance d'Excel
Connaissance du programme SAS souhaitée
Travailler sous la pression des délais
Equilibre entre esprit d'équipe et autonomie
Bilinguisme français-anglais




Nous vous proposons :

Travailler chez Stellantis Financial Services , c’est intégrer une société à taille humaine, mais aussi un groupe leader dans le secteur automobile, qui vous offre l’opportunité de de vous épanouir professionnellement et développer vos talents




Un environnement de travail centré sur l’automobile mais aussi la finance
Un environnement de type PME : familial, convivial, circuit de communication court, managers d’équipe accessibles et disponibles.
Un package complet avec avantages extra-légaux tels que chèque-repas, assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation…
6 jours de réduction de temps de travail sur base annuelle.
La possibilité de rejoindre des petites équipes soudées, motivées et compétentes qui favoriseront votre apprentissage et votre intégration.
Une évolution de carrière possible au sein des groupe SFS et Santander.
De nouveaux bureaux situés à Haren/Bruxelles avec parking et facilement accessibles en transport en commun
Show more

  • Une évolution de carrière possible au sein des groupe SFS et Santander.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hands-on experience (typically approx 3- 5 years) carrying out data analytics, data mining and product analytics in complex, fast-paced environments.
Applied knowledge of data analytics and data pipelining tools and approaches across all data lifecycle stages.
Deep understanding of a few and a high-level understanding of several commonly available statistics approaches
Advanced Power BI knowledge
Advanced SQL knowledge
Advanced scripting experience in R or python.
Ability to write and maintain moderately complex data pipelines
Strong business acumen.
Customer-centric and pragmatic mindset. Focus on value delivery and swift execution, while maintaining attention to detail.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Continuous learning and improvement mindset.




Thank you very much!

  • Continuous learning and improvement mindset.


Thank you very much!

Title: Internship Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join our Student Empowerment Program as a Marketing Data Analyst Intern!

What is the added value of our internship program?


Be a part of the SE community: Meaningful and connected experience guided by a Program Leader and a Business Mentor.
With us, learn every day: Dedicated learning path combining business and soft skills training
Evolve in the BeNe cluster: Enhance collaboration and networking in an international environment


Where?

At Uccle, in Brussels, Belgium.

Duration?

3-6 months (depending on your school convention) - Ideally starting in February or September 2025!

What will be your mission?

As an intern, you will support our team by analyzing data to drive strategic decision-making and improve marketing and sales effectiveness. You will work with various data sources to provide insights, create reports, and assist in the development of data-driven marketing and sales strategies.

Here's how your internship could look like...


Data Collection & Management: Spend time each day gathering and analyzing data from various sources such as SalesForce,
Data Analysis: Analyze marketing performance metrics to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Reporting: Create regular reports and dashboards to communicate findings and performance metrics to the marketing/sales team and stakeholders.
Campaign Support: Assist in measuring and evaluating the effectiveness of campaigns, providing insights to optimize future efforts.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, offer management, and marketing, to ensure data accuracy and alignment on performance objectives.


Learning Experience:


Gain hands-on experience in data cleaning techniques to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data you collect.
Understand how to interpret the data and translate it into actionable insights.
Provide insights based on your analysis to help optimize future sales/marketing efforts.
Develop your problem-solving skills as you tackle diverse analytical challenges.


What student are we looking for?


Fluent in French/English or Dutch/English
Master’s or Bachelor's degree, preferably in Marketing, Statistics, or Economics
Ability to work independently.
Strong analytical skills
Proficient in Excel and data visualization tools (like Tableau or Power BI).


What about our recruitment process?


An exchange with the recruiter
An exchange with your tutor


Ready to Take the Next Step?

At Schneider Electric we believe in fostering a culture of growth and innovation. When you join us, you'll be part of a supportive and collaborative team that encourages your professional development. We provide comprehensive training and mentorship to help you excel in your role. If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with us and make a real impact in the world, apply now to join our team! Together, let's create a brighter future and unlock your full potential at Schneider Electric! We are thrilled to receive your application and are looking forward to reviewing it!

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

€36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 Breng data tot leven en maak impact!




Wil jij de spil zijn in het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen binnen een innovatieve organisatie? 🌟 Als Data Analyst krijg jij de kans om data om te toveren tot krachtige inzichten die onze business naar een hoger niveau tillen. Dit is jouw kans om jouw analytische scherpte, technische vaardigheden en talent voor communicatie in te zetten en écht het verschil te maken. 💡




Als Data Analyst ben je onmisbaar in onze organisatie. Jij:




Implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagementoplossingen die het gebruik van data en rapportages optimaliseren. 📈
Visualiseert data met tools zoals Tableau of Power BI en vertaalt complexe data naar begrijpelijke inzichten. 📊
Analyseert en modelleert data om waardevolle inzichten te leveren voor strategische keuzes. 📚
Waarborgt de kwaliteit van onze data door middel van testing en het opstellen van een data quality beleid. ✅
Adviseert en ondersteunt de organisatie bij het maken van data-gedreven beslissingen. 🧠
Stimuleert innovatie door het toepassen van AI en Machine Learning in onze rapportage- en analyseprocessen. 🤖




Waarmee kan jij ons team versterken?

Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring met datavisualisatietools (zoals Tableau of Power BI). 💻
Je hebt kennis van data-analyse en -modellering en bent bekend met AI en Machine Learning.
Je bent communicatief vaardig en kunt complexe inzichten vertalen naar begrijpelijke taal voor stakeholders. ✨
Je bent proactief, innovatief en gedreven om het beste uit data te halen. 🔍
Je kan je vlot uitdrukken in het Nederlands, Frans en Engels.
Je hebt kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira.




What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.




We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.




Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, bonus, vergoedingen, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Show more

What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.


We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.


Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, bonus, vergoedingen, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Title: Market Data Analyst (Junior)
Description:
Euroheat & Power is the European association promoting sustainable heating & cooling, focusing on district heating and cooling (DHC) solutions. It represents 160+ members in more than 30 countries worldwide, including national DHC associations in the European Union, utilities operating DHC systems, manufacturers, research institutes, consultants and other organisations involved in the DHC sector.




Position Summary

We are looking for a detail-driven, proactive and highly motivated Junior Market Data Analyst for our Market Intelligence Unit to help develop better data and identify trends on the heat market.




Reporting to the Market Intelligence Analyst, you will play a crucial role in interpreting data, analysing results, and providing insights about the district heating and cooling sector. You will support the team in developing and maintaining databases and dashboards and ensuring data accuracy and integrity. The role will require working on key deliverables such as the annual market outlook, reports, webinars and workshops.




You will help provide a better vision and understanding of the current district heating and cooling market, technologies, and decarbonisation pathways. In doing so, you will help companies and policymakers make the right decisions to support the heat transition!




Main tasks

Support the data collection and analysis activities, create and maintain databases,
Contribute to the development and delivery of the flagship DHC Market Outlook,
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability,
Engage with external stakeholders and experts for data collection,
Monitor and respond to internal data requests, providing timely and accurate information,
Monitor quantitative and qualitative research on the district heating and cooling sector,
Support the preparation of market intelligence deliverables such as reports, webinars, or workshops,
Prepare presentations and briefing notes for internal and external meetings (industry, policymakers),
Contribute to weekly team meetings with ideas and insights,
Undertake any other tasks as required by the Market Intelligence Director.




Skills required

Proficient use of Excel (e.g. pivot tables, data validation, data consolidation), and the Microsoft Office package (Word, PowerPoint and Outlook),
Attention to detail and strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights, identify trends and patterns,
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and findings in a clear and concise manner,
Ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions,
Fluency in English (written and spoken),
Relevant degree at university level: Economics, statistics, engineering or similar,
Knowledge of energy markets is a bonus.




Requirements:

You must be eligible to work in Belgium (EU citizen)
You must have completed your studies with a relevant degree
You can start in January 2025




We offer

A great working environment in a fast-growing EU association, with a supportive and friendly international team,
Professional development: opportunities for continuous learning and growth, taking part in projects which support the decarbonisation of the EU heating and cooling sector,
Paid traineeship under "Convention d'immersion professionelle" for a duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension (according to Belgian Law, up to 12 months).
Salary package: 997,09 EUR per month, meal voucher (8 EUR per working day with a 1.09€ employee contribution), transportation allowance, GSM, internet, IT Equipment.




How to apply?

Please send your curriculum vitae (CV) and motivation letter (maximum one page) to cm@euroheat.org with the subject "Junior Market Data Analyst Internship – your name". The letter should outline your suitability and motivation for the position.




The deadline for applications is 15 January 2025.




Further Information

For more details about Euroheat & Power and our ongoing projects, visit our website at www.euroheat.org.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
For one of my customer we are looking for a Data Business Analyst.

Location: Europe(100% remote)

Duration: 1+ year renewable

Description:

Work closely with the Product owner and business stakeholders to understand their needs, objectives, and challenges.
Elicit, document, and analyze business requirements, use cases, and workflows.
Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications - acceptance criteria - to designers, quality analysts and developers in an Agile setting.
Participate in system testing, user acceptance testing, and validation of implemented solutions.
Ensure that delivered solutions meet the specified requirements and are of high quality.
Participate in daily standup scrums, sprint planning meetings, sprint reviews and retrospectives.
Actively follow the progress of the sprint to confirm implementation meets the intent of acceptance criteria.

Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in requirement gathering techniques, process modeling, and documentation
Excellent verbal / written communication and interpersonal skills
Expert in Excel or Gsheets & macros
Proficiency in using project management and collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello) is preferred
Strong organizational & time management skills, with a self-starting, entrepreneurial mindset
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills
3+ years as a Business Analyst or in a related role
Experience working on Microsoft/ Azure based projects, with a focus on Fabric and Power Apps technologies
3+ years of software development experience in an Agile setting
Proven ability to translate non-technical information into a technical level of detail that developers can work with
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field (Master's degree is a plus)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

De corporate dienst Strategy & Legal speelt binnen NMBS een belangrijke rol in de opvolging van de engagementen van de NMBS als publieke dienstverlener in de verschillende kernactiviteiten van NMBS. De stafdienst vervult bovendien een centrale rol in de voorbereiding, opvolging en evaluatie van de strategie van het bedrijf.

Als Data Analyst binnen de dienst Corporate Strategy ondersteun je NMBS bij het ontwikkelen van strategische modellen, met een focus op de analyse en visualisatie van complexe datasets. Je werkt samen met verschillende afdelingen om ervoor te zorgen dat onze modellen op elkaar afgestemd en consistent zijn en je levert input voor strategische beslissingen die NMBS vormgeven.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Data Analyst heb je de volgende taken en verantwoordelijkheden:


Analyseren en interpreteren van multivariate datasets om strategische inzichten te bieden.
Uitvoeren van geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses en ondersteunen van transportanalyses.
Ontwikkelen van visualisaties en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI om resultaten helder en toegankelijk te presenteren.
Uitvoeren van analyses in Visum of bereidheid om dit softwarepakket onder de knie te krijgen.
Samenwerken met andere data-analisten en data-engineers in het bedrijf om datakwaliteit te waarborgen en coherentie te behouden in het gebruik van datasets over afdelingen heen.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je beschikt over een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bijvoorbeeld data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie). Een eerste werkervaring als data-analist is een pluspunt.


Daarnaast Beschikt Je Over Volgende Competenties


Probleemoplossend, teamgericht, en bereid om transversale samenwerking binnen de NMBS te ondersteunen. Je kan zich aanpassen in functie van de noden van het project en de betrokken interne stakeholders;
Kennis van multivariate analysetechnieken en ervaring met het beheren en analyseren van geografische data;
Je hebt een goede kennis van Python;
Bij voorkeur kennis van transportmodellering en vertrouwd met Visum of bereid om deze kennis te verwerven;
Ervaring met datavisualisatie en -analyse tools zoals Power BI;
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe data-inzichten helder te verwoorden;
Je bent creatief en probleemoplossend gericht;
Je bent leergierig en bent gemotiveerd om de verschillende activiteiten van NMBS te ontdekken.


Iedereen is uniek. We vinden het dan ook belangrijk dat je jezelf kan zijn. Want dat maakt NMBS sterker. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Kiezen voor NMBS is kiezen voor een omgeving waarin je kan bijleren en groeien. Je wordt gesteund en omringd door fijne collega’s.

Daarnaast Bieden We Je Een Loonpakket Dat Bestaat Uit


Een aantrekkelijk aangevuld met een 13de maand, onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden als een flexibel budget. Je kan daarbij kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, ...
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Flexibele werkuren, de mogelijkheid om te telewerken en 33 verlofdagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, kortingen op internationale treinreizen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, o.a. kortingen op gezinsactiviteiten en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je zal werken in Brussel, op wandelafstand van het station Brussel-Zuid én regelmatig van thuis uit.

What’s next ?

We willen dat je je goed voelt bij ons en een zo volledig mogelijk beeld krijgt van de job, je collega’s en ons bedrijf. Daarom plannen we verschillende stappen in om elkaar beter te leren kennen. Alle stappen worden zo snel mogelijk na elkaar ingepland.


Solliciteren kan via onze jobsite
We zullen je cv en motivatiebrief met veel interesse lezen en je eventueel kort opbellen om wat extra vragen te stellen en je kennis van de tweede landstaal te testen. Neem zelf ook gerust contact met ons op!
Om je een goed beeld te geven van je job, leggen we je ook een concrete eliminerende case voor.
Wanneer de case-study beantwoordt aan onze verwachtingen, nodigen we jou uit voor een (online) sollicitatiegesprek waarin je je motivatie en competenties kan tonen en waarbij wij (toekomstige manager en collega) verder kennis maken met jou. Ter voorbereiding van dit gesprek sturen we jou nog een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst.
Tijdens het gesprek maken we verder kennis en gaan we dieper in op je motivatie, competenties, ervaring én jouw visie op de functie. Natuurlijk kan jij ons tijdens dat gesprek ook al jouw vragen stellen, zodat je een duidelijk beeld krijgt van wat je toekomstige job inhoudt. Indien nodig, volgt een tweede gesprek.
Verloop alles positief? Dan doen we je een contractvoorstel.
Je start in je nieuwe job!


De voorafgaande procedure kan om gegronde redenen eventueel onderbroken of aangepast worden.

Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq : 49738

Over De Inhoud Van De Job

Bart Wuyts

M: bart.wuyts.851@belgiantrain.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Kristien Van Wichelen

M: kristien.vanwichelen@hr-rail.be

T: +32 2 525 45 62

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"
