Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
Show more
HTML:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.


Our big success so far:

  • A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
  • International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
  • Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up


As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !


What will be your tasks with us ?


You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

  • Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
  • Design of Data solutions
  • Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
  • Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
  • Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
  • Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
  • Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
  • Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations


Who are you ?


  • You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
  • You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
  • You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
  • You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
  • You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
  • Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
  • Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij geïnteresseerd in data en data-analyse? Heb jij een sterk analytisch vermogen en hou je ervan om zorgvuldig te werken? Dan ben jij misschien dé data analist die wij bij het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare Werken nodig hebben!




De functie focust enerzijds op het verzamelen, verwerken en het visualiseren van data in verband met openbare infrastructuur zoals wegen, fietspaden, bruggen, tunnels, sluizen e.a. en investeringen voor de bouw, het onderhoud, de herstelling, de aanpassing en de verwijdering van dit soort constructies.




Het gaat meer in het bijzonder om:

het verzamelen en controleren van technische en economische datasets in functie van nuttige inzichten, trends en indicatoren;
het verwerken van deze datasets, zoals het opschonen van data, het samenbrengen van datasets en het transformeren van data;
het visualiseren van data door middel van rapporten en dashboards;
het doorsturen van data naar andere applicaties en platformen voor verder gebruik;
het publiceren van rapporten en dashboards;
het beheren van rapporten en dashboards, zoals het monitoren van hun correct functioneren en van de nauwkeurigheid.




Anderzijds werkt de functie mee aan het analyseren van datasets: bouwtechnische en economische data worden hierbij gecombineerd om kengetallen en modellen te creëren zodat projecten voor het bouwen, onderhouden, herstellen, aanpassen en verwijderen van openbare infrastructuur sneller en meer accuraat kunnen geraamd worden. In deze functie is het de bedoeling om inzicht te verwerven in de beschikbare data, deze op een oordeelkundige manier samen te brengen, een ruim aanbod aan kengetallen en modellen ten behoeve van investeringsplannen te ontwikkelen en dit aanbod continu up-to-date te houden en te verbeteren.




Kom jij het team versterken?

Je beschikt minstens over een bachelordiploma.
Je hebt 1-3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie (data analyst, reporting analyst, researcher). Je hebt praktische ervaring van o.a. Microsoft Excel (Power Query – Power Pivot) en Power BI.
Je beschikt over uitstekende praktische ICT-vaardigheden.
Je gaat vlot om met digitale toepassingen (o.a. webapplicaties).
Je kan goed aan de slag met de applicaties van Microsoft Office 365.
Je hebt goede kritische analytische vaardigheden en je bent nieuwsgierig en toegewijd om problemen op te lossen en verbanden te leggen of oorzaken te zien.
Je hebt een sterke wiskundige basis (statistiek, modellering) en interesse in data-analyse en modellering.
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands.

Pluspunten

Je hebt kennis van R en/of Python of basiskennis van Matlab, VB.NET of aanverwante software)




Werken via Vlaanderen Connect

Je wordt tewerkgesteld via Vlaanderen Connect, de ICT strategische dienstverlener van de Vlaamse overheid. Bij Vlaanderen Connect. wordt je voor onbepaalde duur ter beschikking gesteld aan het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare werken, hierbij ontvang je een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Werken voor Vlaanderen Connect. betekent werken in een organisatie met boeiende en uitdagende IT functies én de mogelijkheid om mee je schouders te zetten in het uitbouwen van een digitaal en slagkrachtig Vlaanderen.




Verder biedt werken voor Vlaanderen Connect tal van voordelen. Je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je meewerken aan een digitale en slagkrachtige overheid, voor burgers en ondernemers. Daarnaast kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen Connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Aanbod

Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:

een mobiliteitsbudget
maaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)
een hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)
een groepsverzekering
mogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.




Bij Vlaanderen connect is een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé belangrijk: een werkweek van 38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12). Verder zijn er flexibele werkuren en je kan thuiswerken.




Ten slotte krijg je bij Vlaanderen connect nog verschillende andere voordelen: je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Overtuigd?!

Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatieknop!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Remote Across EU)
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: Remote across EU

Duration: 6 to 12 months

Project Start Date: ASAP

Daily Rate: 200 GBP Outside IR 35










Hands-on experience (typically approx 3- 5 years) carrying out data analytics, data mining and product analytics in complex, fast-paced environments.

Applied knowledge of data analytics and data pipelining tools and approaches across all data lifecycle stages.

Deep understanding of a few and a high-level understanding of several commonly available statistics approaches

Advanced Power BI knowledge

Advanced SQL knowledge

Advanced scripting experience in R or python.

Ability to write and maintain moderately complex data pipelines

Strong business acumen.

Customer-centric and pragmatic mindset. Focus on value delivery and swift execution, while maintaining attention to detail.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Continuous learning and improvement mindset.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
For a good client, we are looking for a BI Analyst.

As a BI Analyst, you play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the company. You'll collaborate with different departments to translate their needs into clear reports and dashboards.

In partnership with external experts, you'll ensure the data model evolves alongside our business processes. You'll also be responsible for the continuous development of the Azure data warehouse, keeping it aligned with the latest technological advancements. Clear documentation will be a critical part of your role to ensure all stakeholders can make the most of our data infrastructure.

Who are you?

You hold a degree in IT or have equivalent experience.
You are fluent in French or Dutch, with a good command of the second language.
You have excellent analytical and communication skills.
Proficiency in SQL, DAX, Power BI, and data modeling (Kimball) is essential.
You have at least 3 years of experience developing and implementing BI solutions.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, and Azure Synapse is a plus.

What does they offer you?

A competitive salary with additional benefits like a company car, meal vouchers, and group insurance.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth through various training programs and specializations.
A dynamic work environment with a family-oriented culture that emphasizes collaboration.
Flexible working hours, remote working options, and 12 extra vacation days, ensuring a healthy work-life balance.

Apply now and join the team as a BI Analyst!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Finance
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions?

Are you passionate about transforming data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions? We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst Finance to join our team and help shape the future of financial reporting and analytics. You will play a key role in collecting and analyzing data from various sources, creating interactive dashboards, and providing actionable insights to our Finance department and beyond.




As a Data Analyst in Finance, you will help the team navigate large datasets, build impactful Power BI reports, and support data-driven decision-making within the organization. You'll also act as a key liaison between the Finance department and other teams to ensure the smooth execution of digital transformation projects.




Responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:​

Design and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards, serving the needs of the Finance department, both for Financial and Business Reporting.
Collaborate with Finance teams to gather requirements and translate them into actionable Power BI development needs.
Conduct user testing to ensure reports are effective and meet end-user expectations.
Troubleshoot issues, address inquiries, and resolve technical challenges within the Finance data environment.
Document the development of data models and reports to ensure sustainability and best practices.
Lead and manage Power BI development projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with quality standards.
Promote data management best practices and foster a culture of data stewardship within the Finance team.
Drive digital transformation projects and work with the Finance department to integrate new digital tools and technologies.
Lead efforts to continually improve the Planful system and collaborate with the HQ Finance Data Analytics Team.




How does our ideal candidate look like?

Bachelor’s degree in information technology (or related field) with at least 5 years of experience in a financial data role.
Expertise in Power BI (SQL, Power Query, Data Modelling, DAX, Visualizations).
Knowledge of SAP, SAP BW, Data Bricks, Planful, and Alteryx is a plus.
Familiarity with data architecture, ETL processes, machine learning, and data science concepts.
Experience in financial analysis and modelling.
Strong problem-solving, communication, project management, and change management skills.
A critical, open mindset with a passion for driving innovation in data solutions.




Performance by design. Caring by choice.™

We want to be the place where people want to work. That’s why we particularly focus on safety, mutual respect, integrity and a performance-driven environment. To be the employer of choice, we offer:

Career Growth

We offer exciting career opportunities, whether you want to grow within your function, extend your knowledge across different levels or would like to grow into a managerial role.

Engaging Culture

We continue to build a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where diversity of thought is valued.

Well-Being

The well-being of our employees is essential to our success. We encourage a healthy lifestyle and offer amenities such as ergonomic work areas and social activities.

Generous Compensation & Benefits

We offer competitive salaries and benefits, including extra-legal benefits like insurance plans, safety incentives, vouchers, annual bonus and additional holidays.

Title: Business & Data Analyst
HTML:
About The Role

We are seeking a dynamic and ambitious Business & Data Analyst to join our team in Kontich, Antwerp. You will play a key role in guiding the growth of our portfolio companies, and collaborating with management to make smart, data-driven decisions.

This unique role at Companions promises a dynamic learning journey with a steep career path, where analytical and data-driven skills combined with a growth mindset become your winning advantage.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Continuous improvement and management support: identify opportunities for digital and IT optimization within our portfolio companies, that result in efficiency gains and data-driven decision making. Advice managers on impactful opportunities to pursue together.
  • Solution design and implementation: design targeted solutions from identified areas, taking ownership of implementation whether independently or in collaboration with IT teams. Projects may include building Power BI dashboards, ERP implementations, and data analytics projects related to contribution margin and pricing.
  • Requirements gathering: collect and document business requirements from portfolio and Companions management to ensure clarity of needs.
  • Stakeholder communication: liase effectively between stakeholders to ensure alignment on project goals.
  • Data Analysis: provide actionable insights through data analysis to support data-driven decision-making, fostering significant growth and smarter operations of our portfolio companies.

You are the perfect fit if you…

  • Hold a master's degree in Computer Science, Informatics, (Business) Engineering, or a related field, with an excellent academic track record;
  • Have at least 2 years experience in a role such as data engineer, business analyst, software/enterprise architect, or functional analyst;
  • Are passionate about data, tech and analytics;
  • Are results-driven and motivated to go the extra mile;
  • Seek a steep career path, with opportunities to learn every day;
  • Want to achieve maximum impact and are hands-on;
  • Are an out-of-the-box thinker, are bold and dare to disagree;
  • Have a passion for winning and are convinced that winning is nicer as a team;
  • Are fluent in both spoken and written Dutch and English, French is a plus.

If you don’t tick all the boxes but believe you can add value in this role, we encourage you to reach out!

You simply can’t resist our offer because it includes…

  • A high level of autonomy, trust, and responsibility;
  • The best of both worlds: immersion in an investment environment and tangible impact within various enterprises across different sectors;
  • The potential to collaborate closely with high-performing management teams, and inspiring colleagues, who consistently go the extra mile;
  • A rapidly changing and growing environment that encourages leadership, entrepreneurship and ownership;
  • Unforgettable team experiences;
  • An optimized compensation package.

About Companions

Companions is an independent investment company that was founded in 2022. We invest in small- to medium-sized enterprises, focusing on companies with an EBITDA of up to €3M across diverse sectors.

Companions is an active investor: we improve operational and commercial performance, accelerate growth through M&A, and ensure continuity. What truly sets us apart is our internal team of business analysts, accounting experts, strategic wizards and financial maestros. Our team is actively involved in driving growth within our companies.

At Companions, we embrace diversity and foster an inclusive work environment where everyone's unique perspectives and backgrounds are valued. We believe that diversity enables us to better serve our portfolio companies and partners.

Headquartered in Antwerp, our dedication to success, a hunger for learning, and a commitment to positive impact drive everything we do.

Join us at Companions and help shape the future of our portfolio companies. We can't wait to meet you!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
JUNIOR DATA ENGINEER

Ter uitbreiding van ons team zijn wij op zoek naar een Junior Data Engineer.


Wat verwachten wij van jou?

  • Je bent analytisch ingesteld en een nauwkeurige werker;
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van het MS Office pakket, voornamelijk Excel;
  • Kennis van SQL is een must;
  • Eerdere ervaring met een BI/rapporteringstool (voorkeur voor Qlik Sense/Qlikview) vormt een grote plus;
  • Enige kennis van boekhouding komt ook van pas;
  • Je bent bereid om bij te leren, zowel inhoudelijk als technisch:
  • Werking van een gerechtsdeurwaarder en boekhouding;
  • Qlik Sense software;
  • Je spreekt vlot Nederlands;
  • Je bent sterk in probleemoplossend denken;
  • Je hebt een groot gevoel voor humor.

Wat kun jij van ons verwachten?

  • Je komt terecht in een groeiende project omgeving waar er een informele cultuur heerst en waar elke stem telt;
  • Een goede work/life balance staat hoog in ons vaandel, hybride werken is vanzelfsprekend na de inwerkperiode;
  • We organiseren op regelmatige basis leuke (sportieve) challenges, cafébezoekjes, onze jaarlijkse teambuilding, en andere toffe activiteiten;
  • Ook in jouw opleiding investeren we graag!

Nieuwsgierig geworden? Stuur dan je motivatiebrief en CV naar mve@kasparsolutions.be

Title: Data Analyst Senior (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT, de l’ingénierie et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans, notamment en 2024 où les Extiens se hissent à la première place du palmarès Best Workplaces France !

Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay

HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT, de l’ingénierie et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans, notamment en 2024 où les Extiens se hissent à la première place du palmarès Best Workplaces France !

Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We evolueren naar een datagestuurde wereld met grenzeloze mogelijkheden. Bij Telenet wordt data gezien als de brandstof & motor onder de motorkap die alles in ons bedrijf kan verbeteren. Als Data Analist bij Telenet help je onze organisatie om beslissingen te nemen, niet op basis van buikgevoel, maar op basis van feiten en data. Jij bent degene die de gegevens vertaalt naar rapporten en inzichten die de ervaring van onze klanten en de prestaties van ons bedrijf helpen verbeteren.

Jouw Taken Als Data Analist


Je ontwikkelt nieuwsgierigheid en inzicht in de bedrijfscontext en -processen van je domein, waardoor je een perfecte datapartner wordt voor je stakeholders.
Je verzamelt, queryt, reinigt, valideert en manipuleert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Je definieert, bouwt en automatiseert rapporteringsdashboards die relevant zijn voor het bedrijfsonderwerp waaraan je werkt.
Je voert beschrijvende ad hoc analyses uit
Je ontwikkelt een proactief partnerschap met je stakeholders zodat onze data-assets hen zo efficiënt mogelijk kunnen helpen.
Je neemt initiatieven om de acceptatie van dataoplossingen en de dataflexibiliteit van je zakelijke belanghebbenden te verbeteren.
Je speelt een actieve rol in de gemeenschap van data-analisten binnen Telenet, door middel van het delen van sessies, inspiratie en coaching


Onze Ideale Data Analist


Gedegen kennis van een van de belangrijkste dashboard tools (Qlik Sense, Power BI of Tableau)
Goede kennis van SQL. Ervaring met Snowflake is mooi meegenomen
Je hebt relevante ervaring of een diploma en je hebt een passie voor Data
Je spreekt vloeiend Engels. Kennis van Nederlands/Frans is een pluspunt


Wat Wij Te Bieden Hebben


Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten boekt en je stempel drukt
Alle ruimte om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden
Mogelijkheid om 60% van je tijd thuis te werken (woensdag verplicht op kantoor)
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen (maaltijdcheques, gsm, mobiliteitsbudget, hospitalisatieverzekering, telefoonabonnement, kortingen op Telenet producten, thuiswerken, enz.)
Deel uitmaken van een team van jonge, dynamische, enthousiaste en resultaatgerichte dataprofielen, met leuke teamgebouwen, padelspelletjes op het terrein en af en toe een drankje na het werk

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re not just a venture builder—we’re creating purpose-driven, evidence-led organizations that set the pace for tomorrow’s most impactful industries. Our mission is simple: transform powerful ideas into high-growth, scalable startups that challenge conventions and drive positive change. Operating with an evolutionary approach, we foster flat hierarchies and decentralized decision-making, empowering each venture to evolve independently while staying aligned with our core values of agility, transparency, and purpose.




What We Do

We specialize in building ventures from the ground up, guiding concepts through rigorous validation, rapid development, and scalable growth. Our adaptive, plug-and-play infrastructure ensures that each venture starts strong, while our decentralized framework allows them to scale autonomously. With a data-driven foundation, we prioritize evidence-based strategies and integrate cutting-edge tools, from AI-driven analytics to lean, modular tech stacks, positioning each venture for long-term success.




Our Approach

At our core, we believe in building high-growth organizations that are not only innovative but also sustainable and adaptive to change. Our approach is evolutionary: we embrace continuous improvement, empower decision-making at all levels, and design our ventures to be resilient in the face of change. Each project benefits from our global network of experts, access to competitive bidding for services, and a robust framework for data-led insights, creating ventures that are agile, scalable, and poised to lead in their fields.




Why Work with Us




Purpose-Driven, Evidence-Based: We’re dedicated to building ventures that create real impact, using evidence as our guiding star for every decision.
Decentralized & Empowering: With a flat hierarchy and decentralized approach, each venture enjoys autonomy and agility while staying connected to a powerful support system.
Innovative, Growth-Focused Ecosystem: Our plug-and-play infrastructure and agile methodologies ensure that every venture can scale quickly and sustainably.
Global Reach with Local Insight: Our network of experts brings a global perspective with nuanced local insights, creating ventures that succeed on the world stage while resonating locally.




Our venture builder isn’t just a company—it’s a purpose-driven platform that fosters decentralized, high-growth startups ready to reshape industries. Join us if you’re looking to shape the future and be part of a team that builds the organizations of tomorrow.




Global Benefits

Work Flexibility & Environment

Remote/Hybrid Work Options: Flexibility to work from home or the office, based on role and location.
Flexible Working Hours: Set your own schedule with core working hours.
International Working Environment: Collaborate with diverse teams from around the world.
Office Environment: Modern and well-equipped office space to enhance productivity.

Compensation & Financial Benefits

Competitive Salary & Benefits Package: Salary and benefits tailored to your location and experience.
Quarterly Bonus: Additional cash bonus available when the company achieves record-breaking revenue.
Tax Optimization Benefits: Options for tax-efficient compensation.

Health & Well-being

Mental Health Support: Access to OpenUp for mental health resources and support, available to everyone.
Flexible Health Benefits: Customize health benefits to best meet your needs.

Learning & Development

Professional Development Programs: Opportunities for continuous growth and upskilling.
Learning and Development Budget: Dedicated funds to pursue courses, certifications, or workshops.
Global L&D Training: Access to training sessions organized by the global Learning & Development team.
Coaching Sessions: Personalized coaching to support your career and personal growth.
Language Classes: Language learning options to support international collaboration.

Team Building & Culture

Company Retreats and Team Building Days: Regular events to build strong connections with colleagues.
Team Trip Budget: Allocated budget for team trips to foster stronger team dynamics.
Company Anniversary Celebrations: Join in celebrating milestones and achievements together.




Ideawise is an Equal Opportunity Employer

It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, marital or parental status, or religion.




We want to ensure that all applicants have a fair and equal chance, so we’re using a TestGorilla assessment (https://www.testgorilla.com). This minimizes unconscious bias in our hiring process. Successful candidates will be invited to a job interview.




Ready to join our team?

Start by clicking the link below. https://app.testgorilla.com/s/3lbgwsqn

Title: Bi Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.




SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis




Qualifications:

You hold a master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.




We offer:

A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group




If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium. Let's Tech Together!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description du poste et Missions

Les raisons de rejoindre AFD.Tech part of Accenture, et tous nos avantages :


Bénéficiez d’un accompagnement personnalisé dès votre 1er jour d’arrivée par nos Talent Managers et votre futur Manager (accueil au siège d’Accenture ou en agence en régions, journée d’onboarding, petit-déjeuner convivial)
Développez vos compétences techniques, fonctionnelles ou de management, grâce au catalogue de formations Accenture et à l’aide de nos Practice Managers et de leurs communautés
Faîtes évoluer votre carrière grâce à notre politique de mobilité
Une team E-sports engagée sur League Of Legend en Ligue Corpo Riot X Vitality, coachée par Yellowstar
Vivez des expériences hors du commun avec des événements réguliers


Nos recrutements sont fondés sur les compétences, sans distinction d’origine, d’âge, ou de genre et tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

A très bientôt chez AFD.Tech part of Accenture !

Profil recherché

Responsabilités :


Collecte et préparation des données
Collecter, nettoyer et structurer les données issues de différentes sources (bases de données internes, API, fichiers externes, etc.).
Vérifier la qualité des données et effectuer des corrections si nécessaire.
Créer et maintenir des pipelines de données pour garantir la disponibilité des données nécessaires à l’analyse.
Analyse des données
Analyser les données à l’aide d’outils statistiques et de techniques de modélisation (régressions, clustering, séries temporelles, etc.).
Identifier des tendances, des patterns, et des insights utiles pour améliorer la prise de décision.
Fournir des recommandations basées sur les résultats des analyses.
Visualisation des données
Concevoir des rapports et des tableaux de bord interactifs et clairs, en utilisant des outils comme Power BI, Tableau, ou Excel.
Communiquer les résultats de manière compréhensible pour les non-spécialistes, avec des visualisations adaptées.
Collaboration et communication
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers (marketing, finance, opération, etc.) pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données.
Présenter les résultats des analyses aux équipes et à la direction.
Accompagner les équipes dans l’interprétation des données et la mise en œuvre des recommandations.
Veille technologique et amélioration continue
Suivre les évolutions technologiques et méthodologiques dans le domaine de la data science et de l’analyse de données.
Proposer des améliorations ou de nouvelles approches pour optimiser les processus de collecte et d’analyse de données.


Compétences requises :


Compétences techniques :
Maîtrise des outils d’analyse de données (Excel, SQL, Python, R, etc.).
Connaissance des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Solides connaissances en statistiques et en modélisation de données.
Compréhension des bases de données relationnelles et non relationnelles.
Compétences analytiques :
Capacité à analyser et à interpréter des données complexes.
Aptitude à identifier des tendances et à en tirer des conclusions pertinentes.
Rigueur et précision dans le traitement des données.
Compétences interpersonnelles :
Bonnes capacités de communication pour présenter des résultats à des non-experts.
Esprit d’équipe et capacité à collaborer avec différentes parties prenantes.
Sens de l’écoute et capacité à comprendre les besoins métiers.


Informations utiles


Localisation Bruxelles, Belgique - pas de déplacement
Contrat CDI
Salaire 38000,00 à 50000,00 EUR par an
Niveau de qualification Ingénieur/Cadre/Bac +5
Expérience 1 à 7 ans
Modalités de travail Temps complet
Fonction Informatique - Systèmes d'Information
Secteur Secteur informatique/ESN
Télétravail Partiel


Formation et expériences :


Formation Bac +5 en Data Science, Informatique, Mathématiques, Statistiques, ou domaine équivalent.
Expérience : 2 ans d'éxpériences minimum
Langues : Français/ Néerlandais et Anglais


Rémunération : À définir selon l’expérience et le profil.

Qui sommes nous ?

AFD.TECH Paris


France


AFD.TECH part of Accenture, spécialiste du conseil en IT et Télécommunications, a rejoint le groupe Accenture en 2022. Accenture est le Leader mondial des services aux entreprises et administrations, avec une expertise de pointe dans les domaines du numérique, du cloud, et de la sécurité. C’est aussi une communauté de plus de 730 000 talents et une mission commune : réaliser la promesse technologique alliée à l’ingéniosité humaine.

En 2024, AFD.Tech, filiale d’Accenture, regroupe plus de 2000 talents répartis dans 3 pays (France, Belgique et Maroc), pour un chiffre d’affaires annuel de plus de 130M€.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Title : Senior Data Analyst




Location : Remote in EU




Working hours : 10:00CET-18:30 CET




I am seeking a Senior Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in shaping how data drives customer success. This position offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate across teams, and make a real impact on product development and customer experience.




About the Role

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will build and enhance data visualizations, empower internal teams and customers with actionable insights, and contribute to the development of a robust reporting suite. Collaborating with product, engineering, and customer success teams, your work will directly influence customer outcomes and business growth.




What You'll Do

Your key responsibilities will include:

Data Visualization: Build and expand embedded reporting capabilities using tools like Looker, extending the underlying LookML data model to create meaningful insights.
Data Quality and Structure: Collaborate with product and engineering teams to improve data pipelines and optimize data structure feeding into the reporting platform.
Process Automation: Productionize reporting workflows, including version control, testing, and code deployment.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Prioritize and manage product and customer requests, offering realistic timelines and regular progress updates.
Training and Enablement: Deliver training sessions for internal teams and customers, ensuring they can maximize the value of the reporting suite.




What We're Looking For




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent business experience in Data Analytics or related field.
4+ years of experience in an analytics role.
Expertise in creating data visualizations and complex data models using tools like Looker or Power BI.
Experience in Looker
Proficiency in SQL, with a strong preference for MySQL experience.
Attention to detail and confidence with stakeholders across diverse teams.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with data warehousing architecture and data modelling best practices.
Familiarity with modern data warehouses (e.g., Redshift).
Exposure to AWS services and ETL processes.
Experience in creating and maintaining customer-facing reporting suites.




What We Offer

This is a dynamic role where you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of data analytics within the organization. Whether you prefer working remotely or from one of our corporate locations, we provide flexibility to help you thrive.

Take the lead in advancing data-driven decision-making, optimizing processes, and delivering insights that make a difference.




Apply now and bring your data expertise to a growing and impactful team!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Make your positive impact on the future of gaming

As the gaming industry undergoes rapid transformation, from the rise of free-to-play to the emergence of play-to-earn games and GameFi, Nyan Heroes stands at the vanguard of this revolution. With a focus on crafting a AAA multiplayer shooter set to launch its alpha in late 2024, we're committed to pushing the envelope.




By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Nyan Heroes aims to involve and empower players equitably in all aspects of the game and its economy. Our mission is to set the gold standard for fair, sustainable game development in the GameFi space, leading the industry's advancement technologically, ethically, and inspirationally.




About the role:

We are seeking to hire a Data Analyst who shall help create and define the vision for product-wide analysis and interpretation of data to discover compelling and actionable business insights.




They will create efficient and effective queries that provide timely and accurate reports resulting in maximising databases with a view to current and future scaling.




In addition, they will collaborate with cross-discipline teams from marketing, design, production, engineering and our creative director, delivering insightful, recommendations that result in effective business action plans, guided by senior leadership.




What you’ll be doing:




Performance and Quality Assurance:

Monitor and improve the reliability, efficiency, and quality of data systems.
Implement data validation and error-handling processes to ensure data accuracy.




Collaboration and Support:

Work with data scientists, analysts, and business teams to understand data requirements.
Provide support for data-related issues and troubleshooting.




Security and Compliance:

Ensure data systems comply with relevant data privacy and security regulations.
Implement access controls and encryption to protect sensitive data.




Data Pipeline Development:

Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from various sources.
Ensure pipelines are optimised for performance and cost-effectiveness.




Data Integration:

Integrate diverse data sources (e.g., APIs, databases, streaming platforms) into unified data systems.
Implement data transformation and cleansing processes.




Data Infrastructure Management:

Set up and manage databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Optimise storage solutions for scalability and efficiency.







About you:

5+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst/Data Scientist, or Business/Product Analyst within the games industry
Experience supporting a live service game, from development planning to delivery of content and features post-launch
At least 1 shipped AAA game on console, or PC.
Professional experience with Elasticsearch scripted queries
Professional experience with Azure Analytics/Data and queries
Experience with Hadoop and modern descendants.
Professionally skilled in SQL and traditional structured databases
Proficiency in Python or similar scripting tools to aggregate, normalize and filter large datasets
A/B Testing: experience in conducting controlled experiments to test the effectiveness of different marketing strategies or content and optimize them.
Ability to collect, interpret, and analyse data to gain insights into consumer behaviour, trends, and campaign performance.
Comfortable with and confident in traversing unexplored game design territory, helping refine ideas into shippable features

Nice to have: Experience with first, or third-person shooters is desirable




FAQs

Location: From anywhere in the world. We are globally remote.
Equity/tokens available: Yes
Start date: ASAP




About Nyan Heroes

We are a well-funded gaming studio seeking talented, motivated team members to help build an industry-defining title on PC from the ground up. We are gamers ourselves and believe in allowing talented people to express their own creative freedom. We are looking for many experienced industry heroes to help build and craft an AAA-rated game with a unique innovative twist on the standard formula.




We currently have more than 45+ talented Nyan members across the world with two-thirds of our team coming from AAA-rated gaming studios and titles.




In addition to reshaping the future of gaming, we are committed to creating the top gaming studio culture founded on kindness and our love of cats! Nyan Heroes has already donated $250,000 from its first NFT sale towards our mission of saving 1 billion cats.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Job Description

Als toonaangevend telecommunicatie- en entertainmentbedrijf heeft Telenet meer dan 7 miljoen klantinteracties, 100 interne Telenet- en BASE-vestigingen in België en meer dan 1500 medewerkers die in een klantgerichte functie werken. Hierdoor beschikken we over een zeer diverse databeschikbaarheid binnen de hele organisatie (bv. klant-, product- en interactiedata).

Binnen Customer Operations zijn we op zoek naar een ambitieuze Data Analyst die fulltime onze Operations Tribes voedt met data. In deze rol maak je deel uit van ons Customer Operations Data Steering Team. Daar zullen we data gebruiken om onze Telenet, BASE & back-office collega's te ondersteunen, te inspireren en uit te nodigen met inzichten, duidelijk verstaanbare rapportering en aanbevelingen.

De belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheid van ons team is om Customer Operations bij te staan in de plannen en ambities richting interne en externe stakeholders. Dit doen we door rust, duidelijkheid en voorspelbaarheid te integreren met behulp van data.

Jouw Verantwoordelijkheden Als Data Analyst

  • Drijft de analyse van grotere data en inzichten, onderwerpen en tracks over de 6 verschillende Operations Tribes (Telenet, BASE, Back Office, Billing, Customer Innovation & Platform, Steering);
  • Begrijpt de bedrijfsvraag (-vragen) en vertaalt deze naar data vereisten;
  • Creëert de nodige data queries om ervoor te zorgen dat de gegevens op de meest correcte manier worden verzameld om analyses uit te voeren;
  • Vertaalt data analyse in een visueel aantrekkelijk PowerPoint-deck dat een hoog niveau van data storytelling heeft;
  • Bepaalt de beste visualisaties en bouwt vervolgens kwalitatieve rapporten;
  • Presenteert inzichten aan het Operations management om ervoor te zorgen dat de volledige waarde van de analyse wordt vastgelegd.

Wat We Te Bieden Hebben

  • Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf dat volop in je investeert en je werkomgeving optimaal aanpast aan wat jij nodig hebt. Zo kun je je ontwikkelen en een goede balans tussen werk en privé behouden. Wat gooien we nog meer in de strijd?
  • Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om na een tijdje op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
  • Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten boekt en je stempel drukt.
  • Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van voordelen (bv. thuiswerk, maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, telefoonabonnement, kortingen op Telenet producten, smartphone, mobiliteitsbudget ...).
  • Het fijne gezelschap van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.

Onze Ideale Data Insights Analyst

  • Master in Business Engineering, Toegepaste Economie, Computerwetenschappen, Informatiemanagement... of gelijkwaardig door ervaring;
  • Ervaring in Telecom, Entertainment, Consulting of gelijkaardige industrieën is een pluspunt;
  • Ervaring in data analyse en in staat zijn om zelf data te capteren;
  • Kennis van een rapportagetool is een pluspunt;
  • Sterk inzicht in kwantitatieve analyse en gestructureerde probleemoplossing;
  • Je kan een analyse end-to-end coördineren met het te bekomen resultaat voor ogen, rekeninghoudend met veelvoorkomende valkuilen;
  • Uitstekende presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden. Jij kan belangrijke stakeholders overtuigen;
  • Een goede kennis van het Nederlands en Engels is essentieel.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
I am currently searching for an experience Business Intelligence Specialist for a valued client of mine based with Brussels.




In this role, you will develop and deliver data-driven insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. As a BI Specialist, you will collaborate with various departments, creating impactful reports and dashboards that enable efficient data analysis and help drive business success.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics.
Gather, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency.
Optimize data visualization and reporting processes to improve efficiency.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to inform decision-making and improve business performance.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Specialist (freelance experience preferred).
Strong knowledge of BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Proficiency in SQL and data modeling, with experience in ETL processes.
Familiarity with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.




Fluent in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible work arrangements with remote work options.
Opportunity to work on diverse projects in a supportive and innovative team.
Access to cutting-edge tools and data technologies.




If you are interested in this role, Please Apply Now!

Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
About The Job

Joining Capgemini Engineering means becoming part of a global organization that drives innovation and growth. With over 55 years of experience, a presence in 30 countries, and more than 55 000 employees, we offer an environment where you can elevate your career to new heights.

And that’s not all! As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in developing, designing cutting-edge technological solutions, delivering high-quality engineering services. Together with your team, you will complete life cycle data handling from collection to cleaning, visualization and information communication to stakeholders both peers and management in telecommunication, pharma, and more industries!

Capgemini Engineering: Get The Future You Want

Your Responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for:


Collaborating with diverse teams to develop and implement databases for efficient storage and management of data.
Actively contributing to the success of projects by programming and scripting skills to collect and preprocess raw data sources.
Building strong, sustainable relationships to develop and implement databases for efficient storage and management of data.
Use of statistical methods to analyze and generate useful insight from data.
Build and train mathematical models for forecasting and classification analysis.
Propose innovative ways to answer complex engineering challenges.


Your Profile

At Capgemini Engineering, We’re Looking For Someone Who


Has a passion for mathematical and statistical apparatus.
Has good theoretical & practical knowledge in statistics.
Brings at least 3 years of experience in analytics related activities.
Knowledge and understanding of programming languages like R, Python, MATLAB.
Language Skills: Fluent in English
Bachelor’s, master’s degree or PhD in applied Physics, Mathematics, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.


Success In This Role Often Comes Down To

Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.

Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.

Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.

Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.

What We Offer

At Capgemini Engineering, we offer more than just a job:


A full-time position with attractive secondary benefits.
A competitive salary package, including a company car, laptop, meal vouchers, bonus system, and more.
Training and development: Access to courses and certifications to enhance your skills.
Flexibility: A hybrid work model that supports work-life balance.
Regular company outings and events to celebrate success together.


Recruitment Process

Our Recruitment Process Includes The Following Steps


A first screening via phone.
An initial interview with a Talent Acquisition Professional.
A discussion with one of our People Managers to ensure the right fit.
A meeting with our Technical Colleagues to assess your skills and experience.


Ready for the next step? Apply now and explore how your future could look at Capgemini Engineering!

Title: Strategic Insights Analyst
Description:
ECO3 is a leading global supplier of prepress systems to the printing industry. Commercial, newspaper and packaging printers rely on us for the most extensive range of integrated solutions, from printing plates and computer-to-plate systems over workflow and print management software to pressroom chemicals. Our solutions are designed to deliver higher productivity, lower costs and greener outcomes at every stage of the print process.




We are a company with a positive mindset and a ‘can do’ attitude, continuously striving for excellence. ECO3 is headquartered in Belgium with production centers in Germany, Brazil and China. We are commercially active worldwide through sales organizations and dealers in more than 30 countries.




You print. We care.




We are seeking a Strategic Insights Analyst, a high-potential professional who will work closely with senior management and the leadership team. This role is designed for someone eager to contribute to strategic initiatives that drive growth and operational excellence within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with senior managers and the management team on key strategic projects, focusing on transformation and restructuring efforts to enhance operational effectiveness and long-term value.
Conduct thorough analyses to support decision-making processes, identifying opportunities for improvement and innovation in business operations.
Assist in project management activities, ensuring that timelines, budgets, and objectives are met through effective coordination and collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Participate in brainstorming sessions and workshops, contributing fresh ideas and insights that align with the company’s growth strategies.
Support the implementation of change management initiatives, helping teams adapt to new processes and systems introduced during transformation projects.
Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for senior leadership, summarizing findings, recommendations, and project updates.
Foster a collaborative team environment, building strong relationships across departments and promoting a culture of continuous improvement.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in transformation and restructuring, bringing innovative ideas to the team.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
2+ years of professional experience in consulting or industry, with a focus on operations, restructuring, or strategic initiatives.
Demonstrated experience in project management and teamwork, with a track record of successful collaboration in dynamic environments.
Strong analytical skills with a results-oriented mindset and the ability to approach complex problems logically.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively conveying ideas and insights to diverse audiences.
A well-developed sense of responsibility and a strong commitment to achieving high-quality outcomes.
A passion for driving growth and delivering exceptional change within organizations.
An entrepreneurial spirit, characterized by initiative, creativity, and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities.




Key Competencies:

Strategic thinking and the ability to analyze and synthesize complex information.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with a focus on building productive relationships.
Excellent organizational skills, capable of managing multiple projects and priorities effectively.
High levels of accountability, with a commitment to delivering results and making a positive impact.




Why Join Us? As a Strategic Insights Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work closely with senior leaders on high-impact projects that shape the future of our organization. This role offers a unique chance to develop your career in a supportive environment where your contributions will be valued and recognized. If you are passionate about driving change and looking to make a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Company Description

We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a member of Netcompany Group A/S, and a leading European IT Solutions and Services company with a strong international presence and expertise, dedicated to responsible digitalisation. We offer innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of public and private organizations, while being a key player in the EU Institutions for the past 30 years. We hold an outstanding record of 500+ organizations in 70+ countries, that have chosen our solutions and services, to fulfil their business needs. Our team of 3500+ professionals is our driving force and our most valuable asset.

Job Description

Are you ready to discover the role of a Power BI Specialist in Netcompany-Intrasoft?

As a Power BI Specialist You Will


Build and maintain business intelligence data models and dashboards for our IT applications, according to the priorities given by project managers.
Integrate data from multiple sources.
Create visuals for workflow, distribution, and consumption using Power BI tools.
Build new BI dashboards based on change requests.
Provide evaluative and corrective maintenance to existing BI dashboards.
Address requests received via the Change Advisory Board & Follow the schedule agreed upon with IT unit officials.


Qualifications

What would make you a fit for the role:


Master’s degree with a minimum of 10 years of experience, or a Bachelor’s degree with at least 14 years of experience.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Power BI, Kibana, QuickSight, DAX Query, SQL, Python, M Query, Power Query).
Experience in Power BI data modeling and ETL, both on-premises and in the cloud.
Experience in Power BI report performance optimization (e.g., query folding, visual optimization, data model minimization).
Familiarity with Power BI administration, including gateways, user/report access, and workspaces.
Knowledge in integrating various data sources into Power BI (e.g., relational databases, JSON, website analytics).
Experience with GitLab or similar version control tools.
Strong analytical skills to translate complex data into actionable visualizations.


Additional Information

Being a part of the Netcompany-Ιntrasoft team, you will be provided with:


The opportunity to work in a modern environment.
A competitive compensation & benefits package
Hospitalization plan
Hybrid working model
Meal and commuting allowance
Well-being activities (on premises)
Continuous learning opportunities using the most modern methods (unlimited access to Udemy for Business, ad-hoc trainings)
A personalized development plan for targeted career growth


If you are looking forward to be part of a diverse environment, and have the opportunity to work alongside well-experienced professionals, on challenging, large-scale projects that directly impact millions of citizens around the globe, then this is the place to be!

By joining Netcompany – Intrasoft Belgium, you will be an integral part of a distinguished team of 600+ tech enthusiasts working for international projects, primarily within the European Institutions market. Whether you're collaborating with clients on their premises or harnessing the power of cutting-edge technologies at our own facilities, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of digital services in an environment that values your ideas and fosters your growth.

Our culture

Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://netcompany.com/careers/greece/our-values/

#BePartOfSomethingGreat!

Please submit your CV in English. All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Should you be invited for an interview and be considered suitable candidates for the EU project at the first stage, we inform you that your CV may be forwarded to the relevant European Organization or third companies - consortium members participating in the specific EU project together with NETCOMPANY INTRASOFT for evaluation.

We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. As part of the Netcompany-Intrasoft culture, we respect human rights and focus on creating a positive workplace, where all employees are valued, and where diversity and inclusion are a vital part of our our everyday working experience.

Title: Consultant Power BI
Description:
Mission:




Notre client recherche un Power BI Expert pour renforcer son équipe IT et participer activement au développement du centre de compétence Power BI. Le rôle consiste à collaborer étroitement avec les départements métiers afin d’améliorer les modèles de données, optimiser les flux de données et gérer les rapports au sein de l'entreprise. Vous serez en charge de l’adaptation de l’architecture des systèmes Power BI en fonction des exigences corporate et des besoins spécifiques des différents départements (Ressources Humaines, Finance, Marketing, etc.).

Responsabilités principales :

Développement et amélioration des modèles de données et des flux de données sur Power BI
Gestion des licences et déploiement du service Power BI dans de nouveaux départements
Création de rapports et tableaux de bord pour le management des capacités, les finances, etc.
Adaptation de l’architecture et de l’infrastructure Power BI en fonction des contraintes de l’entreprise
Collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins et y répondre de manière optimale

Profil recherché :

Minimum 3 ans d'expérience dans l'utilisation et le développement avec Power BI
La gestion de projet est un plus
Solides compétences en gestion de données et en création de rapports
Capacité à travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers pour répondre à leurs besoins spécifiques
Bonnes compétences en communication et en gestion des priorités

Conditions :

Poste basé en présentiel avec 1 jour de télétravail par semaine possible
Durée : 12 mois
Début souhaité : dès que possible, début 2025




Si vous êtes passionné par Power BI et souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dynamique pour un projet stratégique, n'hésitez pas à postuler !

Title: Performance & Data Analyst F/M
Description:
Position description

Business unit

Operations, Data & IT - Operations, Client Servicing & Reporting

Job title

Performance & Data Analyst F/M

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return , asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

As a Performance & Data Analyst in our Performance Measurement team at Candriam, you are joining a global multi-specialist asset management firm renowned for its commitment to sustainable and responsible investments.

In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our reporting data, essential for both external client reports and consumption by internal clients like the RFP team and Front Office.

Your work will encompass a broad spectrum of portfolio data relevant to our diverse investment solutions, including performance metrics, asset allocations, and holdings information. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in managing the performance engine's parameterization, overseeing the data flow process, and enhancing data quality.

This role is integral to feeding accurate and reliable data into our central data lake, supporting strategic decision-making and analysis across the company.

It requires a dedication to operational excellence and a proactive approach to developing your technical skills within the evolving landscape of sustainable asset management.

Responsabilities


You collect data from different sources and integrate it into the performance calculation tool
You maintain the set-up of the production scope
You manage the output of performance results to serve all business needs
You actively contribute to specific projects on creating value added services for internal and external clients
You provide innovative insight in data related to regulatory and business challenges
You assess, design and implement solutions in data management, data governance and data quality
You analyze systems and processes to make them more efficient and to make data delivery faster and more accurate.



Profile


You hold a Master in finance, economics or you are preferably performance measurement and GIPS
You have excellent reporting & data management skills
A previous experience with a performance analysis tool is an asset (Statpro, Bisam, Factset,..)
You have an analytical mind that is capable of creative and solution-oriented thinking in a continuous search for improvement
You are efficient and work in a structured and methodical way
You have an eye for detail, you are meticulous and pragmatic
You are a motivated person that can work in a dynamical environment and face challenges
You master MS Excel; Python skills required. knowledge of MS Access, VBA and SQL is an asset, Power BI skills are also a plus
You are fluent in English, French or Dutch





Job location


Candidate criteria

Education


Master's Degree I / Bac+4



Minimum Level Of Experience Required

6-10 years

Languages


English (C1 - Fluent)
French (C1 - Fluent)

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Specialist with a focus on Power BI to help drive our organization’s data initiatives. In this role, you’ll play a pivotal part in enhancing our data capabilities, supporting cross-departmental efforts, and ensuring our data architecture aligns with corporate strategies. This opportunity offers a dynamic, collaborative work environment.




🤖 Responsabilities and Requirements:

Contribute to the growth of the Power BI Competence Center (PBI) within the IT department in close cooperation with business stakeholders.
Improve data models and data flows to optimize efficiency and reliability.
Adapt and enhance architecture and infrastructure to align with corporate constraints.
Oversee Power BI license management to ensure optimal usage and compliance.
Develop impactful reports for capacity management, finance, and other key functions.
Expand Power BI usage to additional departments, including HR, Finance, and Marketing.
Support the deployment of Power BI projects across teams, bringing data insights to life.




🛠️ Technical Requirements:

3+ years working with Power BI in a professional environment. A basic understanding of project management is a plus.
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data flow optimization, and reporting.
Proficiency with Power BI, including report creation and system management.
Fluency in English, French




➕ Plus:

Dutch is advantageous for collaboration across teams.




🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.




📜 Permanent contract or Freelancing
🚗 Company car
🏥 Health Insurance with DKV
🍽️ Meal voucher
🏠💼 Hybrid working: 1 days per week home office




Don't know us yet? Discover us!!




Home - Capitole Consulting







Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩
