  • Improve data models and data flows to optimize efficiency and reliability.
  • Adapt and enhance architecture and infrastructure to align with corporate constraints.
  • Oversee Power BI license management to ensure optimal usage and compliance.
  • Develop impactful reports for capacity management, finance, and other key functions.
  • Expand Power BI usage to additional departments, including HR, Finance, and Marketing.
  • Support the deployment of Power BI projects across teams, bringing data insights to life.


🛠️ Technical Requirements:

  • 3+ years working with Power BI in a professional environment. A basic understanding of project management is a plus.
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling, data flow optimization, and reporting.
  • Proficiency with Power BI, including report creation and system management.
  • Fluency in English, French


➕ Plus:

  • Dutch is advantageous for collaboration across teams.


🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.


  • 📜 Permanent contract or Freelancing
  • 🚗 Company car
  • 🏥 Health Insurance with DKV
  • 🍽️ Meal voucher
  • 🏠💼 Hybrid working: 1 days per week home office


Don't know us yet? Discover us!!


Home - Capitole Consulting



Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
Job Description

At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.




Your job responsibilities:




Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.




Your Requirements:




Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.




We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Title: Job | Data Analyst Technology | Bruxelles
Description:
Description

Le Corporate Office de CTO est responsable de l’orientation stratégique et du support opérationnel de toutes les divisions Technology au sein du groupe Belfius.

Au sein du Corporate Office de CTO, nous sommes à la recherche d’un analyste data qui peut améliorer le niveau du reporting corporate. Grâce à votre traitement & analyse des données, à votre contrôle minutieux, à votre suivi des KPI et à vos tableaux de bord clairs, la direction de Technology peut évaluer les résultats effectivement et prendre plus rapidement de meilleures décisions.

Votre job en deux mots

Vous faites partie d’une équipe dynamique qui travaille sur des sujets variés tels que HR, finance, planning, communication, entreprise, architecture IT, etc. Votre rôle consiste à concevoir, développer et gérer des reportings & tableaux de bord dans PowerBI portant sur ces différents thèmes.

En étroite collaboration avec les directeurs et les équipes, vous veillez à un apport correct des données et vous développez des reportings globaux, des tableaux de bord KPI et des analyses visant à soutenir la technologie Operations et la stratégie.

Vous veillez à un apport correct des données et vous développez des reportings globaux & des tableaux de bord KPI. En outre, vous pouvez vous épanouir et enrichir vos connaissances en soutenant les différentes équipes au sein de Technology, qui utilisent le reporting & les tableaux de bord, et en participant à la réflexion sur la manière de pouvoir les améliorer.

Une journée de travail typique se présente comme suit :


Vous discutez avec différentes équipes de Belfius Technology afin de comprendre les informations dont elles ont besoin et vous effectuez une analyse fonctionnelle.
Vous synthétisez les sources de données et les exigences de reporting en un modèle de données qui soutient le reporting requis.
Vous collectez et analysez les données.
Vous créez des customized BI reportings et des tableaux de bord dans PowerBI.
Vous êtes responsable du traitement et du téléchargement des données.



Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare

Chez nous, vous pouvez vous distinguer et révéler le meilleur de vous-même si vous répondez aux critères suivants :


Vous êtes passionné par la technologie, l’innovation et/ou les données et vous êtes prêt à mettre vos connaissances en pratique dans le monde bancaire et des assurances.
Vous possédez un diplôme de bachelier ou de master, de préférence en Informatique, Engineering, Sciences ou une orientation économique et/ou vous avez déjà une expérience IT.
Vous avez au minimum 2 ans d’expérience avérée dans l’analyse des données, le modelage des données et la création de tableaux de bord dans PowerBI.
Vous avez une bonne dose de curiosité dans le domaine des analyses, des chiffres et de l’optimalisation des processus.
Vous maîtrisez Excel tout en suivant de près comment nous pouvons travailler encore plus efficacement à l’aide des analyses des données/BI.
Vous avez une bonne connaissance du français ou du néerlandais et de l’anglais.



Vous marquerez encore plus de points si :


Vous avez de l’expérience en analyse fonctionnelle ou business.
Vous avez de l’expérience dans le levelling up d’Excel en PowerQuery et/ou PowerBI.
Vous avez un esprit axé sur l’optimalisation, ce qui vous permet de discuter avec vos collègues, notamment sur la manière de les aider à effectuer leur tâche plus efficacement et effectivement.



Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :


Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius.
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé.
Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier.
Show more

  • Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
  • Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius.
  • Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé.
  • Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier.

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

ALTER SOLUTIONS is a consulting and technology expertise company founded in 2006. Our mission is to support our clients in their digital transformation challenges. Our services are structured around the following areas of expertise:


Software Delivery
Infrastructure & Cloud Computing
Agile IT Performance
Business Performance


Our Success Relies On The Development And Fulfillment Of Each Employee, So We Place Great Importance On Providing The Best Possible Working Conditions


Remote work available for a large part of our projects
A Flex Office work environment to promote communication and collaboration
Expert communities to share and disseminate skills within the group
Close project management and HR support
Annual training and certification opportunities
Recognition of our consultants' expertise paths
Strong openness to occasional or long-term international mobility
Intrapreneurship opportunities


Job Description

Job Description:

We are currently looking for a Functional Data Analyst to work with one of our clients in the energy sector. The successful candidate will join the "Data" team, which manages data for both Downstream and Upstream activities, with a focus on Forecasting. In this role, you will be responsible for data management, ensuring high-performing forecasting processes, and bridging the gap between business and IT teams.

Key Responsibilities


Write functional specifications (PBI, use cases, process design)
Develop and execute test cases, including integration testing
Serve as a liaison between business and development teams
Assist with business acceptance testing
Monitor production and perform maintenance
Ensure timely deliveries and adherence to deadlines


Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:


Proven experience in Data Management
Knowledge of the energy market industry
Technical expertise in SQL and Python
Experience with API development and cloud environments (AWS)
Familiarity with tools like Databricks, PySpark, Insomnia, and Postman
Experience in functional database design and data warehousing


Additional Information: This project is focused on supporting and securing the business processes related to confirmed sales positions in gas and power markets. The service is carried out within the Downstream & Upstream Delivery Centers, with a focus on the LSS departments of Brussels but may extend to various European countries.

Languages

English is required; proficiency in French is a strong plus.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant (NL + ENG)
Description:
Founded in 2020 in Belgium, ATS4IT is part of the Moongy Group, established to strengthen agap2IT’s presence in Europe.

Since 2021 we expanded further with the opening of our Danish branch in Copenhagen, and our Spanish brand in Madrid, reinforcing our commitment to being a key player in the European technology landscape.

Proximity, transparency, and collaboration define our approach at ATS. We aim to be your trusted partner and the first choice for your technological challenges

Position: Business Intelligence Consultant

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Hybrid: 2-3 times a week on the client´s office

Candidates must possess European nationality or a valid work permit for Belgium

Mandatory Languages: One of the national languages (Dutch and French) must be the mother tongue, and the other language must be understood and readable

Job Description:

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Consultant to guide organizations in leveraging data to make strategic decisions. This role involves designing dashboards, analyzing trends, and creating actionable reports.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements;
Design and develop BI solutions, including dashboards and data models;
Perform data analysis to identify key performance insights;
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across BI tools;
Train users on BI tools and data interpretation.



Requirements:


Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4-6 years of experience in Business Intelligence
Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.);
Strong knowledge of SQL and data modeling techniques;
Ability to understand and interpret business needs;
Experience with ETL processes and data integration;



What We Offer


DKV Insurance
Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
Continuous and personalized career progression support
Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.



At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

  • 4-6 years of experience in Business Intelligence
  • Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc.);
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and data modeling techniques;
  • Ability to understand and interpret business needs;
  • Experience with ETL processes and data integration;


What We Offer

  • DKV Insurance
  • Free training (technical, behavioral, language) and certifications
  • Continuous and personalized career progression support
  • Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies
  • Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.


At ATS4IT, part of the agap2IT family, we promote equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, based solely on merit.

Join us and be part of the future!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Als data analist ben je dé expert in het beheren van onze bedrijfsdata.

Met jouw kennis zorg je ervoor dat systemen zoals SAP, C4C, Hubspot en onze webshop perfect samenwerken.




Zo maak jij het verschil in onze dagelijkse werking!




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden :

Data beheren: je zorgt voor correcte klant- en productdata in SAP en ons CRM-systeem (C4C).
Rapportages maken: je ontwikkelt datarapporten en lijsten om processen te monitoren en te optimaliseren.
Processen verbeteren: je werkt samen met collega’s en het hoofdkantoor om workflows te documenteren en te optimaliseren.
Datastromen beheren: je zorgt voor een foutloze koppeling tussen systemen zoals onze webshop en Hubspot.
Collega’s trainen: je leert je collega’s slim en efficiënt gebruik te maken van het CRM-systeem.
Privacy garanderen: je bewaakt de naleving van GDPR-richtlijnen en voert databeveiligingsaudits uit.




Wat wij in jou zoeken :

Je behaalde een bachelor in bedrijfskunde, communicatie of informatica.
Je hebt ervaring met ERP- en CRM-systemen (SAP-kennis is een pluspunt).
Je bent analytisch en detailgericht, met een proactieve houding.
Je beschikt over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en houdt ervan om kennis te delen.
Heb je kennis van GDPR-compliance en databeveiliging, dan heb je een extra troef.




Wat jij van ons mag verwachten :

Een stabiele toekomst dit dankzij een internationale werkgever met een dynamisch en groeiend team.
Opleidingen en trainingen om jouw vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen.
Een goede balans tussen je job en vrije tijd vinden we belangrijk. Daarom werken we onder andere met glijdende werkuren en vrij in te plannen ADV-dagen bovenop je wettelijke vakantiedagen. Ook van thuis uit werken is mogelijk.
Fun gegarandeerd met maandelijkse teamactiviteiten, georganiseerd door ons eigen partycomité.
Sterk loonpakket inclusief maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering en groepsverzekering.




Locatie

Nationaal – kantoor te Lokeren.

 

Klaar om impact te maken?

Neem contact op met Annelien van HR via jobs@rittal.be of +32 483 67 33 44.

Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Patrianna, We're passionate about creating exceptional gaming experiences for millions of players around the world, operating at the intersection of technology and entertainment, our aim is to deliver innovative solutions to enhance user experiences in social gaming.







We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to work closely with our marketing team. The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience with SQL and at least one reporting tool like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker. Prior experience in marketing is a plus but not required.




Key Responsibilities:

Manage and integrate multiple datasets from various sources to ensure accurate and consistent reporting.
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar tools.
Conduct in-depth analysis across multiple brands to identify strategies that enhance marketing ROI.
Ensure data accuracy and validate insights to support data-driven decision-making.




Requirements:

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis.
Experience with reporting and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Marketing experience is a plus, especially with UTM tracking, affiliate platforms, campaign attribution, and digital advertising metrics (e.g., CTR, CPC, CPA).
Strong analytical skills and effective communication abilities.




Tech Stack: Google Big Query, Looker (LookML, not Looker Studio), Tableau, Git, Dataform.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive marketing success, we want to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data & Control Analyst
Description:
Department

The Corporate Planning division, located in Brussels, consists of several departments: The corporate planning department in charge of Group Controlling & Daikin Europe controlling, the Business Analytics department, and the Internal controls & J-Sox department.

The division is responsible for drilling down the strategy into annual budgets and realizing the group targets. This is done in cooperation with all sales and manufacturing entities, as well as with other departments in Daikin Europe. As a backbone for group-wide reporting, the department takes care of the management of the sales-, margin-, and pricing data, as well as collecting and reporting market intelligence. Our mission is to safeguard and manage profitability, via periodic reporting to top-management, close follow-up and by proposing countermeasure actions.

Furthermore, the division is responsible for the development and implementation of corporate governance and internal controls in the group (e.g. J-SOx and system access).

The vacancy is in the Business Analytics Department.

Function


You will be involved in SAP roll-outs at our daughter companies. You will propose & implement changes to improve the controlling function within our group.
You will discuss changes requested by the business and translate this together with the IT Center into SAP/PowerBI solutions. You translate the business requirements towards IT so they can provide working IT solutions, brining added value to the business.
You will be involved in the roll-out of Sales & Service software package at our daughter companies. During these projects, you will mainly focus on controlling in SAP, as well as the reporting track in PowerBI.
You will be involved in the set-up of new reporting dashboards in PowerBI across EMEA organization. In the dashboard you will combine all related operational tools.
You work together with a wide range of stakeholders that all have different requirements, you are able to set priorities, manage expectations and communicate accordingly. Your ideas how to further improve our setup will created added value.


Your profile


You have a Master's degree in business economics, finance or controlling
You already have extended experience in a similar role as controller or SAP key-user, or extended experience in an analytical position.
You have user experience of SAP modules SD, FI and CO. Technical knowledge on SAP set-up in FI and CO is an asset
You are prepared to travel abroad (15% of your time) and/or to the Oostkamp office (Accounting & IT) if projects or meetings require this.
You work accurate, have the ability to dig into the details without losing the helicopter view
You possess excellent analytical skills and demonstrate good communication skills
You are a team player but you’re also able to work independently
You are result-driven with a strong focus on improvements


What We Offer

At Daikin, you can count on a varied job with an international market leader that stimulates its people to grow and to work together. We offer you an open ended contract. You will be given extensive training and will be well supported from the start. The position carries a competitive salary and a package of extra-legal benefits. This function offers an excellent stepping stone to take on more responsibilities in a planning-oriented function or a detachment abroad at one of our EMEA affiliates.

Daikin Europe N.V.

Daikin Europe N.V. is the EMEA headquarters of the Japanese company, Daikin Industries Ltd. We design, manufacture and distribute air conditioning and heating systems for commercial, residential and industrial applications. Our headquarters are located in Brussels and Ostend, but through our sales networks we also have a presence throughout Europe, Africa and the Middle East.

We are the market leader in the field of air conditioning and also offer Total Comfort Solutions in the fields of cooling, heating, ventilation and related techniques.

In addition, as a company we are constantly expanding, with extensive international contacts, a pleasant, stimulating working environment, extensive training and coaching, ... Daikin Europe N.V. has many trump cards. However, our highly motivated employees are our greatest asset. That is why we are always looking for new talent.

Title: Data Analyst _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

Le service corporate Strategy & Legal joue un rôle majeur au sein de la SNCB au niveau du suivi des engagements de la SNCB en tant que prestataire de services publics dans les différentes activités principales de la SNCB. Par ailleurs, ce service staff joue également un rôle central dans la préparation, le suivi et l'évaluation de la stratégie de l'entreprise.

En tant que Data Analyst au sein du service Corporate Strategy, vous soutenez la SNCB dans le développement de modèles stratégiques en mettant l’accent sur l’analyse et la visualisation d’ensembles de données complexes. Vous collaborez avec différentes divisions pour veiller à ce que nos modèles soient coordonnés et cohérents et vous contribuez aux décisions stratégiques qui façonnent la SNCB.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

En tant que Data Analyst, vous assumez les tâches et responsabilités suivantes :


Analyser et interpréter les ensembles de données multivariées pour fournir des pistes stratégiques.
Exécuter des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et soutenir les analyses de transport.
Développer des visualisations et rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI afin de présenter des résultats de manière plus claire et accessible.
Réalisation d’analyses en Visum ou être disposé à maîtriser ce logiciel.
Collaborer avec d’autres data analysts et data engineers au sein de la société pour garantir la qualité des données et garder une cohérence dans l’utilisation d’ensembles de données entre les divisions.


Un job fait pour vous ?


Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie). Une première expérience professionnelle comme data analyst est un atout.


Par ailleurs, vous disposez des compétences suivantes :


Orienté résolution de problèmes, orienté équipe et disposé à soutenir la collaboration transversale au sein de la SNCB. Vous êtes capable de vous adapter en fonction des besoins du projet et des stakeholders internes concernés ;
Connaissance de techniques d’analyses multivariées et expérience dans la gestion et l’analyse de données géographiques ;
Vous avez une bonne connaissances de Python ;
De préférence, connaissance dans la modélisation des transports et maîtrise de Visum ou prêt à acquérir cette connaissance ;
Expérience des outils de visualisation et d’analyse des données tels que Power BI;
Bonnes aptitudes de communication et capacité à formuler clairement des idées complexes sur les données ;
Vous êtes créatif et orienté résolution de problèmes ;
Vous êtes avide d'apprendre et motivé à découvrir différentes activités de la SNCB.


Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui fait la force de la SNCB. C'est pourquoi la diversité et l'inclusion sont essentielles à nos yeux.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez soutenu et entouré de chouettes collègues. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13eme mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillerez à Bruxelles, à deux pas de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et pourrez télétravailler régulièrement.

What’s next ?

Nous voulons que vous vous sentiez bien parmi nous et que vous obteniez une image aussi complète que possible du travail, de vos collègues et de notre entreprise. C'est pourquoi nous prévoyons plusieurs étapes pour mieux faire connaissance. Toutes les étapes sont planifiées successivement, sur une période aussi courte que possible.


Vous pouvez postuler via notre jobsite
Nous examinerons votre CV et lettre de motivation avec grand intérêt et, si nécessaire, nous vous téléphonerons brièvement pour vous poser quelques questions supplémentaires et tester votre connaissance de la deuxième langue nationale. N'hésitez pas non plus à nous contacter !
Afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, nous vous inviterons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité en ligne. Lors de l'entretien, nous (le manager et les collègues) ferons plus ample connaissance avec vous et nous nous pencherons sur votre motivation, vos compétences, votre expérience et votre vision de la fonction. Bien entendu, vous pourrez également nous poser toutes les questions que vous souhaitez pour vous faire une idée précise de votre futur emploi.
Un deuxième entretien sera peut-être organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous ferons alors une proposition de contrat.
Vous commencerez votre nouveau job !


La procédure préliminaire peut éventuellement être interrompue ou adaptée pour des raisons fondées.

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq : 49738

Sur le contenu de cet emploi :

Bart Wuyts

M : bart.wuyts.851@belgiantrain.be

Sur la procédure de sélection :

Florence Servais

M : florence.servais@hr-rail.be

T : +32 2 432 54 60
Show more

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Context of the mission/objective(s) of the job

We are embarking on an exciting project focused on data democracy, aiming to deliver valuable insights to

the business through comprehensive dashboards. As a BI Analyst, you will play a crucial role in this

initiative, leveraging your expertise in Power BI and Azure to drive data-driven decision-making.

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards to provide actionable insights to business stakeholders.
Work (create, modify) with large datasets within Power BI, ensuring efficient data processing and Visualization.
Navigate Tabular Editor with ease to manage and optimize data models.
Maintain data loads and refreshes using SSMS, Tabular, or REST API.
Optimize data transformations using Power Query and DAX.
Implement and manage Incremental Refresh, Query Folding, Deployment Pipelines, and ALM Toolkit.
Utilize BEx Queries, Analysis for Office (A4o), and Web Intelligence (WebI) for data reconciliation Between BW and Power BI reports.
Ensure data security through Row-Level Security (Rls) and Object-Level Security (OLS).
Develop Power BI reports - including some of them optimized for smartphones, showcasing strong visualization skills.


Requirements


Proven experience with large datasets in Power BI.
Proficiency in navigating and using Tabular Editor.
Strong knowledge of maintaining data loads and refreshes (SSMS, Tabular, REST API).
Experience in optimizing Power Query and DAX.
Familiarity with Incremental Refresh, Query Folding, Deployment Pipelines, and ALM Toolkit.
Experience with BEx Queries, A4o, and WebI is a significant plus.
Understanding of Rls and OLS for data security.
Strong visualization skills and experience in building Power BI reports for smartphones is a significant plus.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Relevant certifications (e.g., PL-300) are advantageous.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
Show more
HTML:
Context of the mission/objective(s) of the job

We are embarking on an exciting project focused on data democracy, aiming to deliver valuable insights to

the business through comprehensive dashboards. As a BI Analyst, you will play a crucial role in this

initiative, leveraging your expertise in Power BI and Azure to drive data-driven decision-making.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards to provide actionable insights to business stakeholders.
  • Work (create, modify) with large datasets within Power BI, ensuring efficient data processing and Visualization.
  • Navigate Tabular Editor with ease to manage and optimize data models.
  • Maintain data loads and refreshes using SSMS, Tabular, or REST API.
  • Optimize data transformations using Power Query and DAX.
  • Implement and manage Incremental Refresh, Query Folding, Deployment Pipelines, and ALM Toolkit.
  • Utilize BEx Queries, Analysis for Office (A4o), and Web Intelligence (WebI) for data reconciliation Between BW and Power BI reports.
  • Ensure data security through Row-Level Security (Rls) and Object-Level Security (OLS).
  • Develop Power BI reports - including some of them optimized for smartphones, showcasing strong visualization skills.

Requirements

  • Proven experience with large datasets in Power BI.
  • Proficiency in navigating and using Tabular Editor.
  • Strong knowledge of maintaining data loads and refreshes (SSMS, Tabular, REST API).
  • Experience in optimizing Power Query and DAX.
  • Familiarity with Incremental Refresh, Query Folding, Deployment Pipelines, and ALM Toolkit.
  • Experience with BEx Queries, A4o, and WebI is a significant plus.
  • Understanding of Rls and OLS for data security.
  • Strong visualization skills and experience in building Power BI reports for smartphones is a significant plus.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Relevant certifications (e.g., PL-300) are advantageous.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities.

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
Job Description

At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
We believe that people can improve the world through the power of technology. We do this by creating a nurturing environment that promotes growth and creative thinking.

We enable our engineers and customers with innovative solutions to address some of the most challenging problems out there.

We deliver added value to our customers by building reusable accelerators, developing innovative blueprints, and supporting their technology strategy.

What will you be doing?

  • You have a passion for innovation and know-how to use your engineering skills to give our clients a solid lead in the digital world. You will work in multidisciplinary teams on innovative solutions.
  • You advise our clients on technology during a sprint zero and implement the solution with your engineering team.
  • You are going to ingest and process the raw data of several large international corporations. Next to that you will lead teams and create reusable data solutions.
  • You will be exposed to large volumes of data and related processing workloads. And of course a lot of customer contact in which you advise them on how to maximize the value of their data.
  • You will contribute to Capgemini's vision and help us build our data innovation portfolio;
  • You will be part of a culture with a high bar of engineering and emotional intelligence standards where development paths are self-determined within a mentor-led environment to support and guide these growth opportunities.

Job requirements

How do you qualify?

Don't worry about the long list. If you think you qualify and you don't match the exact qualifications, just apply! We can always have a talk to see if there is a good match. When you have your talk with us, tell us about your:

  • Work experience in IT and Data Engineering;
  • Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Foundations in Data Management, Processing and Data Modelling techniques;
  • Experience with cloud-based data services;
  • Knowledge of Data Management Principles and Frameworks;
  • Knowledge of Metadata concepts and Metadata-driven data applications;
  • Knowledge of different Data Modelling Techniques (e.g. Relational);
  • Experience in Distributed Data Computing and Big Data ecosystems(Hadoop, Teradata);
  • Understanding of Data streaming and API solutions;
  • Exposure to data quality frameworks and error management;
  • Experience with multiple Data ingestion and Data integration tools and frameworks(Basic) Knowledge of data consumption techniques (Data Wrangling, SelfService BI, Managed BI, Advanced Analytics);
  • Software engineering and programming skill sets which may include –Python, Scala, Java, C# (At least one);
  • Knowledge of the Spark framework;
  • Understanding of core cloud concepts - Data storage, Compute, Data connections, APIs, and Security on cloud;
  • Experience in designing, building, testing, and maintaining cloud applications and related services;

Do you have these extras? Then we like you even more!

  • Experience in Azure Data Services (ADF, SQL DWH, Data Bricks);
  • Experience with CI/CD and DevOps;
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery);

Our offer

Of course, you will get a competitive salary with other interesting benefits. But more importantly, you will work at a fantastic and pleasant place where you can do more than just engineering. You will be learning, developing yourself, organizing events and speaking at conferences.

Are you ready to be a part of the team and do you think you are the next Data Engineer we are looking for? Do not hesitate to apply.

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
Nexeo is currently seeking an IT Functional Analyst - Senior for a leading financial institution in Brussels.




About Nexeo Belgium:

We are a consultancy firm that supports clients in the banking, finance, and insurance sectors throughout all stages of their transformation projects—from business consulting to IT solution implementation.




As a Nexeo consultant, you will benefit from:

An international environment with offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland, and Canada.
A growing team of over 450 employees.
Career opportunities in a company experiencing 20% annual growth.

IT Functional Analyst - Senior – Main Responsibilities:

Analyze and define business models using techniques like UML, Visio, and mock-ups.
Understand and document end-to-end (E2E) process and data flow.
Challenge business requirements in terms of technical feasibility, risks, and limitations, proposing alternative solutions.
Collaborate with architects on technical solutions, including APIs.
Review and understand code (Visual Basic, Python, SQL) to ensure smooth integration.
Facilitate end-to-end testing, ensuring the quality of deliverables.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate needs into functional requirements.
Manage risks, constraints, and impediments to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.

Profile:

Master's degree or equivalent experience.
At least 5 years of relevant experience in a Functional/Business Analyst role, preferably with knowledge of fraud.
Proficient in conceptual modeling (UML, Visio, mock-ups), MS Office, and understanding of IS and testing.
Familiar with coding languages like Visual Basic, Python, and SQL.
Knowledge of Agile methodologies is a plus.
Strong communication skills in Dutch, French, and English.

Skills:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Structured, detail-oriented, and quality-focused.
Self-driven and capable of working autonomously while being a strong team player.

Working for Nexeo:

Hybrid work model: 50% on-site, 50% remote.
A dynamic and innovative working environment.
Opportunities for career development and growth.




#ITFunctionalAnalyst #FraudPrevention #Banking #Agile #BusinessAnalysis #Brussels #Consulting

Title: Performance & Data Analyst F/M
Description:
Position description

Business unit

Operations, Data & IT - Operations, Client Servicing & Reporting

Job title

Performance & Data Analyst F/M

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return , asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

As a Performance & Data Analyst in our Performance Measurement team at Candriam, you are joining a global multi-specialist asset management firm renowned for its commitment to sustainable and responsible investments.

In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our reporting data, essential for both external client reports and consumption by internal clients like the RFP team and Front Office.

Your work will encompass a broad spectrum of portfolio data relevant to our diverse investment solutions, including performance metrics, asset allocations, and holdings information. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in managing the performance engine's parameterization, overseeing the data flow process, and enhancing data quality.

This role is integral to feeding accurate and reliable data into our central data lake, supporting strategic decision-making and analysis across the company.

It requires a dedication to operational excellence and a proactive approach to developing your technical skills within the evolving landscape of sustainable asset management.

Responsabilities


You collect data from different sources and integrate it into the performance calculation tool
You maintain the set-up of the production scope
You manage the output of performance results to serve all business needs
You actively contribute to specific projects on creating value added services for internal and external clients
You provide innovative insight in data related to regulatory and business challenges
You assess, design and implement solutions in data management, data governance and data quality
You analyze systems and processes to make them more efficient and to make data delivery faster and more accurate.



Profile


You hold a Master in finance, economics or you are preferably performance measurement and GIPS
You have excellent reporting & data management skills
A previous experience with a performance analysis tool is an asset (Statpro, Bisam, Factset,..)
You have an analytical mind that is capable of creative and solution-oriented thinking in a continuous search for improvement
You are efficient and work in a structured and methodical way
You have an eye for detail, you are meticulous and pragmatic
You are a motivated person that can work in a dynamical environment and face challenges
You master MS Excel; Python skills required. knowledge of MS Access, VBA and SQL is an asset, Power BI skills are also a plus
You are fluent in English, French or Dutch





Job location


Candidate criteria

Education


Master's Degree I / Bac+4



Minimum Level Of Experience Required

6-10 years

Languages


English (C1 - Fluent)
French (C1 - Fluent)

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Databricks Data Engineer to support the development of a data product and analytics-driven culture. You will work closely with data experts, DBAs, and data consumers/scientists to establish and maintain a robust Databricks environment. Your expertise will play a critical role in shaping and ensuring the success of this new platform and strategy.




Responsibilities:

Build and maintain scalable data architectures and data lakes on the Databricks platform.
Implement monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and address data processing issues.
Stay updated with the latest advancements and best practices in Databricks and big data technologies.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure scalability, reliability, and security of Databricks clusters.
Design and configure data pipelines using Databricks to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources.
Develop and optimize SQL queries and Spark jobs for efficient data processing and analysis.
Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues and data quality problems in Databricks environments.
Provide technical guidance and support to data scientists and analysts using the Databricks platform.
Document solutions, architectures, and processes related to Databricks implementations.




Requirements

Strong knowledge of big data technologies and concepts, including Apache Spark and distributed computing.
Experience with cloud platforms, preferably AWS Databricks.
Deep understanding of data integration, data modeling, and data warehousing.
Expertise in data ingestion, ETL processes, and both streaming and batch data.
Proven experience in building and optimizing data pipelines using Databricks Notebooks, Databricks Jobs, and Databricks Delta Lake.
Proficiency in SQL with expertise in database concepts, query optimization, and performance tuning.
Programming skills in Python, Scala, or SQL.
Knowledge of exposing data for dashboarding and data analytics.
Familiarity with data governance, data security, and compliance requirements in a big data environment.
Strong problem-solving skills for troubleshooting and resolving data processing and performance issues.
Installation and configuration of Databricks clusters and associated components (network connectivity, access controls, etc.) is an advantage.




Your expertise in Databricks will drive impactful decisions and innovations in agricultural research and development.

Title: Senior Power BI Specialist
Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Power BI Specialist to join their team.




Job Description

As a Power BI Specialist you will: 

Build and maintain business intelligence data models and dashboards for our IT applications, according to the priorities given by project managers.
Integrate data from multiple sources.
Create visuals for workflow, distribution, and consumption using Power BI tools.
Build new BI dashboards based on change requests.
Provide evaluative and corrective maintenance to existing BI dashboards.
Address requests received via the Change Advisory Board & Follow the schedule agreed upon with IT unit officials.




Qualifications

What would make you a fit for the role: 

Master’s degree with a minimum of 10 years of experience, or a Bachelor’s degree with at least 14 years of experience.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Power BI, Kibana, QuickSight, DAX Query, SQL, Python, M Query, Power Query).
Experience in Power BI data modeling and ETL, both on-premises and in the cloud.
Experience in Power BI report performance optimization (e.g., query folding, visual optimization, data model minimization).
Familiarity with Power BI administration, including gateways, user/report access, and workspaces.
Knowledge in integrating various data sources into Power BI (e.g., relational databases, JSON, website analytics).
Experience with GitLab or similar version control tools.
Strong analytical skills to translate complex data into actionable visualizations.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I am currently looking for an experience Data Engineer to join a valued client of mine.




In your day to day, you will be responsible for building and optimizing the data infrastructure and pipelines that enable data analysis and insights across our organization. This freelance opportunity is ideal for a data engineer who values flexibility, autonomy, and is passionate about creating data systems that support business objectives.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store data.
Develop and manage ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions.
Optimize and manage cloud-based data infrastructure (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to ensure efficiency and security.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data processing and infrastructure.
Implement and monitor data governance and security protocols to maintain data integrity.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Engineer (freelance experience preferred).
Proficiency in data engineering tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
Strong knowledge of ETL frameworks and tools (e.g., Apache Spark, Airflow, Talend).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and data architecture best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication skills and ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical teams.




Fluent in French or Dutch and English




What We Offer:

Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexible working hours with remote options.
Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team on impactful projects.
Access to advanced data technologies and tools.




If this role sounds of interest, please do not hesitate to get in touch!

Show more
HTML:
I am currently looking for an experience Data Engineer to join a valued client of mine.


In your day to day, you will be responsible for building and optimizing the data infrastructure and pipelines that enable data analysis and insights across our organization. This freelance opportunity is ideal for a data engineer who values flexibility, autonomy, and is passionate about creating data systems that support business objectives.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store data.
  • Develop and manage ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
  • Collaborate with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions.
  • Optimize and manage cloud-based data infrastructure (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to ensure efficiency and security.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data processing and infrastructure.
  • Implement and monitor data governance and security protocols to maintain data integrity.


Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a Data Engineer (freelance experience preferred).
  • Proficiency in data engineering tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, Java, or Scala.
  • Experience with data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery).
  • Strong knowledge of ETL frameworks and tools (e.g., Apache Spark, Airflow, Talend).
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and data architecture best practices.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Effective communication skills and ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical teams.


Fluent in French or Dutch and English


What We Offer:

  • Competitive project-based compensation.
  • Flexible working hours with remote options.
  • Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team on impactful projects.
  • Access to advanced data technologies and tools.


If this role sounds of interest, please do not hesitate to get in touch!

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
LE TRAVAIL

Notre Service RH a Mis En Place Une Équipe D’une Dizaine De Business Analysts Dédiée Au Développement Et Au Support Des Applications HR, Telles Que SAP Ou SuccessFactors. Cette Équipe Comprend Également Une Cellule Analytics Qui Joue Un Rôle Clé Dans La Création De Dashboards Et D’outils De Reporting Pour Le Management Et Les Entités Opérationnelles, Permettant D’offrir Une Vision Claire Et Utile Des Données RH. Pour Renforcer Cette Cellule Analytics, Nous Recherchons Un.e Data Analyst Qui Contribuera à Mener à Bien Les Missions Suivantes


Analyser et traduire les besoins exprimés par le management d’Infrabel, qu’il s’agisse de la direction RH ou des autres directions, en solutions concrètes basées sur les données.
Produire des rapports dans Power BI ou SAS, ou, selon les cas, suivre les développements demandés auprès de notre département ICT.
Assurer la qualité des données, garantir leur intégrité et veiller au respect des aspects liés au RGPD.


En tant que Data Analyst, vos domaines de responsabilité sont les suivants :


Collecte, intégration et gestion des données RH : vous serez responsable de cartographier, documenter et structurer les différentes sources de données RH. En parallèle, vous assurerez la qualité, l’intégrité et la conformité des données, en veillant particulièrement au respect des réglementations GDPR.
Analyse et exploitation des données : grâce à votre expertise dans des outils tels que Power BI ou SAS, vous réaliserez des analyses approfondies pour identifier des tendances, extraire des insights et fournir des éléments clés qui orienteront les décisions stratégiques et opérationnelles du département RH.
Création de rapports et visualisations : vous concevrez et développerez des rapports et dashboards clairs et compréhensibles, adaptés aux besoins des managers RH et des autres parties prenantes. Ces outils serviront à fournir une vision pertinente et exploitable des données RH, renforçant ainsi la prise de décision éclairée.
Développement d’outils innovants : vous contribuerez à anticiper les futurs défis RH en concevant différents modèles et outils. Ces outils permettront d’identifier des tendances, comme les besoins en personnel ou l’impact des programmes de formation.
Suivi des projets et gestion des change requests : vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le suivi des projets et des change requests en collaboration avec notre service IT. Cela inclut la gestion des plannings, la réponse aux questions techniques, la réalisation de tests, ainsi que la préparation des communications lors des mises en production pour garantir le bon déroulement des projets et des évolutions.


VOTRE PROFIL


Vous possédez un diplôme de Master ou l’équivalent par expérience.
Vous avez au moins 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst, idéalement dans l'environnement HR d’une entreprise de taille comparable à Infrabel.
Vous avez une connaissance opérationnelle du néerlandais.
Vous avez un niveau avancé en Excel et en Power BI. La maîtrise de SAS et Python représente un atout.
Vous êtes capable de comprendre des données complexes, de détecter des tendances et de proposer des solutions pertinentes pour répondre aux besoins métier.
Vous travaillez avec précision, en assurant l’intégrité et la qualité des données tout au long de vos analyses.
Vous gérez efficacement vos priorités, suivez vos projets et respectez les délais fixés tout en restant flexible face aux imprévus.
Vous aimez travailler en équipe et coordonner vos efforts avec d’autres départements pour atteindre des objectifs communs.
Vous savez vulgariser des analyses complexes pour les rendre compréhensibles et exploitables par des interlocuteurs variés, des managers aux équipes techniques.
Vous restez informé.e des nouvelles technologies, outils et méthodologies pour enrichir vos compétences et améliorer continuellement vos pratiques.


Nous considérons la diversité comme une vraie richesse. Pour travailler chez nous, seuls le talent et l’enthousiasme entrent en ligne de compte.

NOTRE OFFRE


Un job passionnant et varié
Dans une entreprise stable qui contribue à une mobilité durable en phase avec la société
De nombreuses possibilités de formation et de carrière : vous être entrepreneur.neuse de votre propre carrière
Une grande flexibilité, pour que vous puissiez trouver un équilibre entre travail et vie privée
Un package salarial attrayant avec divers avantages supplémentaires
Voyagez gratuitement en train


L'ENVIRONNEMENT DE TRAVAIL

Infrabel construit, entretient et renouvelle l’infrastructure ferroviaire en Belgique. Ensemble avec nos 10 000 collègues, nous voulons innover et créer de l'impact avec bienveillance, fiabilité, positivité et courage. Ces valeurs fondamentales sont la base de notre culture d'entreprise et guident tout ce que nous faisons. En misant sur les datas, la digitalisation et des partenariats solides, nous construisons une mobilité durable et sûre, maintenant et pour le futur.

Curieux.se d'en savoir plus ? Clique ici pour plus d'infos.

Chez Infrabel, nous sommes fier.e.s de notre certification Top Employer ! Car elle récompense nos nombreux projets en lien avec la sécurité et le bien-être de nos collègues, ou encore, notre ambitieuse politique de diversité et d'inclusion. Le télétravail, le développement personnel, l'ergonomie, la motivation du personnel, et la gestion du stress, ne sont que quelques exemples de thématiques sur lesquelles nous travaillons chaque jour.

QUELLES ÉTAPES DEVEZ-VOUS SUIVRE?

Postulez en ligne > CV screening > Nous prenons contact avec vous > Entretien de recrutement > Bienvenue chez Infrabel!

Vous êtes en situation de handicap et vous avez besoin d’ajustements raisonnables pour votre entretien d’embauche ? N'hésitez pas à nous le faire savoir.

DES QUESTIONS SUR CETTE OFFRE D'EMPLOI?

Caroline Lallemand, Talent Acquisition Specialist | E-mail: caroline.lallemand@infrabel.be

N’oubliez pas de créer un profil via ‘Mon profil’. Vous pouvez non seulement ajouter vos données, mais également créer des « alertes d’emploi » en fonction de vos intérêts. De cette façon, vous serez le/la premier.ère à recevoir les nouveaux emplois qui vous conviennent dans votre boîte mail.

Title: Data Analyst (100%)
Description:
Sie werden Mitglied eines dynamischen Teams in der Finanz-Abteilung. Kurze und einfache Kommunikationswege, dank Nähe des Haupt-Auftraggebers, erleichtern unser Alltag. Unser kleines Team ist bestrebt, hochwertige Informationen und Wissen aus dem breiten Datenuniversum der Bank zu erzeugen. Wir erledigen alle Schritte von der Datenbeschaffung bis zur Auswertung. Innovation und Einsatz von moderne Technologien liegt uns am Herzen und KI ist der nächste Schritt.





Ihre Aufgabe




n
Sie erfassen und dokumentieren die Aufträge und erstellen die technischen Anforderungen, zusammen mit dem Auftraggeb
erSie importieren Daten aus den Quellsysteme und führen Datenanalysen dur
chSie entwickeln Prozeduren im Data Warehouse für die Berechnung von KPI und liefern Bericht
enSie entwickeln Dashboard und dokumentieren Ihre Entwicklung
enSie automatisieren wiederkehren Aufgaben, Reports oder Prozedur
enSie prüfen die Datenqualität und Datenintegrität über alle Produkt
enSie arbeiten an Konzepte für neue Produkte und entwickeln KI-Modelle oder setzen KI Werkzeuge e




in
Unsere Anforderun




gen
Sie verfügen über einen Berufs- oder Studienabschluss in Informatik/Wirtschaftsinformatik und können bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Warehouse/BI eines Finanzdienstleisters vorweisen. Im Umgang mit Excel und mit relationale Datenbanken wie MS SQL Server (oder Oracle) sind Sie bestens vertraut und darüber hinaus verfügen Sie ebenso über gute Programmierkenntnisse (T-SQL). Sie haben bestenfalls Kenntnisse von QlikSense (oder PowerBI). Erfahrungen mit Jedox sowie mit der Bankenplattform Avaloq sind von Vorteil. Ebenfalls sind Erfahrungen mit Python und Data Science Aufgaben vom Vorteil für kommende Projekte. Sie zeichnen sich vor allem durch Ihr analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen aus und erledigen Ihre Arbeit mit viel Eigeninitiative, selbständig sowie lösungsorientiert. Ein hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein, grosse Lernbereitschaft sowie ein hohes Mass an Verantwortungsbewusstsein setzen wir in dieser Funktion absolut voraus. Fliessendes Deutsch und gute Französisch Kenntnisse (oder umgekehrt) runden Ihr Profil




ab.
Unser An




gebot
Die Möglichkeit, an innovativen Projekten mitzuwirken und Ihre Ideen einzubringen sowie ein unterstützendes und motiviertes Team, das gemeinsam grosse Ziele erreichen möchte, erwartet Sie. Bei uns wird viel Wert auf die Übernahme von Verantwortung gelegt, hierzu bieten wir viel Spielraum. Eingebettet in den Finanzkonzern der Gruppe Crédit Mutuel bieten wir Ihnen nebst attraktiven Konditionen auch Sicherheit und Kontinuität. Eine sehr gute Vorsorge und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sind weitere Plusp




unkte.
Stellenantritt per sofort oder nach Verein




barung.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - SQL
Company: Nordwand Group - the IT & Finance Recruitment Company
Description:
The Nordwand Group is currently looking for a Data Analyst with very strong SQL to validate, query and manually map data sources to ensure the data is accurate and actionable for use by the development teams. Around 40% of your role will also include Business Analysis




The Profile required

Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating data
Excellent data / database skills
Fluent English




Job Goals

Translate high level requirements into actionable tasks for the development team.
Conduct analysis work to answer ah-hoc questions from the team and internal clients.
Define and build data quality checks and reports that support fast identification of potential errors or gaps in the model.
Act as a first level testing by understanding in detail what drives every change in numbers following updating mapping files or other source data




Responsibilities

Manual mapping of data sources, ensuring accurate classification and transformation of information
Review, validate, and reconcile factors to ensure they align with industry standards and best practices.
Investigating discrepancies and making adjustments as needed.
Write and execute queries to extract and manipulate data from various databases, ensuring it meets required standards and is ready for reporting and analysis.
Perform data validation tasks to ensure the completeness, accuracy, and integrity of data.
Preparation of reports and dashboards, providing insights on trends, validation findings, and improvements to be made.
Work closely with cross-functional teams




In this position you need to take on the position and own it so the team can count on you. You need to be proactive and bring into the position energy and a need to question. This position is really suited to someone who wants to listen and learn and grow into the function.




If you are interested in this position please send your CV into the Nordwand Group to be considered. Applicants must hold an EU passport or a permit to work in Switzerland.

Show more
