Title: Data & Insights Analyst/Analyste de données et perspectives
HTML:
Data & Insights Analyst


Group: Digital Insights

Reports to: Lead, Data & Insights

Location: WADA Europe Office, Lausanne, Switzerland


Posting deadline: 17 January 2025


WHO WE ARE


The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) was established in 1999 as an international independent agency to lead a collaborative worldwide movement for doping-free sport. As the global regulatory body, WADA’s primary role is to develop, harmonize and coordinate anti-doping rules and policies across all sports and countries. Our key activities include: scientific and social science research; education; intelligence & investigations; development of anti-doping capacity; and, monitoring of compliance with the World Anti-Doping Program.


POSITION OVERVIEW


Within, the World Anti-Doping Agency (“WADA”) Digital Insights Impact Area (the “Impact Area”), the Data & Insights Analyst will assist the Lead of the unit in understanding complex key business problems, improving operational performance, and supporting the Agency’s strategic priorities by conducting anti-doping data analysis.


More specifically, the Data & Insights Analyst will effectively analyze, assess, process and monitor data coming from a variety of sources and will disseminate within the Organization strategic and operational insights.


The Data & Insights Analyst will contribute to the development and implementation of a data-led system to assess, identify and report on doping trends, threats and patterns worldwide, for informed decision-making, and strengthen and monitor WADA’s Anti-Doping strategies and operations.


Working under the supervision of the Lead, the Data & Insights Analyst will be an essential member of the WADA’s Digital Insights Unit.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Create and maintain rich and user-friendly interactive visualizations and dashboards, with reporting components;
  • Improve the Organization operational performance by automating the data extraction, increasing data quality and integrating data coming from multiple sources;
  • Explore solutions to improve knowledge on doping trends and patterns to feed the Organization anti-doping programs;
  • Contribute to and support various strategic projects and reports for executives, project teams and stakeholders;
  • Proactively analyze data to answer key questions for WADA or their stakeholders;
  • Contribute to the evaluation of the organization’s methods, to the creation of best-practice documents regarding data analysis processes and the development of an internal network of data practitioners;
  • Generate information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns;
  • Develop and deliver useable solutions under ascribed deadlines;
  • Work effectively with a cross-functional team.


QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS


  • Bachelor or Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Applied Statistics and/or Data Analytics or related fields (background in forensic science is an asset), with 3 or more years’ professional experience;
  • Proven experience in the analysis of data for strategic and operational intelligence purposes. Experience in Anti-Doping is a plus;
  • Experience in a similar position is an asset;
  • Proven experience working with dimensional and relational databases, data analysis methodology, BI tools (e.g. Power BI and Tableau) and programming (e.g. SQL, R or Python);
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills – the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data;
  • Experience in qualitative and quantitative data analysis is an asset;
  • Highly developed interpersonal and collaborative skills;
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Ability to work quickly and accurately, with or without supervision, or as part of a cross-functional team and organization, in a structured and organized manner;
  • Strong documentation and presentation skills – ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand;
  • Excellent oral and written skills in one of the two WADA official languages (English/French) and good command of the other official language. Spanish or other languages would be an asset;
  • Periodic evening and/or weekend work expected;
  • No travel required;
  • Fit with organizational culture: Teamwork, team spirit and love of sport;
  • Aligned with WADA core values: Integrity, Openness and Excellence.


WHAT WE OFFER


  • Working with great colleagues, for a good cause;
  • Retirement plan contribution very competitive;
  • Group Insurance 100% premium covered by WADA (effective first day of employment);
  • Annual wellness subsidy;
  • Professional development and growth opportunities;
  • Hybrid work environment (a mix of office and home-based work);
  • Reimbursement of monthly internet costs (capped amount per month) after probation period.



The masculine is used in our communications for the sole purpose of lightening the text and it designates all genders. WADA believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. All qualified candidates will be considered for this position in a fair manner. WADA would like to thank all candidates who have shown an interest by applying for a position. However, after a thorough profile review, only the retained candidates will be contacted.


Vision: WADA’s vision is a world where all athletes compete in a doping-free sporting environment.

Mission: WADA's mission is to lead a collaborative worldwide movement for doping-free sport.

About us: WADA is headquartered in Montreal, Canada and has regional offices in Cape Town, South Africa; Lausanne, Switzerland; Montevideo, Uruguay; Tokyo, Japan and the office of the President in Warsaw, Poland. As of March 2024, the Agency employs approximately 181 employees and is represented by 58 nationalities. We value the diversity of our employees – current and future – that, as a global team, endeavor every day to protect the rights of clean athletes worldwide.

Title: Analyste Data Quality & Gouvernance des Données
Description:
Talan est un cabinet de conseil en innovation et transformation par la technologie. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille les entreprises et les administrations, les accompagne et met en œuvre leurs projets de transformation et d’innovation en France et à l’international.



Présent dans 21 pays, le Groupe met l’innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines liés aux mutations technologiques des grands groupes, comme le Big Data, l’IoT, la Blockchain et l’Intelligence Artificielle.



Pour la 9ème année consécutive, Talan est lauréat du palmarès des entreprises françaises où il fait bon travailler.



Présent à Genève et à Lausanne Talan Suisse compte aujourd’hui près de150 collaborateurs. Initialement investi dans le secteur financier, Talan s’est développé ces dernières années dans les secteurs de l’horlogerie, des assurances, des médias et des services.





Job Description







Administration et gestion de la plateforme de Data Catalogue pour garantir une gestion optimale des données.
Développement et mise en œuvre des standards, procédures et meilleures pratiques en matière de qualité des données.
Intégration des sources de données et collaboration avec les équipes techniques (DBA, IT) pour optimiser la gestion et le traitement des données.
Suivi de la conformité aux normes et standards de qualité des données, en particulier pour les données critiques au sein de l’organisation.
Coordination des actions de gestion de la qualité des données avec les parties prenantes internes, y compris les propriétaires et responsables des données.
Production de rapports et de tableaux de bord mensuels pour surveiller la qualité des données à travers la banque.
Résolution proactive des problèmes de qualité des données en collaboration avec les équipes transverses et la direction de la conformité et des risques.
Utilisation d’outils de gestion de la qualité des données, tels que Talend Data Quality, pour assurer la conformité aux exigences internes et externes.


Qualifications


Diplômé d’une école d’ingénieur (ou équivalent) en informatique, gestion des données ou domaine similaire.
Environ 5 ans d'expérience dans la gestion de la qualité des données, la gouvernance des données et la gestion des données dans un environnement bancaire, idéalement dans le secteur de la banque privée.
Connaissances des langages SQL et Python
Une expérience en administration de Data Catalogue est requise
Connaissance des exigences réglementaires liées aux données critiques et des outils de gestion de la qualité des données (profilage des données, gestion des risques de données).
Français et anglais courants.
Capacité à travailler en équipe, à communiquer efficacement (écrit et oral) et à gérer les parties prenantes de manière proactive.
Forte capacité d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes, avec une bonne gestion de projet et une capacité à piloter des actions.


Additional Information


Taux d’activité : 100%
Type de contrat : CDI
Show more

Title: Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:


Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat


Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:

  • Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
  • Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
  • Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
  • Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
  • Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
  • Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat

  • Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
  • 2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
  • Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Int. E-Commerce Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We would like to talk to you about the opportunity to join our International E-Commerce department for 6 months as Int. E-Commerce Business Intelligence Analyst.

In this role, you will have to understand and identify key trends and opportunities to drive the E-Commerce growth, and ensure strategic thinking on the future of the online user experience.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

Business Analysis


Follow the E-Commerce performance evolution through various angles and provide insights on latest trends
For one key product category, conduct in-depth analysis and monitor all E-Commerce KPIs
Work in close collaboration with the markets and other International teams to share key insights on business evolution
Comment the overall performance of the E-Commerce channel and take part in the preparation of global performance reviews
Proactively find new growth opportunities in line with the Maison and E-Commerce strategy and coordinate implementation with appropriate stakeholders
Benchmark Cartier E-Commerce with other key players within the Group and the industry
Understand client data and user journeys on the website


Data visualization and dashboarding


Support markets and develop user adoption
Innovate and propose new data visualizations to facilitate understanding and adoption of new concepts
Enhance reports and propose new ideas to optimize existing ones


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?


You have a Master’s degree in Business / Engineering or related fields
You have a first experience in business analysis in commercial, finance, marketing, or supply chain
You master data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, Tableau…
You have an analytical mindset and are detail-oriented
You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a great team-spirit
You have a digital appetence and are at ease with complex and fast-moving ecosystem
You speak English and French fluently


WHAT DO WE OFFER?


We are fully transparent and share with you: Maison strategies, key information & needs of other Corporate Departments.
We create a positive environment where we are proud to employ talent from multiple backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that when diversity and inclusion are fully embraced and empowered, creativity and knowledge emerge to deliver excellence. We continue to work towards creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our clients and our communities.
We constantly develop you with trainings, continuous learning, and feedback culture. Building a healthy and strong feedback culture, where you will feel entitled to give an honest opinion, is essential to us.


YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

If your application is selected, we will give you an introductory call to further discuss the opportunity, and next steps. If things go well on both ends, you will have a chance to meet the Int. Head of E-Commerce Development & Operations and the HR Business Partner.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer Sénior – Ingénierie des Données (H/F)

Poste à 100%

Nous cherchons des Data Engineer Sénior et Junior pour concevoir et développer des produits de données destinés à divers services, avec un haut niveau d’exigence technique. Intégré(e) aux équipes Données, vous interviendrez sur des projets complexes impliquant de fortes volumétries de données.




Vos missions :

Développer des APIs, intégrer des flux de données et traiter des données volumineuses sur une infrastructure on-premise.
Participer aux séances Agile de l’équipe.
Assurer la cohérence avec l’architecture d’entreprise et garantir un traitement optimal des données.
Proposer des solutions innovantes et accompagner les membres juniors dans l’amélioration de leurs pratiques.




Votre profil :

Diplôme en informatique ou équivalent.
Minimum 3 ans d’expérience en ingénierie des données.
Maîtrise des outils comme Gitlab, VSCode, DBT, Python, Kafka.
Niveau de français C2 et anglais B2.
Connaissance des méthodologies ITIL/Hermes et expérience dans le secteur public, un atout.




Lieu de travail : Lausanne. Télétravail possible (2 jours max/semaine).

Date de début : Avril 2025.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Your Role:




As a Senior Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in the creation and evolution of a centralized Data Hub for a major private banking migration project. This hub will consolidate data from various systems to support client reporting, fiscal reporting, regulatory compliance, and business intelligence needs. You will work closely with a team of data analysts, BI specialists, and IT professionals to ensure the delivery of high-quality data solutions.




Key Responsibilities:




Collaborate with business and IT teams to understand and define requirements for the Data Hub.
Design, build, and maintain the Data Hub infrastructure using modern tools such as Azure Synapse and pySpark.
Aggregate, consolidate, and structure data to create a centralized repository for reporting and analytics.
Develop and deliver client, fiscal, and regulatory reports, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
Assist BI Analysts in building business-focused reports for decision-making.
Participate in the integration of T24 into the Data Hub, ensuring seamless data migration and system interoperability.
Explain and document data processes and workflows to facilitate understanding across the team.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior team members on technical and business-related aspects of data management.
Ensure the scalability, maintainability, and future readiness of the Data Hub, transitioning from project mode to ongoing operational support.




What We’re Looking For:




A minimum of 10 years of experience in data engineering, with a focus on private banking or financial institutions.
Expertise in modern data tools, particularly Python, pySpark, and Azure Synapse (experience with equivalent tools will also be considered).
Strong understanding of private banking processes, corporate actions, and operational workflows.
Ability to bridge the gap between IT and business, demonstrating a deep understanding of banking operations.
Experience building centralized data solutions, including data aggregation, consolidation, and report generation.
A track record of delivering complex data projects within cross-functional teams.
Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to modern tools and technologies.
Fluent in English; knowledge of French is a plus.
You will join an existing team of 7-8 professionals dedicated to the Data Hub and analytics.

Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.   

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about? 

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform? 


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you?  


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us? 


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning.  


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.

Title: Senior Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.




Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team’s and company's future.




This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.




Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.




Skills and Talents

Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.




Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.




In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland – flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland – we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Chapter Leader

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop end-to-end business intelligence framework for online products and SAAS solutions based on requirements that include recommending an appropriate architecture (on-premises/cloud), analytics, and reporting. Each day, you will evaluate business data to produce meaningful insights and metrics and to identify trends that could improve business performance. You will also showcase your expertise by designing new dashboards using best practices and intuitive visualization.

The work model for the role is:

This role is contributing to the Electrification business Smart Power division in Bangalore, India.

You will be mainly accountable for:


Develop and maintain BI solutions, including reports, dashboards, and data visualizations, using tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense, Grafana etc.
Collaborate with Agile Team & stakeholders to gather requirements and translate business needs into technical specifications for BI solutions.
Design and optimize data models and databases to support BI solutions, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and reliability.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement, presenting findings to stakeholders.
Implement best practices for data governance, security, and compliance to ensure the integrity of BI solutions.
Provide training and support to users on BI tools and solutions, ensuring effective utilization across the organization.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in the field of business intelligence.
International travel on need basis.



Qualifications For The Role


Bachelor’s degree in Computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven experience 5+ years working in a Business Intelligence role or similar capacity.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in using BI tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense, Grafana etc. with a strong understanding of data visualization principles.
Expertise in SQL and database management systems (DBMS) like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, etc. Experience in Snowflake is preferred.
Exposure to Machine Learning and AI libraries (including Deep Learning, NLP) is preferred and Exposure with programming languages/ tools like Python, R, Alteryx etc. is preferred.
Broad IT/SW/DS background and willingness to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of new technologies and application domains.
Excellent communication skills with an ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence both internally and externally.


More about us

ABB Smart Power provides energy distribution solutions for data centers, industrial and manufacturing plants, critical infrastructure and commercial buildings. The Division’s technical teams work closely with industry partners, delivering advanced solutions that support rapid growth, energy transition, and sustainability objectives. The Division’s portfolio includes industrial circuit breakers, low-voltage systems, motor starting applications, and safety devices like switches and relays. Its Power Protection unit supports the world’s largest data center companies with advanced energy-efficient UPS solutions. The Division’s ABB Ability™ Energy Manager provides a scalable, easy-to-use platform that helps organizations save energy and reduce CO2 emissions.

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning

  • Proven experience 5+ years working in a Business Intelligence role or similar capacity.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
  • Proficiency in using BI tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlik Sense, Grafana etc. with a strong understanding of data visualization principles.
  • Expertise in SQL and database management systems (DBMS) like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, etc. Experience in Snowflake is preferred.
  • Exposure to Machine Learning and AI libraries (including Deep Learning, NLP) is preferred and Exposure with programming languages/ tools like Python, R, Alteryx etc. is preferred.
  • Broad IT/SW/DS background and willingness to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of new technologies and application domains.
  • Excellent communication skills with an ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence both internally and externally.

More about us

ABB Smart Power provides energy distribution solutions for data centers, industrial and manufacturing plants, critical infrastructure and commercial buildings. The Division’s technical teams work closely with industry partners, delivering advanced solutions that support rapid growth, energy transition, and sustainability objectives. The Division’s portfolio includes industrial circuit breakers, low-voltage systems, motor starting applications, and safety devices like switches and relays. Its Power Protection unit supports the world’s largest data center companies with advanced energy-efficient UPS solutions. The Division’s ABB Ability™ Energy Manager provides a scalable, easy-to-use platform that helps organizations save energy and reduce CO2 emissions.

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning

Design, build, and maintain data pipelines and middleware systems for trading IT platforms.

Title: Forensic Analyst
Description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Business Analyst Senior Manager

Your role and responsibilities

In this role you will be responsible for leveraging your investigative and analytical expertise to support investigations and monitor Integrity risks across ABB’s environment. Responsibil-ities include:


Support IIM by providing forensic analytic support for investigations in China. Foren-sic analytic support includes data discovery and research of investigative subjects. Once identified, forensic analysts also may apply advanced analytic techniques to as-sess allegations made against the subjects. Forensic analysts partner closely with IIM investigators to set the scope of data analytic activities for an investigation and then execute those activities in a timely and effective manner.
Identify emerging and pre-existing Integrity risks across ABB’s environment by per-forming monitoring using the Forensic Analytic Team’s Continuous Monitoring Plat-form (CMP). This position will focus on reviewing China systems using a suite of monitoring tools and techniques.
Enhance CMP by integrating China-specific risk statements and accommodating country-specific processes. This role is expected to become a subject-matter expert in China business processes and use that knowledge to enhance CMP and make it more effective. Enhancing CMP may include both thought leadership and software development activities.
Help build new data ingestions to further enhance CMP.
Act as a subject-matter expertise at the intersection of investigations, integrity risk, and technology. Support peers in Investigations and other colleagues across Group Functions and the business.



Qualifications For The Role


10+ years of experience performing non-HR investigations for large multi-national companies, focusing on major investigations involving fraud, bribery, and corruption.
Familiarity with common business processes around third-party management (TPM), Procure-To-Pay (P2P), Order-To-Cash (O2C), Project Management, and Record-To-Report (R2R).
A desire to learn data analytics tools and processes. Demonstrated experience with analytical tools and database systems is a plus.
Fluency in English is required. Fluency in Mandarin is preferred.
High level of attention to detail


More about us

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

Global Pharma Technical Development (PTD) is a 2,000-strong global team driving Roche's mission to develop meaningful medicines. PTD bridges early to commercial product needs through innovative technical solutions. The PTD Data and Digital (PTDD) team pioneers digital transformation in Pharma Technical Development with seamless data flow, analytics, and upskilling. Focused on advancing data and digital capabilities, PTDD supports small and large molecule development, device development, analytical sciences, and the clinical supply chain. We integrate data and information across the product lifecycle with analytics and intelligent automation, collaborating closely with key partners like Ix, pRED/gRED, PTC, and PTE.

Are you a passionate Data Engineer with a knack for cloud technologies and transforming data into actionable insights? Join Roche's Pharma Technical Development Data and Digital Team (PTDD) to design, build, and maintain scalable data infrastructure. Collaborate with global cross-functional teams and advance our digital capabilities, driving efficiencies and innovative solutions to deliver meaningful medicines to patients faster. Be part of a vibrant community that supports small and large molecule technical development, device development, and intelligent automation. Apply now to pioneer Pharma in the digital world!

Your opportunity


Data Pipelines: Design and maintain efficient, scalable data pipelines for large datasets
Data Integration: Ensure quality and consistency by integrating data from multiple sources
Optimization: Enhance data architecture and performance for advanced analytics and machine learning
Testing: Setup of preferably automated software quality testing
Collaboration: Partner with data scientists and analysts to address data needs
Compliance & Documentation: Adhere to regulations and maintain thorough documentation for pipelines and processes



Who You Are
You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Life Sciences, Information Technology, or related field and 2-5 years of Data Engineering experience, ideally in R&D or Technical Operations. Further, you bring:


Technical Skills: Expertise with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and proficiency in Python, Java, SQL, or Scala. Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka) and data warehousing (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake), CI/CD, automated testing
Soft Skills & Environment: Strong problem-solving, analytical, communication, and collaboration abilities. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a commitment to data quality. Fluency in English; German is a plus. Ensure that all data engineering activities comply with relevant data quality, data protection and privacy regulations
Preferred Qualifications: Experience with containerization tools (L7, Docker, Kubernetes), familiarity with the Snowflake platform, data visualization tools (Tableau, Spotfire, Dataiku, Thoughtspot, Plotly), and knowledge of machine learning and high-availability architecture design


Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Quantitative Strategist
Description:
Quant Strategist / Developer

Oil Trading

Geneva




Our client is a leading renewable energy firm, and they are seeking a Quant Stratgist and Developer to join their dynamic oil trading team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong focus on data, analytics, and quantitative development, who thrives in a fast-paced, commercially driven trading environment to guide trading strategy. You will work closely with traders, building innovative tools and models that directly influence trading strategies and performance.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement cutting-edge quantitative models and tools for oil trading.
Analyse and process large data sets to derive insights that inform trading decisions.
Contribute to trading strategies and risk management solutions.
Collaborate with traders to create solutions for market analysis, risk management, and strategy development.
Continuously enhance trading models and systems to adapt to market dynamics.
Design and deploy scalable solutions for data integration, processing, and visualisation.




Essential Skills & Experience:

Strong programming expertise in Python, C#, or similar, with a focus on quantitative development and modelling.
Solid experience in commodities trading, particularly in oil or related markets.
Proficiency in handling and analysing large-scale data sets; experience with SQL and other data tools is advantageous.
Knowledge of statistical modelling, machine learning, and predictive analytics.
Proven ability to work collaboratively with traders and other front-office teams.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

As part of Pharma Technicla Development (PTD) our organization is committed to deliver the Pharma ambitions by bringing game-changing therapies from clinical phase I into the market to serve every patient, every day. Our core business is to develop safe, innovative and effective drugs using cutting edge technologies for manufacturing process (Drug Substance and Drug Product), clinical supply, formulation, device, packaging, and analytical development.

As a Data Engineer you will work in the Data and Digital Team (PTDD) within Pharma Technical Development. Global Pharma Technical Development (PTD) is an organization of over two thousand people globally that are integral for the mission of Roche to develop meaningful medicines for patients. PTD actively collaborates and develops innovative technical solutions to bridge early-stage, late-stage and commercial product needs. PTD Data and Digital (PTDD) team is a global team and we pioneer Pharma Technical Development in the Digital World, through seamless data flow, culture & upskilling, and analytics & insights. Our focus is advancing data and digital capabilities towards achieving efficiencies, robust process/product design and speed to patients while championing the enabling digital mindset across our business.

PTDD is responsible for a broad range of services for systems and support across small and large molecule (synthetics and biologics) technical development, device development, analytical sciences, business operations and clinical supply chain. We enable digital integration of data and information across product advancement lifecycle paired with data analytics and intelligent automation, end to end lifecycle support/enhancement for Automation, lab information management systems, data engineering/data science to support PTD functions. We collaborate closely with key partners including Ix, Research and Early Development and other Pharma Technical functions.

As a Data Engineer you will report to the Digital Integration Team Lead in Basel and work in a matrix team of digital experts and SMEs from drug development on the digital future of drug development.

Your Opportunity


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines to handle large data volumes
Integrate data from various sources, ensuring quality, consistency, and reliability
Contribute to data architecture design to support analytics and machine learning
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders to meet data needs
Monitor, optimize, and document data pipelines and storage solutions
Ensure compliance with data protection and privacy regulations
Set up automated software quality testing



Who You Are
You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Life Sciences, IT, or related field and bring 2-5 years of experience in Data Engineering, preferably in the pharmaceutical industry, ideally with proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, SQL, or Scala as well as experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka). Further you bring:


Familiarity with data warehousing solutions (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake) and technical lab informatics platforms (ELNs, Benchling, Dotmatics)
Experience with containerization (such as Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools (such as L7)
Knowledge of machine learning, large language models, and data science concepts
Familiarity with visualization and data tools (Tableau, Spotfire, Dataiku, Thoughtspot, Plotly)
English fluency is required; German proficiency is a plus


Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer – SQL, Python
Description:
Data Engineer vacancy requiring profound SQL and Python knowledge for our Zurich based client in the pharmaceutical sector.

Your Tasks


Developing and maintaining backend processes focused on data engineering and SQL integration
Implementing front-end components using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and creating interactive data visualizations with Plotly
Scripting and automating data-related processes using Python and libraries such as scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy
Developing APIs to facilitate data integration and accessibility
Performing unit testing to ensure code quality, reliability, and functionality
Collaborating with teams to integrate machine learning models into existing data architectures and workflows



Your Experience/knowledge


Expertise in data engineering, coupled with proficiency in SQL for backend development
Proficiency in front-end technologies including HTML, CSS, and basic JavaScript
Strong knowledge of Python, with experience in scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy
Ability to develop simple APIs for seamless data integration and accessibility
Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools like Jira
Experience with Databricks for processing and managing large datasets is preferred



Your Soft Skills


Excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
Analytical and solution-orientated thinking



Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Work setting: Hybrid

Sector: Pharmaceutical

Start: ASAP

Duration: 06MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH22288

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
📢 Notre mission :




Ivy Partners est une société de conseil Suisse qui contribue à l’évolution des entreprises dans leurs enjeux stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.

Notre objectif aujourd’hui est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui contribuera positivement à leur épanouissement et à leur bien-être, en les faisant monter en compétences et en leur offrant de réelles perspectives d’évolution.

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Engineer pour renforcer notre équipe dans la gestion des ingestions Talend en cours et pour accompagner l'équipe dans la découverte de Fivetran, si cette dernière possède également des connaissances dans ce domaine.




👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que Data Engineer chez Ivy Partners, vous serez en charge de :




Contribuer à la réalisation des ingestions Talend en cours.
Assister l'équipe dans l'exploration et la compréhension de Fivetran.
Participer activement au Proof of Concept (POC) et au pilote avec Fivetran.
Collaborer avec les différentes équipes pour garantir la compatibilité et l'efficacité des solutions mises en place.
Effectuer des tests rigoureux pour garantir la qualité et la fiabilité des solutions d'intégration de données.
Fournir un support technique et une expertise aux équipes de développement et d'exploitation pour résoudre les problèmes liés à l'intégration de données.




🏅 À propos de vous !




Vous êtes notre petite pépite si techniquement :




Expérience avérée dans l'utilisation de Talend, de préférence avec une connaissance de Snowflake, ce qui serait un véritable atout!
Une bonne maîtrise de l'outil Fivetran.
Capacité à travailler en équipe, à communiquer efficacement et à s'adapter à un environnement dynamique.
Aptitude à résoudre des problèmes de manière autonome et à prendre des initiatives.
Excellentes compétences en résolution de problèmes, en analyse et en communication.
Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et à gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément dans un environnement dynamique.
Diplôme universitaire en informatique, en génie informatique ou dans un domaine connexe (ou expérience équivalente).




Et si humainement :




Vous êtes organisé.e, rigoureux/se, autonome et avez un bon esprit d’équipe.
Vous êtes force de proposition pour des nouveautés et du changement.
Vous êtes à l’aise avec différents interlocuteurs et savez vulgariser.







🤝 Ivy Partners, c’est aussi :




La bienveillance | Soucieux de nos employés, nous leur garantissons un environnement favorable où chacun est valorisé et se voit offrir des formations et des perspectives d’évolution en Suisse ou à l’international.

La confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est développer un partenariat fondé sur la confiance, le professionnalisme et la transparence à chaque instant.

L’innovation | Nous garantissons une transformation numérique efficace grâce à l’innovation technologique couplée à la créativité.

La responsabilité | Le collectif est à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons, et nous prenons cette responsabilité au sérieux en mettant tout en œuvre pour avoir un impact positif.







🚀 Rejoindre Ivy, c’est prendre part à une aventure stimulante à chaque instant ! Merci d’envisager de nous rejoindre, nous sommes impatients d’en savoir plus sur vous !

Title: Senior Data Engineer/Analyst
Description:
Project Description:

Our client is a global technology change and delivery organization comprising nearly 500 individuals located in Switzerland, Poland, Singapore and India. Providing global records and document processing, archiving, and retrieval solutions to all business divisions focusing on supporting Legal, Regulatory, and Operational functions.




Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and manage data solutions on Azure
Develop and maintain data pipelines using Databricks
Ensure efficient data storage and retrieval using Azure Storage and Data Lake
Automate infrastructure and application deployments with Ansible
Write clean, maintainable code in Python
Collaborate with team members using Git and GitLab for version control and CI/CD
Gather and document business requirements through stakeholder interviews and workshops
Analyze and translate business needs into technical specifications
Apply data analytics to interpret data and support business decisions
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to manage expectations and provide project updates
Continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and drive efficiency
Share and contribute: Support and guide less senior team members, contribute to team spirit and dynamic growth, actively participate in wider engineering group- and product-wide activities




Skills

Must Have:

10+ years of data engineering/analysis experience
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
Proficient in deploying and managing services on Microsoft Azure
Hands-on experience with Databricks for data processing and analytics
Understanding of Azure Storage concepts and best practices
Understanding of Microsoft Fabric concepts and best practices
Experience in designing, implementing, and managing data lakes on Azure
Experience in using Ansible for automation and configuration management, with proficiency in YAML
Strong programming skills in Python for data manipulation and automation
Proficient in version control using Git and experience with GitLab for CI/CD pipelines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders and team members
Strong analytical abilities to interpret data and provide actionable insights to support data-driven decision-making




Nice to Have:

Experience in Agile Framework




Languages:

English: C2 Proficient

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
💡 Pourquoi choisir API ?




API, avec plus de 30 ans d'expérience, est une entreprise familiale, reconnue pour sa réelle expertise IT ; transformation digitale, service de support, Cloud...

Nous avons su nous nous entourer des meilleurs experts afin de répondre au mieux aux besoins spécifiques de nos clients.




En optant pour API, vous choisissez une entreprise à taille humaine bénéficiant d'un solide savoir-faire en IT.

Nous sommes fiers de notre culture d’entreprise unique car nous offrons des opportunités de développement professionnel, avec des programmes de formation continue, d'évolution de carrière ainsi qu’un suivi rigoureux.




Nous mettons l’humain au cœur de nos activités : après tout, nos ordinateurs peuvent résoudre des problèmes, mais ils ne savent toujours pas faire un bon café !




📢 Et si vous étiez la personne que nous attendions ?




Aujourd'hui nous sommes à la recherche d'un-e Data Engineer pour nous rejoindre à Lausanne.




En tant qu’ingénieur(e) en données, vous serez responsable de la conception et de la réalisation de produits de données pour différents services à destination du grand public. Vous évoluerez dans un environnement technique exigeant et travaillerez selon les principes de la méthodologie DevOps.




Vos responsabilités :




Créer, mettre à disposition et enrichir un lac de données.
Implémenter des solutions informatiques pour gérer de fortes volumétries de données et effectuer des transformations pertinentes.
Participer aux séances Agiles en collaboration avec l’équipe.
Travailler en étroite relation avec l’architecture d’entreprise, ainsi qu’avec les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure pour maintenir un écosystème de données stable et évolutif.
Garantir un traitement adéquat des données et veiller à la qualité et à la disponibilité de la documentation.
Réaliser des analyses statistiques et qualitatives afin d’assurer un usage optimal des données et offrir une expérience utilisateur de qualité.
Faire preuve de proactivité et de cohérence dans vos propositions.
Apporter un support aux ingénieurs pour améliorer leurs traitements et outils, selon les formations internes dispensées.







Votre profil :




Compétences techniques :

Outils DevOps : GitLab, VSCode, Docker
Outils de tests : PyTest/UnitTest, SonarQube, Postman
Outils de transformations : DBT, Python, Debezium, autres ETL
Sources de données : Parquet sur S3, PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Kafka, SQLServer, SGBD Time Series (Prometheus, InfluxDB), ELK
Ordonnancement et monitoring : Prefect




Qualifications :

Diplôme en informatique d’une haute école (HES, Université, EPF) ou formation équivalente.
Minimum 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans des projets d’ingénierie de données.
Expérience dans la mise en œuvre de projets en mode AGILE.
Connaissances des frameworks ITIL et Hermes sont un plus.
Expérience dans le secteur public est un atout.




Les étapes du processus de recrutement chez API :




Engageons la conversation ! Pour commencer, nous souhaitons découvrir qui vous êtes : votre parcours, vos intérêts et vos aspirations. Cette première prise de contact nous permettra de mieux vous connaître.
Ensuite, approfondissons ! Vous aurez l’occasion de rencontrer nos Business Managers qui vous parleront de la vie de consultant chez API. Ce sera le moment idéal pour découvrir les projets qui retiennent votre attention en fonction de vos ambitions !
Concrétisons ! Une fois l’adéquation entre vos ambitions, vos compétences et le projet établie, l’aventure ensemble peut commencer !

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and German
You must be living in Switzerland the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS Digital Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community







TELUS Digital partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. https://telusdigital.com

Title: Data Analyst Wirtschaftlichkeitsprüfung (a) 60%
Description:
Was dich erwartet


Zusammenarbeiten mit unseren internen Kunden mit Fokus auf Wirtschaftlichkeitsprüfung in einem interdisziplinären Team aus Fachspezialisten, Juristen und Datenanalysten
Weiterentwickeln der Methode zur Wirtschaftlichkeitsprüfung
Analysieren von ad hoc Anfragen zu Leistungskosten und -controlling mit SQL, R und Python
Spezifizieren, Begleiten und Testen von DWH-Reports mit unserem internen Business Intelligence-Team (Microstrategy) und Befähigen der Nutzer
Entwickeln mathematischer und/oder statistischer Modelle, Methoden und Instrumente
Transparente und faire Entlöhnung: Je nach Kompetenzerfüllungsgrad erwartet dich ein Jahreslohn zwischen CHF 100'000 und 130'000 (bei 100%)


Was du mitbringst


Höhere Ausbildung mit quantitativer Ausrichtung (z.B. Mathematik, Statistik)
Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Erfahrung im Gesundheitswesen oder in einer Krankenversicherung, Tarifwissen von Vorteil
Hohes Mass an Eigeninitiative und zielgerichtete, strukturierte Arbeitstechnik
Erfahrung mit unterschiedlichen Datenquellen, Systemen und statistischen Methoden
Fähigkeit, Analysen, Schlussfolgerungen und Prognosen mit der notwendigen Genauigkeit aufzuarbeiten und zielgruppengerecht zu präsentieren


Was wir dir bieten

Flexibilität und Wertschätzung

Wir unterstützen dich dabei, Beruf und Privatleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Etwa mit einer 40-Stunden-Woche, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitarbeitsmodellen, Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sowie mindestens 27 Tagen Ferien. Zudem profitierst du von attraktiven Vergünstigungen, beispielsweise auf deiner Krankenversicherung.

Kultur und Einstellung

Unsere Du-Kultur trägt wesentlich dazu bei, dass wir offen, unkompliziert und hilfsbereit zusammenarbeiten. Die Identifikation mit unseren Zielen und Werten sowie Chancengleichheit schreiben wir dabei gross.

Bewusstsein und Ausgleich

Wir fördern dein Gesundheitsbewusstsein – mit Beratungen, ausgewogenen Gerichten in unseren Personalrestaurants sowie vielen weiteren Angeboten rund um die Themen Ernährung, Bewegung und Entspannung.

Vielfalt und Herausforderung

Bewegung braucht nicht nur der Körper, sondern auch der Geist. Wir fördern deine berufliche Entwicklung - persönlich und im Team. Etwa mit einer Vielzahl an internen Kursen und Coachings.
Show more
HTML:
Was dich erwartet

  • Zusammenarbeiten mit unseren internen Kunden mit Fokus auf Wirtschaftlichkeitsprüfung in einem interdisziplinären Team aus Fachspezialisten, Juristen und Datenanalysten
  • Weiterentwickeln der Methode zur Wirtschaftlichkeitsprüfung
  • Analysieren von ad hoc Anfragen zu Leistungskosten und -controlling mit SQL, R und Python
  • Spezifizieren, Begleiten und Testen von DWH-Reports mit unserem internen Business Intelligence-Team (Microstrategy) und Befähigen der Nutzer
  • Entwickeln mathematischer und/oder statistischer Modelle, Methoden und Instrumente
  • Transparente und faire Entlöhnung: Je nach Kompetenzerfüllungsgrad erwartet dich ein Jahreslohn zwischen CHF 100'000 und 130'000 (bei 100%)

Was du mitbringst

  • Höhere Ausbildung mit quantitativer Ausrichtung (z.B. Mathematik, Statistik)
  • Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Erfahrung im Gesundheitswesen oder in einer Krankenversicherung, Tarifwissen von Vorteil
  • Hohes Mass an Eigeninitiative und zielgerichtete, strukturierte Arbeitstechnik
  • Erfahrung mit unterschiedlichen Datenquellen, Systemen und statistischen Methoden
  • Fähigkeit, Analysen, Schlussfolgerungen und Prognosen mit der notwendigen Genauigkeit aufzuarbeiten und zielgruppengerecht zu präsentieren

Was wir dir bieten

Flexibilität und Wertschätzung

Wir unterstützen dich dabei, Beruf und Privatleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Etwa mit einer 40-Stunden-Woche, flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitarbeitsmodellen, Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sowie mindestens 27 Tagen Ferien. Zudem profitierst du von attraktiven Vergünstigungen, beispielsweise auf deiner Krankenversicherung.

Kultur und Einstellung

Unsere Du-Kultur trägt wesentlich dazu bei, dass wir offen, unkompliziert und hilfsbereit zusammenarbeiten. Die Identifikation mit unseren Zielen und Werten sowie Chancengleichheit schreiben wir dabei gross.

Bewusstsein und Ausgleich

Wir fördern dein Gesundheitsbewusstsein – mit Beratungen, ausgewogenen Gerichten in unseren Personalrestaurants sowie vielen weiteren Angeboten rund um die Themen Ernährung, Bewegung und Entspannung.

Vielfalt und Herausforderung

Bewegung braucht nicht nur der Körper, sondern auch der Geist. Wir fördern deine berufliche Entwicklung - persönlich und im Team. Etwa mit einer Vielzahl an internen Kursen und Coachings.

Title: Junior System Engineer (80-100%)
Description:
Du bist motiviert, etwas zu bewegen und suchst eine Position, in der du Verantwortung übernehmen und wachsen kannst? 🚀 Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir suchen eine engagierte Persönlichkeit, die sich mit Leidenschaft in einem expandierenden Unternehmen einbringen möchte.




JOB DESCRIPTION




🛠️ Monitoring & Wartung: Du überwachst die Kundensysteme und gehst Alarmmeldungen proaktiv an. Mit regelmässiger Wartung der Infrastrukturen stellst du sicher, dass unsere Kunden nicht in ihrer Arbeit beeinträchtigt werden.
🤝 Kundensupport: Du unterstützt unsere Kunden bei IT-Problemen und bearbeitest Tickets per Fernwartung oder vor Ort. Ob On-/Offboardings, Notebook-Einrichtungen, Berechtigungsanpassungen oder Hardware-Staging – mit deiner Serviceorientierung sorgst du für einen echten WOW-Effekt.
🌟 Unterstützung in IT-Projekten: Wir fördern deine Weiterentwicklung und geben dir die Möglichkeit, kleinere Projekte selbstständig zu übernehmen oder erfahrene System Engineers bei komplexeren Projekten zu unterstützen.




REQUIREMENTS




🎓 Abgeschlossene Ausbildung: Du bist ausgebildete:r Informatiker:in (Fachrichtung Systemtechnik) oder ICT Fachmann/Fachfrau.
🖥️ Praktische Erfahrung: Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre Erfahrung in einem IT-Dienstleistungsumfeld gesammelt.
🌐 Technisches Know-how: Du bringst Kenntnisse in Windows und Microsoft 365 mit.
🤝 Kundenorientierung: Du hast Freude am Umgang mit Kunden und bist serviceorientiert.
🤗 Teamgeist: Deine positive Einstellung stärkt unser kollegiales Teamklima.
💡 Eigeninitiative: Du arbeitest selbstständig und gehst proaktiv an Aufgaben heran.
🗣️ Sprachkenntnisse: Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.




PERSPECTIVE




🏡 Home Office: Flexible Arbeitsmodelle bieten dir die Freiheit, auch von zu Hause zu arbeiten.
🤝 Kollegiales Team: Dich erwartet ein angenehmes und lebendiges Arbeitsklima.
🚀 Freiraum & Vertrauen: Wir geben dir viel Gestaltungsspielraum in deiner Arbeit.
🌐 Neuste Technologien: Arbeite mit modernen Tools und Technologien in einem innovativen Umfeld.
📚 Weiterentwicklung: Ein jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget und die Zusammenarbeit mit erfahrenen System Engineers fördern dein persönliches Wachstum.
🌟 Spannendes Arbeitsumfeld: Ein expandierendes Unternehmen mit vielen neuen Chancen und Möglichkeiten.
🎉 Attraktive Benefits: Zahlreiche Mitarbeitervorteile, die wir ständig erweitern.
Möchtest du Teil unseres dynamischen Teams werden und aktiv etwas bewegen? Dann bewirb dich jetzt und starte deine Karriere als Junior System Engineer bei uns! 🌟
