Title: Senior Data Engineer/Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
As a fast-growing international company, Luxoft is always on the lookout for IT professionals from all over the world. Our specialization – Banking/Financial services, Automotive and Digital transformation areas.




Description:

Our client is a global technology change and delivery organization comprising nearly 500 individuals located in Switzerland, Poland, Singapore and India. Main focus - providing global records and document processing, archiving, and retrieval solutions to all business divisions focusing on supporting Legal, Regulatory, and Operational functions.

Currently we're looking for an experienced Senior Data Engineer/Analyst to join the team in Zurich.




Responsibilities:

• Design, implement, and manage data solutions on Azure

• Develop and maintain data pipelines using Databricks

• Ensure efficient data storage and retrieval using Azure Storage and Data Lake

• Automate infrastructure and application deployments with Ansible

• Write clean, maintainable code in Python

• Collaborate with team members using Git and GitLab for version control and CI/CD

• Gather and document business requirements through stakeholder interviews and workshops

• Analyze and translate business needs into technical specifications

• Apply data analytics to interpret data and support business decisions

• Communicate effectively with stakeholders to manage expectations and provide project updates

• Continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and drive efficiency

• Share and contribute: Support and guide less senior team members, contribute to team spirit and dynamic growth, actively participate in wider engineering group- and product-wide activities




Skills

Must Have:

• 10+ years of data engineering/analysis experience

• Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field

• Proficient in deploying and managing services on Microsoft Azure

• Hands-on experience with Databricks for data processing and analytics

• Understanding of Azure Storage concepts and best practices

• Understanding of Microsoft Fabric concepts and best practices

• Experience in designing, implementing, and managing data lakes on Azure

• Experience in using Ansible for automation and configuration management, with proficiency in YAML

• Strong programming skills in Python for data manipulation and automation

• Proficient in version control using Git and experience with GitLab for CI/CD pipelines

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders and team members

• Strong analytical abilities to interpret data and provide actionable insights to support data-driven decision-making




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Geneva (H/F)
Description:
fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.


You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.


You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.



Responsibilities

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM.
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)



Education and Experience

Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
Experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Working with web analytics tools
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media


Skills and Interests

Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Good business and market understanding
Client-facing skills
Good team spirit
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry


55 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion.

Title: Power quantitative analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies is targeting to build a portfolio of 100 GW of renewables by 2030 and to become one of the main player in renewables worldwide. This will be achieved through many investment projects (2-4 b$/year). Trading Power will contribute to this ambition by managing financial and physical power and risks of the renewables portfolio on open markets. TEM (Trading Energy Management) performance team aims at supporting TEM in creating a profitable and sustainable portfolio by providing analyses of the profitability and risks of its different businesses (PPA portfolio, short term optimisation, etc…).

As Power Quantitative Analyst, you will develop models to support risk analyses, fundamental modelling, hedging strategies and investment decisions and make recommendation to Structured Portfolio traders and senior management. This will require dealing with complex technical and theoretical problems requiring quantitative approaches.

Activités

What you will do:

As a Power Quantitative Analyst your main responsibilities will be the following:


Specify, design & implement mathematical models to handle pricing issues & risk assessment of a portfolio of renewables assets and backtest & optimise models performance.
Run regular risk analysis of the portfolio, analyse hedging strategies and portfolio effect, and make recommendation to traders and senior management.
Work closely with structured portfolio and short term traders to support them in specific risk & pricing analysis
Manage IT-related questions (deployment, QA) directly with IT and Trading Systems team (Python / AWS / TFS) and support Trading support function (MO, operations …) with the takeover of tools developed by the team
Develop and maintain an understanding of Trading Power desks businesses and stay up to date regarding their positions and products.
Ensure support to other TGP and GRP teams on quant-related issues that may arise on their regular activity.



Profil du candidat


You hold a Master’s degree in Economics, Mathematics or Engineering
You have a first experience in a Power Trading environment
Strong modelling and analytical skills with strong attention to detail with first experience in quantitative modelling.
Basic knowledge of European and US energy markets
Programming skills (Python/ SQL/R/) and/or visualization frameworks (PowerBI/Streamlit,.) will be appreciated
Ability to work under pressure, rigor, proactivity and creativity
Good communication skills, ability to explain complex issues and present them in a clear and neat manner.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Quantitative Research Analyst
Description:
Calibrium AG is a private Investment Office that invests in a broad range of asset classes globally. We are fundamental long-term investors looking for a highly motivated and analytically minded professional to join our team as a Quantitative Research Analyst (100%). The ideal candidate possesses a practical mindset, excels at applying their skills to real-world challenges, and is adept at developing effective solutions.




You are intensely curious, have a passion for solving complex problems presented by financial markets and a strong willingness to learn and self-educate about new investment opportunities/strategies. You work diligently and have a hands-on approach. You will be reporting to the co-head of the Liquid Investment Division.







Responsibilities

Oversee the codebase, providing quality control, troubleshooting, and support
Execute ad-hoc projects that require both coding expertise and advanced quantitative skills
Support the team’s trade execution activities
Enhance existing asset allocation and portfolio construction models across both liquid and illiquid asset classes
Improve and develop the current return and risk forecasting models and optimize systematic investment strategies
Develop tactical asset allocation models informed by market and macroeconomic signals
Keep abreast of industry and academic research to identify and incorporate relevant innovations







Requirements

University degree in mathematics, statistics, econometrics, quantitative finance, computer science or physics; CFA is a plus
Strong programming skills in Python with the ability to write clear code
Exceptional analytical skills with 3+ years of experience in financial data analysis, alpha research, portfolio construction, back-testing, simulation and building quantitative non-latency sensitive trading strategies
Ability to present complex ideas in an intuitive and easy to follow manner and work in an international team
Demonstrable passion for investing and markets
Excellent command of written and spoken English; German is a plus
Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate







We offer

An environment uniquely dedicated to investing
A culture of open discussion, intellectual honesty and constructive dissent
A platform on which to improve and grow your already significant talents
Responsibility given early
Compensation commensurate with performance







Calibrium provides a challenging and fair work environment in an international team.




We only consider applications which include a motivational letter and CV (no more than 2 pages). Please send your complete application documents to: hr@clbrm.com.

Show more

Title: Quantitative Researcher, Equity Stat-Arb
Description:
This client is a senior portfolio manager with a long and successful track record at some of the world's top hedge funds at scale. This Manager has recently joined a new large fund in Switzerland and seeks to build a new team. This manager is focused on developing and deploying cutting-edge trading strategies across global markets. This manager 'genuinely' operates at the intersection of finance, data science, and technology, and he is entirely hands-on. Join a team of brilliant minds in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your contributions will make a real impact.




Role

We seek a talented and driven quantitative alpha researcher with equity statistical arbitrage strategies expertise. The ideal candidate will combine deep market knowledge with advanced quantitative skills to design, backtest, and implement innovative trading models. Proficiency in Python is essential, as you'll work extensively with data-driven research and algorithmic strategy development.




Responsibilities

Develop and refine statistical arbitrage strategies focused on equity markets.
Conduct rigorous data analysis to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and alpha opportunities.
Build and maintain robust backtesting frameworks to evaluate strategy performance.
Collaborate with data engineers to source, clean, and preprocess large datasets.
Optimize strategies for execution, considering market impact, slippage, and risk constraints.
Monitor live strategy performance and adjust as necessary to maintain alpha generation.




Qualifications

Master’s/PhD. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Probability Theory, Machine Learning, etc
Excellent understanding and experience of equity markets and statistical techniques.
Proven experience in quantitative research and strategy development. 3-7 years of experience.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, and PyTorch (or similar).
Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical modeling techniques.
Good understanding of risk management principles and portfolio optimization.
Fluency in verbal and written English.




Offered

Aggressive compensation package, including top-line performance-based bonuses. Full benefits package.
A culture of innovation and collaboration in a supportive team environment.
Access to cutting-edge technology and data resources and significant capital.
Opportunities for professional development and growth. Strong potential to progress to running and managing risk in the future.
Visa and Relocation to Switzerland.
Show more

Title: Data & Insights Analyst/Analyste de données et perspectives
HTML:
Data & Insights Analyst


Group: Digital Insights

Reports to: Lead, Data & Insights

Location: WADA Europe Office, Lausanne, Switzerland


Posting deadline: 17 January 2025


WHO WE ARE


The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) was established in 1999 as an international independent agency to lead a collaborative worldwide movement for doping-free sport. As the global regulatory body, WADA’s primary role is to develop, harmonize and coordinate anti-doping rules and policies across all sports and countries. Our key activities include: scientific and social science research; education; intelligence & investigations; development of anti-doping capacity; and, monitoring of compliance with the World Anti-Doping Program.


POSITION OVERVIEW


Within, the World Anti-Doping Agency (“WADA”) Digital Insights Impact Area (the “Impact Area”), the Data & Insights Analyst will assist the Lead of the unit in understanding complex key business problems, improving operational performance, and supporting the Agency’s strategic priorities by conducting anti-doping data analysis.


More specifically, the Data & Insights Analyst will effectively analyze, assess, process and monitor data coming from a variety of sources and will disseminate within the Organization strategic and operational insights.


The Data & Insights Analyst will contribute to the development and implementation of a data-led system to assess, identify and report on doping trends, threats and patterns worldwide, for informed decision-making, and strengthen and monitor WADA’s Anti-Doping strategies and operations.


Working under the supervision of the Lead, the Data & Insights Analyst will be an essential member of the WADA’s Digital Insights Unit.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Create and maintain rich and user-friendly interactive visualizations and dashboards, with reporting components;
  • Improve the Organization operational performance by automating the data extraction, increasing data quality and integrating data coming from multiple sources;
  • Explore solutions to improve knowledge on doping trends and patterns to feed the Organization anti-doping programs;
  • Contribute to and support various strategic projects and reports for executives, project teams and stakeholders;
  • Proactively analyze data to answer key questions for WADA or their stakeholders;
  • Contribute to the evaluation of the organization’s methods, to the creation of best-practice documents regarding data analysis processes and the development of an internal network of data practitioners;
  • Generate information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns;
  • Develop and deliver useable solutions under ascribed deadlines;
  • Work effectively with a cross-functional team.


QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS


  • Bachelor or Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Applied Statistics and/or Data Analytics or related fields (background in forensic science is an asset), with 3 or more years’ professional experience;
  • Proven experience in the analysis of data for strategic and operational intelligence purposes. Experience in Anti-Doping is a plus;
  • Experience in a similar position is an asset;
  • Proven experience working with dimensional and relational databases, data analysis methodology, BI tools (e.g. Power BI and Tableau) and programming (e.g. SQL, R or Python);
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills – the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data;
  • Experience in qualitative and quantitative data analysis is an asset;
  • Highly developed interpersonal and collaborative skills;
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Ability to work quickly and accurately, with or without supervision, or as part of a cross-functional team and organization, in a structured and organized manner;
  • Strong documentation and presentation skills – ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand;
  • Excellent oral and written skills in one of the two WADA official languages (English/French) and good command of the other official language. Spanish or other languages would be an asset;
  • Periodic evening and/or weekend work expected;
  • No travel required;
  • Fit with organizational culture: Teamwork, team spirit and love of sport;
  • Aligned with WADA core values: Integrity, Openness and Excellence.


WHAT WE OFFER


  • Working with great colleagues, for a good cause;
  • Retirement plan contribution very competitive;
  • Group Insurance 100% premium covered by WADA (effective first day of employment);
  • Annual wellness subsidy;
  • Professional development and growth opportunities;
  • Hybrid work environment (a mix of office and home-based work);
  • Reimbursement of monthly internet costs (capped amount per month) after probation period.



The masculine is used in our communications for the sole purpose of lightening the text and it designates all genders. WADA believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. All qualified candidates will be considered for this position in a fair manner. WADA would like to thank all candidates who have shown an interest by applying for a position. However, after a thorough profile review, only the retained candidates will be contacted.


Vision: WADA’s vision is a world where all athletes compete in a doping-free sporting environment.

Mission: WADA's mission is to lead a collaborative worldwide movement for doping-free sport.

About us: WADA is headquartered in Montreal, Canada and has regional offices in Cape Town, South Africa; Lausanne, Switzerland; Montevideo, Uruguay; Tokyo, Japan and the office of the President in Warsaw, Poland. As of March 2024, the Agency employs approximately 181 employees and is represented by 58 nationalities. We value the diversity of our employees – current and future – that, as a global team, endeavor every day to protect the rights of clean athletes worldwide.

Title: Analyste Data Quality & Gouvernance des Données
Description:
Talan est un cabinet de conseil en innovation et transformation par la technologie. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille les entreprises et les administrations, les accompagne et met en œuvre leurs projets de transformation et d’innovation en France et à l’international.



Présent dans 21 pays, le Groupe met l’innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines liés aux mutations technologiques des grands groupes, comme le Big Data, l’IoT, la Blockchain et l’Intelligence Artificielle.



Pour la 9ème année consécutive, Talan est lauréat du palmarès des entreprises françaises où il fait bon travailler.



Présent à Genève et à Lausanne Talan Suisse compte aujourd’hui près de150 collaborateurs. Initialement investi dans le secteur financier, Talan s’est développé ces dernières années dans les secteurs de l’horlogerie, des assurances, des médias et des services.





Job Description







Administration et gestion de la plateforme de Data Catalogue pour garantir une gestion optimale des données.
Développement et mise en œuvre des standards, procédures et meilleures pratiques en matière de qualité des données.
Intégration des sources de données et collaboration avec les équipes techniques (DBA, IT) pour optimiser la gestion et le traitement des données.
Suivi de la conformité aux normes et standards de qualité des données, en particulier pour les données critiques au sein de l’organisation.
Coordination des actions de gestion de la qualité des données avec les parties prenantes internes, y compris les propriétaires et responsables des données.
Production de rapports et de tableaux de bord mensuels pour surveiller la qualité des données à travers la banque.
Résolution proactive des problèmes de qualité des données en collaboration avec les équipes transverses et la direction de la conformité et des risques.
Utilisation d’outils de gestion de la qualité des données, tels que Talend Data Quality, pour assurer la conformité aux exigences internes et externes.


Qualifications


Diplômé d’une école d’ingénieur (ou équivalent) en informatique, gestion des données ou domaine similaire.
Environ 5 ans d'expérience dans la gestion de la qualité des données, la gouvernance des données et la gestion des données dans un environnement bancaire, idéalement dans le secteur de la banque privée.
Connaissances des langages SQL et Python
Une expérience en administration de Data Catalogue est requise
Connaissance des exigences réglementaires liées aux données critiques et des outils de gestion de la qualité des données (profilage des données, gestion des risques de données).
Français et anglais courants.
Capacité à travailler en équipe, à communiquer efficacement (écrit et oral) et à gérer les parties prenantes de manière proactive.
Forte capacité d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes, avec une bonne gestion de projet et une capacité à piloter des actions.


Additional Information


Taux d’activité : 100%
Type de contrat : CDI
Show more

Title: Biostatistiker:in / Daten Analyst
Description:
60 %

Veterinary Public Health Institut, DCR-VPH, Vetsuisse-Fakultät, Universität Bern sucht

zum 01.03.2025 oder nach Vereinbarung

Aufgaben

Die Stelle beinhaltet zu ca 50% statistische Beratung von Forschungsprojekten (v.a. klinische Studien und Beobachtungsstudien) an der Vetsuisse Fakultät der Universität Bern, sowie institutsinterne Unterstützung bei fortgeschrittenen statistischen Analysemethoden und Data Science (u.a. Machine Learning). Dabei werden Sie mit verschiedenen Masterstudierenden und Doktorierenden und deren Betreuungspersonen zusammenarbeiten. Die Beratung beinhaltet neben der Unterstützung bei der statistischen Auswertung der Daten auch Fragen im Bereich des Studien Designs, sowie ggf. Mithilfe beim Verfassen von wissenschaftlichen Publikationen.

Zudem werden Sie zu einem kleineren Teil (ca 10%) bei der Lehre mitwirken. Dies beinhaltet Lehre in Biostatistik für Tiermedizin-Studierende, sowie bei Kursen für PhD Studierende der Universität Bern.

Anforderungen


Master in Biostatistik, Epidemiologie oder einer naturwissenschaftlichen Disziplin
Sehr gute Statistikkenntnisse und Erfahrung mit statistischen Softwares (R, Python, STATA, NCSS)
Erfahrung in wissenschaftlichen Publikationen von Vorteil
Ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung und Verhandlungsgeschick
Didaktische Ausbildung und Lehrerfahrung von Vorteil
Fähigkeit, technische Begriffe an Laien verständlich zu vermitteln
Belastbarkeit und die Fähigkeit, viele Projekte parallel zu bearbeiten


Wir bieten

Wir bieten ein aktives wissenschaftliches Umfeld in einem veterinärepidemiologischen Forschungsinstitut mit rund 15 Personen. Zu den Forschungsschwerpunkten des VPHI gehören angewandte Forschung zur Modellierung von Infektionskrankheiten, die Überwachung und Kontrolle der Tiergesundheit und von Zoonosen, Tiergesundheitsökonomie, sowie One Health. Das Institut bietet eine offene Team-Kultur mit vielen Interaktionen zwischen den Forschungsprojekten.

Die Stelle ist sehr abwechlungsreich in Bezug auf die zu betreuenden Forschungsprojekte, sowie in der zwischenmenschlichen Zusammenarbeit.

Die Entlöhnung erfolgt nach universitären Richtlinien.

Die Stelle ist auf 2 Jahre befristet mit der Option auf Festanstellung.

Bewerbung und Kontakt

Für fachliche Auskünfte zur Stelle steht Ihnen Frau Salome Dürr (salome.duerr@unibe.ch oder 031 684 5739) oder Herr Ioannis Magouras (ioannis.magouras@unibe.ch oder 031 684 5744) zur Verfügung

Ihre Bewerbung mit den üblichen Unterlagen senden Sie bitte

elektronisch

bis am


Januar 2025


an salome.duerr@unibe.ch.

www.karriere.unibe.ch Rechtliche Hinweise

Jetzt bewerben

Title: Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:


Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat


Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more
HTML:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:

  • Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
  • Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
  • Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
  • Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
  • Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
  • Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat

  • Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
  • 2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
  • Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Int. E-Commerce Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We would like to talk to you about the opportunity to join our International E-Commerce department for 6 months as Int. E-Commerce Business Intelligence Analyst.

In this role, you will have to understand and identify key trends and opportunities to drive the E-Commerce growth, and ensure strategic thinking on the future of the online user experience.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

Business Analysis


Follow the E-Commerce performance evolution through various angles and provide insights on latest trends
For one key product category, conduct in-depth analysis and monitor all E-Commerce KPIs
Work in close collaboration with the markets and other International teams to share key insights on business evolution
Comment the overall performance of the E-Commerce channel and take part in the preparation of global performance reviews
Proactively find new growth opportunities in line with the Maison and E-Commerce strategy and coordinate implementation with appropriate stakeholders
Benchmark Cartier E-Commerce with other key players within the Group and the industry
Understand client data and user journeys on the website


Data visualization and dashboarding


Support markets and develop user adoption
Innovate and propose new data visualizations to facilitate understanding and adoption of new concepts
Enhance reports and propose new ideas to optimize existing ones


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?


You have a Master’s degree in Business / Engineering or related fields
You have a first experience in business analysis in commercial, finance, marketing, or supply chain
You master data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, Tableau…
You have an analytical mindset and are detail-oriented
You possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a great team-spirit
You have a digital appetence and are at ease with complex and fast-moving ecosystem
You speak English and French fluently


WHAT DO WE OFFER?


We are fully transparent and share with you: Maison strategies, key information & needs of other Corporate Departments.
We create a positive environment where we are proud to employ talent from multiple backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that when diversity and inclusion are fully embraced and empowered, creativity and knowledge emerge to deliver excellence. We continue to work towards creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our clients and our communities.
We constantly develop you with trainings, continuous learning, and feedback culture. Building a healthy and strong feedback culture, where you will feel entitled to give an honest opinion, is essential to us.


YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

If your application is selected, we will give you an introductory call to further discuss the opportunity, and next steps. If things go well on both ends, you will have a chance to meet the Int. Head of E-Commerce Development & Operations and the HR Business Partner.

Title: Analista de Dados Jr
Description:
Na DHL Express, cada indivíduo é único e as diferenças contribuem e promovem um ambiente inclusivo baseado em valores e ações. Acreditamos que a diversidade nos fortalece e, dessa forma, reunimos em nosso time a pluralidade de cores, crenças, culturas, deficiências, idades, identidades de gênero, nacionalidades, orientações sexuais, raças, religiões...”

Você quer fazer a diferença? Então venha para a nossa equipe “Intensamente Focada nos Clientes” e se torne um Especialista Internacional Certificado!

Consideramos, para todas as nossas vagas, candidatos PcD. Junte-se a nós!

RESPONSABILIDADES:



Análise e Relatórios de Dados: Coletar, analisar e interpretar dados jurídicos, desenvolver relatórios e painéis para acompanhar KPIs e apoiar a tomada de decisões.
Atividades Administrativas: Consolidar informações processuais para fechamento financeiro, manter relação com a equipe financeira, atualizar sistemas jurídicos, apoiar auditorias e controlar o orçamento anual.
Pesquisa Jurídica e Desenvolvimento Profissional: Manter-se atualizado com mudanças legislativas, participar de desenvolvimento profissional contínuo e comitês regionais.
Colaboração e Trabalho em Equipe: Colaborar com a equipe jurídica e outros departamentos, melhorar processos e fluxos de trabalho, e implementar estratégias para eficiência operacional.
Ética Profissional: Garantir confidencialidade e integridade das informações, aderindo a padrões éticos e regulamentos.
Melhoria de Processos: Avaliar e otimizar processos jurídicos, automatizar tarefas repetitivas e promover melhorias contínuas.
Gestão de Tecnologia Jurídica: Implementar e manter ferramentas de tecnologia jurídica como sistemas de gestão de contratos e faturação eletrônica.
Relatório: Utilização de Power BI para análise de dados e controle de orçamento mensal.
Esta atividade será diretamente subordinada ao Diretor Jurídico. Irá apoiar as unidades de negócio da Express e DGF



REQUISITOS:



Graduação completa ou em andamento em Administração ou áreas de Tecnologia.
Experiência com Excel, Data Analytics e Power BI.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicação oral e escrita.
Fortes habilidades analíticas e capacidade de resolver problemas de forma eficaz.
Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipe.
Compromisso com o desenvolvimento profissional contínuo e adesão aos princípios éticos da profissão jurídica.
Inglês intermediário.
Espanhol será considerado um diferencial.



NOSSA OFERTA:



Ambiente de trabalho dinâmico e colaborativo.
Oportunidades de crescimento e desenvolvimento profissional.
Benefícios competitivos e remuneração atrativa.
Participação em programas de treinamento e capacitação.



Você vê um desafio pessoal nessas atividades? Então se candidate agora!

Nós estamos ansiosos para receber a sua inscrição!

Title: Analista Dados Junior
Description:
Você quer desempenhar um papel essencial na construção de um futuro mais sustentável, trabalhando em projetos que geram impacto significativo na sociedade e no meio ambiente? 🌍

Se você é movido(a) pela busca por soluções inovadoras que maximizam a criação de valor e impulsionam a transformação digital, essa é sua chance de se juntar à nossa equipe na Siemens!

Com mais de 100 anos de história no Brasil, buscamos transformar nossa excelência em eletrificação, automação e digitalização em soluções de ponta que rompem barreiras e levam inovação a milhões de brasileiros. 🚀

Quer fazer parte desse time?

Veja nossa oportunidade de Analista Dados Junior

Quais serão suas responsabilidades?


Coletar, analisar e interpretar dados relacionados à entrada de pedidos, gestão de estoques e operações da cadeia de suprimentos.
Criar relatórios detalhados e dashboards que destaquem os indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPIs), como precisão dos pedidos, tempos de processamento, níveis de estoque e desempenho de entrega.
Identificar tendências, dificuldades e áreas potenciais de melhoria nos processos de entrada de pedidos e suprimentos.
Apresentar os resultados das análises de dados e recomendações para a gestão e partes interessadas relevantes.
Monitorar o processo de entrada de pedidos para garantir a precisão dos dados e o processamento oportuno dos pedidos dos clientes.
Auxiliar na análise de ordens de compra (POs) e ordens de venda, garantindo a devida documentação e entrada nos sistemas, como SAP ou outras plataformas ERP.
Ajudar a identificar e resolver discrepâncias de dados ou problemas relacionados ao processamento de pedidos.
Colaborar com a equipe de entrada de pedidos para otimizar os fluxos de trabalho, reduzindo erros e atrasos.


Quais requisitos estamos buscando?


Formação Superior Completa em Administração de Empresas, Engenharia e Tecnologia da Informação.
Conhecimento em ferramentas de análise de dados como SAP, Excel, Power BI, Tableau ou plataformas semelhantes.
Compreensão básica de SQL ou outras ferramentas de gestão de banco de dados.
Inglês avançado.


Local de trabalho e modelo de contratação:


CLT, modelo híbrido (home office em alguns dias da semana!)
Anhanguera - São Paulo


Se você se identifica com o que estamos procurando, venha se aplicar!

A Siemens oferece, além de equipes diversas, cooperativas e dinâmicas, um pacote de benefício amplo e voltado a bem-estar e qualidade de vida, contando com participação em lucros e resultados, modelo híbrido de atuação e diversos outros ganhos e facilidades, quer conhecer mais? Acesse nossa página de benefícios!

Venha conosco construir o futuro!

Title: Analista de Dados Júnior
Description:
🚘 Trabalhar na Kavak é…

Fazer parte de um time global que incentiva inovação e criatividade, em um ambiente onde a multidisciplinaridade se destaca. Aqui, diferentes perspectivas se unem para desenvolver soluções que revolucionam o mercado automotivo e a experiência do cliente. Cada ideia é valorizada e todos têm a chance de transformar o futuro. Se você busca projetos desafiadores e disruptivos, a KAVAK é o seu lugar.




🚘 Missão dessa posição: O Analista de Dados atuará diretamente na equipe de Dados, sendo responsável por dar suporte de dados às demais áreas da empresa como um todo. Essa pessoa atuará na criação e manutenção de bases de dados, criação de estudos, melhorias de processos envolvendo dados, criação e manutenção de dashboards utilizando Tableau, e criação e manutenção de aplicações low code.




🚘 Descrição de Atividades:

Entender como os dados facilitam o dia dia dos times e identificar oportunidades de melhorias de processos envolvendo dados;

Utilizar SQL para extrair e manipular dados;

Auxílio na manutenção de dashboards e relatórios que forneçam insights acionáveis;




🚘Requisitos para candidatura:

Formação Superior em Tecnologia, Matemática, Estatística, Economia, Engenharia ou áreas relacionadas;

Imprescindível: conhecimento intermediário / avançado em SQL;

Conhecimento intermediário/avançado em Excel / Google Sheets;




🚘 Requisitos Desejáveis (não eliminatórios):

Conhecimento em ferramentas de visualização de dados (Looker Studio ou Tableau)




🚘 O que a Kavak te proporciona:

Assistência Médica e Odontológica para você e seus dependentes
WellHub (GymPass): Nossa plataforma de bem-estar, que proporciona atividades físicas e cuidados com a saúde mental.
Vale-Refeição e/ou Alimentação: Crédito depositado no Cartão Flash, para você escolher onde e como utilizar.
Auxílio Mobilidade ou Vale Transporte: Flexibilidade para que você escolha o benefício que melhor se adapta ao seu dia a dia.
Estacionamento Gratuito no Local: Para quem prefere vir de carro, oferecemos estacionamento sem custo.
Transporte Fretado (sem desconto): Transporte fretado à disposição, proporcionando mais conforto e segurança no trajeto.
Seguro de Vida: Segurança adicional para você e sua família.
Amparo: Estaremos ao seu lado e de sua família quando estiverem lidando com uma perda. Auxiliando em todos os desafios administrativos, financeiros e emocionais decorrentes da perda de um ente querido.
Day Off de Aniversário: Celebre seu dia com uma folga exclusiva.
Empréstimo Consignado: Acesso facilitado a crédito com taxas mais baixas, ajudando no planejamento financeiro.
Incentivos a Idiomas (Nulinga): apoio para você investir no seu desenvolvimento com cursos de idiomas com descontos atrativos, ampliando seu potencial de comunicação.
Programa de Bônus Kavak: Recompensas com base em metas e performance, valorizando o seu esforço e dedicação.
Desconto para compra de carros: você pode escolher o carro seminovo ou usado dos seus sonhos, dentro do inventário da Kavak, com desconto exclusivo para Kavakes e ainda contar com 4 revisões a um valor simbólico, de acordo com nossa política vigente.




🚘Modelo de trabalho e local:

Modelo Híbrido: 3 dias presencial e 2 home office.
Local de Trabalho: Kavak City - Barueri - SP.




Etapas do processo:

Bate papo com o RH;

Bate papo com o gestor + case.




Sobre a Kavak

A Kavak traz ao mercado um modelo de negócios pioneiro que compreende a compra e venda online e serviços para veículos seminovos e usados, proporcionando uma experiência transparente e segura. No Brasil desde 2021, está presente também no México, Argentina, Chile, Turquia e Oriente Médio propondo a transformação no setor automotivo por meio de tecnologia e inovação. A Kavak se tornou a primeira empresa unicórnio da história do México e, atualmente, é uma das startups mais valiosas da América Latina.

Show more
HTML:
🚘 Trabalhar na Kavak é…

Fazer parte de um time global que incentiva inovação e criatividade, em um ambiente onde a multidisciplinaridade se destaca. Aqui, diferentes perspectivas se unem para desenvolver soluções que revolucionam o mercado automotivo e a experiência do cliente. Cada ideia é valorizada e todos têm a chance de transformar o futuro. Se você busca projetos desafiadores e disruptivos, a KAVAK é o seu lugar.


🚘 Missão dessa posição: O Analista de Dados atuará diretamente na equipe de Dados, sendo responsável por dar suporte de dados às demais áreas da empresa como um todo. Essa pessoa atuará na criação e manutenção de bases de dados, criação de estudos, melhorias de processos envolvendo dados, criação e manutenção de dashboards utilizando Tableau, e criação e manutenção de aplicações low code.


🚘 Descrição de Atividades:

Entender como os dados facilitam o dia dia dos times e identificar oportunidades de melhorias de processos envolvendo dados;

Utilizar SQL para extrair e manipular dados;

Auxílio na manutenção de dashboards e relatórios que forneçam insights acionáveis;


🚘Requisitos para candidatura:

Formação Superior em Tecnologia, Matemática, Estatística, Economia, Engenharia ou áreas relacionadas;

Imprescindível: conhecimento intermediário / avançado em SQL;

Conhecimento intermediário/avançado em Excel / Google Sheets;


🚘 Requisitos Desejáveis (não eliminatórios):

Conhecimento em ferramentas de visualização de dados (Looker Studio ou Tableau)


🚘 O que a Kavak te proporciona:

  • Assistência Médica e Odontológica para você e seus dependentes
  • WellHub (GymPass): Nossa plataforma de bem-estar, que proporciona atividades físicas e cuidados com a saúde mental.
  • Vale-Refeição e/ou Alimentação: Crédito depositado no Cartão Flash, para você escolher onde e como utilizar.
  • Auxílio Mobilidade ou Vale Transporte: Flexibilidade para que você escolha o benefício que melhor se adapta ao seu dia a dia.
  • Estacionamento Gratuito no Local: Para quem prefere vir de carro, oferecemos estacionamento sem custo.
  • Transporte Fretado (sem desconto): Transporte fretado à disposição, proporcionando mais conforto e segurança no trajeto.
  • Seguro de Vida: Segurança adicional para você e sua família.
  • Amparo: Estaremos ao seu lado e de sua família quando estiverem lidando com uma perda. Auxiliando em todos os desafios administrativos, financeiros e emocionais decorrentes da perda de um ente querido.
  • Day Off de Aniversário: Celebre seu dia com uma folga exclusiva.
  • Empréstimo Consignado: Acesso facilitado a crédito com taxas mais baixas, ajudando no planejamento financeiro.
  • Incentivos a Idiomas (Nulinga): apoio para você investir no seu desenvolvimento com cursos de idiomas com descontos atrativos, ampliando seu potencial de comunicação.
  • Programa de Bônus Kavak: Recompensas com base em metas e performance, valorizando o seu esforço e dedicação.
  • Desconto para compra de carros: você pode escolher o carro seminovo ou usado dos seus sonhos, dentro do inventário da Kavak, com desconto exclusivo para Kavakes e ainda contar com 4 revisões a um valor simbólico, de acordo com nossa política vigente.


🚘Modelo de trabalho e local:

  • Modelo Híbrido: 3 dias presencial e 2 home office.
  • Local de Trabalho: Kavak City - Barueri - SP.


Etapas do processo:

Bate papo com o RH;

Bate papo com o gestor + case.


Sobre a Kavak

A Kavak traz ao mercado um modelo de negócios pioneiro que compreende a compra e venda online e serviços para veículos seminovos e usados, proporcionando uma experiência transparente e segura. No Brasil desde 2021, está presente também no México, Argentina, Chile, Turquia e Oriente Médio propondo a transformação no setor automotivo por meio de tecnologia e inovação. A Kavak se tornou a primeira empresa unicórnio da história do México e, atualmente, é uma das startups mais valiosas da América Latina.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
In Numia facciamo dell'innovazione e della digitalizzazione dei pagamenti il nostro core business, offrendo alle banche prodotti e servizi di monetica ad alto potenziale innovativo.


Grazie alla sinergia tra le diverse componenti funzionali e tecnologiche, offriamo una risposta tempestiva ai mutamenti di mercato ed alle esigenze della clientela con soluzioni tecnologiche all’avanguardia.


Siamo una IMEL (Istituto di Monetica Elettronica) che conta circa 8 milioni di carte di pagamento e 400.000 POS.


Per l'Unità Organizzativa Fraud Prevention & Analytics, siamo alla ricerca di Data Analyst per il nostro team di Roma.


Entrerai a far parte di un contesto in espansione e continua evoluzione e, tra le principali attività, potrai:

  • Curare l'analisi di grandi set di dati e la relativa reportistica;
  • Supportare lo sviluppo di modelli predittivi per la prevenzione delle frodi;
  • Comprendere le esigenze dei diversi team aziendali al fine di fornire soluzioni data-driven.


Se il progetto ti appassiona e hai i seguenti requisiti, Join Us!

  • Esperienza, anche breve, in ruoli di Data Analysis;
  • Buona conoscenza di SQL;
  • Esperienza nell’uso di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Power BI;
  • Conoscenza di Python per l’analisi dati;
  • Familiarità con strumenti di Data Wrangling e pulizia dei dati;
  • Capacità di presentare i dati in modo chiaro e intuitivo attraverso dashboard e report;
  • Conoscenza base degli aspetti operativi e sistemistici di macchine Linux.


Unendoti al Team Numia troverai:

  • Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e positivo, dove la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
  • Colleghi competenti e collaborativi, con i quali potrai sempre confrontarti e mettere a fattor comune le reciproche conoscenze e capacità
  • Possibilità di esprimere il tuo talento in un contesto in forte crescita e orientato all’innovazione


Ti abbiamo incuriosit*? Se possiedi buone doti relazionali e comunicative, inviaci la tua candidatura all’indirizzo mail selezione@numia.com.


Prima di candidarti, leggi attentamente la nostra informativa sulla privacy https://www.numia.com/Pagine/Utility/Privacy.aspx


Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi, nel rispetto dei D.Lgs. 98/2006 e 151/2015, e a persone di ogni età e nazionalità, razza e origine etnica, orientamento sessuale, disabilità, religione o stato civile, nel rispetto dei D.Lgs. n. 215/2003 e 216/2003.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Zenith Global è un intermediario finanziario, iscritto all'Albo Unico ex art. 106 T.U.B., specializzato nella gestione di operazioni di finanza strutturata in Italia. Operativa dal 1999, Zenith è il primo operatore ad aver ottenuto (nel 2004) il rating di Master Servicer da parte dell’agenzia Standard & Poor’s. Nel 2023 Zenith ha altresì ottenuto la certificazione Great Place to Work.


Zenith Global è parte del Gruppo Arrow Global Ltd che, ad ottobre 2021, è stato acquisito dal fondo di private equity TDR Capital. TDR Capital è uno dei più grandi fondi di private equity nel mercato europeo, con oltre €10 miliardi di capitale investito.


Zenith Global è una realtà in forte crescita, per poter gestire al meglio il suo sviluppo, è alla costante ricerca di talenti che desiderino abbracciare una nuova ed avvincente sfida. Il team Data Governance riveste un ruolo chiave all’interno di Zenith Global e per poterlo debitamente rafforzare siamo alla ricerca di Data Analyst che svolgano attività di analisi e rendicontazione delle operazioni di cartolarizzazione.


Principali responsabilità:

  • Supporto operativo all’ufficio Data Quality & Optimization per l’upload dei dati anagrafici nel sistema gestionale aziendale, oltre che delle cessioni e dei crediti inclusi gli asset immobiliari;
  • Verifica e quadratura dei dati di input rispetto alle regole di importazione previsti dal modello dati utilizzato.
  • Supporto all’analisi sui dati ricevuti (gap analysis tra quanto richiesto dal tracciato GAIA e quanto ricevuto dal Sub-Servicer) e confronto con le controparti sulla corretta compilazione delle informazioni necessarie per le finalità di vigilanza, reportistica, centrale rischi, bilanci, costo ammortizzato;
  • Supporto operativo al download e alla elaborazione delle movimentazioni dei conti correnti delle SPV per le quali Zenith svolge l’attività di Master Servicer e, se necessario, l’abbinamento, la riconciliazione e i sospesi tra i debitori e gli incassi sui conti;
  • Supporto operativo alle attività di antiriciclaggio, lavorando a stretto giro con i referenti del gruppo AML, inserendo sul sistema gestionale i dati degli ordinanti come richiesto da normativa;
  • Implementazione di soluzioni tecniche volte a rendere più efficiente l’operatività limitando il più possibile ogni rischio operativo, con la finalità di ottimizzare e semplificare i processi e disegnando nuove procedure;
  • Elaborazione di manualistica, sia ai fini operativi che tecnica dopo le release di sviluppi e fix riguardanti i software utilizzati;
  • Monitoraggio dei report del Data Quality per individuare e quindi sanare anomalie dei dati caricati sul gestionale, quindi eventuale sviluppo di software per rendere più preciso e affidabile lo strumento di controllo;
  • Inserimento di cedenti, originator, investitori e notes, quindi all'operazione BI, ruoli sul gestionale rispetto alle comunicazioni del weekly e monitorando gli sviluppi societari;
  • Produzione di elaborati/reportistica per le finalità contrattuali, interne o esterne all'azienda.


Requisiti preferenziali:

  • Diploma tecnico e/o laurea in materie scientifiche;
  • Buona conoscenza del Pacchetto Office (in particolar modo di Excel e Power Point);
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta);
  • Costituirà requisito preferenziale la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione T-SQL e strumenti BI come QlikView o PowerBI.


Completano il profilo:

  • Proattività e dinamicità;
  • Voglia di imparare;
  • Propensione al problem solving;
  • Senso di responsabilità e riservatezza;
  • Predisposizione a lavorare in team.
  • Predisposizione a lavorare in autonomia con scadenze prefissate.


Chi cerchiamo:

­Vorremmo incontrare giovani neo-laureati che abbiano terminato il proprio percorso di studi e abbiano, eventualmente, maturato una prima esperienza in ambito lavorativo.


Cosa offriamo:

  • ­ Un’esperienza professionale in un ambiente dinamico, giovanile e in forte crescita;
  • ­ L’opportunità di apprendere e consolidare competenze tecniche specifiche;
  • ­ La possibilità di confrontarsi con interlocutori di rilievo, a livello nazionale ed internazionale;
  • ­ L’opportunità di crescere all’interno di una realtà solida, in forte crescita e dal respiro internazionale.

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
Description:
Adecco Italia S.p.A., per multinazionale cliente operante nel settore della mobilità, ricerca:




JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La risorsa sarà inserita all’interno della Divisione Marketing e Business Development in un contesto fortemente dinamico ed orientato all’analisi dei dati.




Principali attività




Creazione e gestione di report per le diverse direzioni aziendali
Monitoraggio dei KPI aziendali
Supporto per elaborazione di bdgt e forecast
Analisi dati per fini analitici, predittivi e strategici
Gestione di comitati interni
Elaborazione di presentazioni strategiche




Requisiti




Laurea in Matematica/Statistica, discipline economiche
Gradita esperienza pregressa in contesti aziendali automotive, su progetti di Datawarehouse e di Business Intelligence con avanzato uso di strumenti di analisi dati e reporting
Gradita esperienza nella realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Intelligence e Analytics (Report, Dashboard, Data Modeling)
Conoscenza di DB relazionali con utilizzo di join complesse tra tabelle, costruzioni di query attraverso l’utilizzo del linguaggio SQL
Attività di analisi con applicativi quali SAS (es guide o SAS Base)
Gradita conoscenza di QLIKsense come strumento di reporting
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e del pacchetto Office (Power point, Access, Word)
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
Buone capacità relazionali e comunicative con una spiccata capacità di lavorare in team




Sede: Roma.

Contratto: iniziale contratto di somministrazione a tempo determinato semestrale. Ral 32K. Buoni pasto.







I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l’informativa sulla privacy.

Facsimile di domanda disponibile al seguente link Facsimile domanda candidatura.

ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa al seguente link.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
EY Technology Consulting

Junior Data Analyst

Unisciti al nostro team AI&DATA a Milano, Roma, Bari, Cagliari e Trieste e dai una svolta alla tua carriera entrando in EY.

Chi è EY?

EY è una delle società Big 4 della consulenza. Quello che ci caratterizza rispetto alle altre aziende è la possibilità di trasformare il business e il modo di lavorare dei nostri clienti, che siano grandi multinazionali, piccole imprese o pubbliche amministrazioni. La nostra cultura del lavoro si basa sulla fiducia, l’autonomia e il rispetto tra le persone, ed è incentrata sul raggiungimento dei risultati attraverso una modalità di lavoro ibrida.

#TELLMEY – Cosa dicono di noi

Questi sono i fattori più influenti che hanno spinto colleghe e colleghi a sceglierci nel 2024!

  • Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all’anno di formazione per ciascuna persona;
  • Progressione di carriera: solo negli ultimi 12 mesi il 65% delle persone di EY si è vista riconoscere un avanzamento di carriera;
  • Salary e Benefits: con un’ampia gamma di convenzioni aziendali, dalla palestra allo shopping, fino a servizi gratuiti di telemedicina e supporto psicologico;
  • Mobilità e opportunità internazionali, compresa la possibilità di lavorare dall’estero fino a 20 giorni senza essere in trasferta;
  • Smart working senza giornate prestabilite centralmente.

Per il ruolo di Junior Data Analyst, ti occuperai di:

  • definizione dei requisiti di business;
  • identificazione dei dati pertinenti e necessari per le analisi di business;
  • determinare e individuare, collaborando con i Data Engineer, le fonti dati appropriate a soddisfare i requisiti di business, per determinare nuovi processi atti a migliorare la raccolta dei dati per l’analisi;
  • attività di profilatura, pulizia e trasformazione dei dati;
  • creazione di modelli dati scalabili ed efficienti per finalità di reporting.
  • analisi e visualizzazione dei dati attraverso l’utilizzo di tecnologie come data mining, data exploration, Power BI, QlikSense, Tableau, per la generazione di insight che rispondano alle domande degli stakeholder di business
  • gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall’esigenza di business, alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi (storytelling dei dati)

Chi stiamo cercando? Persone con:

  • Laurea in materie ingegneristiche o scientifiche
  • Almeno 1 anno di esperienza nel ruolo
  • Buona competenze di sviluppo front-end con tecnologia Power BI;
  • Buona conoscenza del linguaggio SQL;
  • Conoscenza di PowerQuery;
  • Buona conoscenza del linguaggio DAX;
  • Competenze in ambito statistico;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Italiano a livello professionale

Sarebbe bello anche se avessi:

  • la certificazione PL-300 – Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst

Cosa ti aspetta in EY 

  • Progetti di ogni tipo per clienti di ogni settore;
  • + 450.000 ore di formazione erogate per accrescere le tue competenze tecniche e il tuo talento personale;
  • Un Counselor che ti supporterà nel tuo percorso professionale;
  • Policy di smart working flessibile e possibilità di lavorare dall’estero; 
  • Benefits e programmi di welfare aziendale diversificati.

EY promuove la diversità, l’equità e l’inclusione, valorizzando l’unicità, indipendentemente da età, genere, abilità, esperienza, cultura, orientamento sessuale, religione, disabilità e background socioeconomico. Tutte le nostre offerte di lavoro si rivolgono allo stesso modo a persone con disabilità, in conformità con la legge italiana L. 68/99. Il nostro obiettivo è creare un ambiente di lavoro equo e accessibile.

 

The exceptional EY experience, it’s yours to build

Apply!

Title: BNL BNP Paribas – Junior Data Analyst TD (m/f/x)
Description:
Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas, significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in più di 70 paesi con circa 199 mila collaboratori. Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all’innovazione.

Cosa farai concretamente?

Contribuirai ad assicurare le attività di pianificazione commerciale della Rete Commerciale di BNL, la produzione e distribuzione dei dati e delle informazioni necessarie per la gestione commerciale ed il raggiungimento degli obiettivi assegnati e la predisposizione ed il monitoraggio dei sistemi incentivanti di Rete.

Il/la Candidato/a Ideale


È un profilo tecnico in possesso del titolo di Laurea Triennale. Risulta requisito preferenziale la presenza di precedenti esperienze professionali in area reporting, monitoraggio e analisi dati.
È in possesso di buone capacità di analisi e interpretazione dati.
È in possesso di buona conoscenza del pacchetto Microsoft Office (in particolare Excel, Access, Power Query, VBA/SQL)
È capace di lavorare per obiettivi.
È in possesso di una buona capacità di pianificazione e organizzazione del lavoro.
Presenta una significativa attenzione verso i dettagli e precisione.
È capace di lavorare in team.
È in possesso di una buona capacità di problem solving.
È in possesso di una buona capacità di delivery/orientamento al risultato.
Conoscenza della lingua inglese a livello intermedio.


La Nostra Offerta

Ti offriamo l’inserimento nel ruolo attraverso affiancamenti mirati, formazione tecnica su processi, procedure e prodotti e formazione comportamentale.

Il contratto previsto è a tempo determinato, la retribuzione segue quanto previsto dal Contratto Collettivo Nazionale del Credito

Sedi di lavoro

Roma

In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l’inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate.

Cosa aspetti? Candidati per il ruolo di Commercial Planning Specialist e costruiremo insieme, passo dopo passo, la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile. Il tuo futuro professionale nel Gruppo BNP Paribas ti aspetta!

Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunità)

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Descrizione dell'Azienda

Atumtek è un protagonista nell'innovazione tecnologica per il settore assicurativo e bancassicurativo. Come abilitatore insurtech, supportiamo la trasformazione digitale di compagnie assicurative, banche, broker e intermediari, promuovendo un ambiente dinamico e incentrato sull'innovazione.




Posizione aperta: Junior Data Analyst/ETL Developer

Ricerchiamo un Junior Data Analyst/ETL Developer da inserire nel team Data Platform della nostra software factory interna. Sarai coinvolto nel disegno, nell’implementazione e nell’evoluzione delle nostre piattaforme, oltre che nello sviluppo di soluzioni E2E innovative in ambito Data & Analytics per il settore assicurativo.




Competenze richieste:

RDBMS: SQL Server, PostgreSQL
ETL: Pentaho Data Integration, Microsoft SSIS, Datastage
Modellazione dati: Erwin Data Modeler
Strumenti di analisi e reporting: Power BI, Report Builder, Birt




Requisiti del candidato ideale

Passione per le tematiche legate al mondo Data & Analytics.
Esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni nel ruolo.
Buona conoscenza dei linguaggi SQL e PL/SQL.
Familiarità con DBMS relazionali e integrazione dati.
Competenze in architetture di warehousing e tecniche di reporting.
Capacità di lavorare in team in un’ottica collaborativa e innovativa.




Competenze aggiuntive che saranno considerate un plus:

Capacità di analizzare requisiti di Business e tradurli in specifiche tecniche.
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di strutture dati per la contabilità (es. XBRL).
Conoscenze funzionali in ambito assicurativo.




Cosa offriamo

Contratto di assunzione a tempo indeterminato.
Opportunità di crescita professionale in un contesto innovativo e stimolante.
Modalità di lavoro ibrido

Show more
HTML:
Descrizione dell'Azienda

Atumtek è un protagonista nell'innovazione tecnologica per il settore assicurativo e bancassicurativo. Come abilitatore insurtech, supportiamo la trasformazione digitale di compagnie assicurative, banche, broker e intermediari, promuovendo un ambiente dinamico e incentrato sull'innovazione.


Posizione aperta: Junior Data Analyst/ETL Developer

Ricerchiamo un Junior Data Analyst/ETL Developer da inserire nel team Data Platform della nostra software factory interna. Sarai coinvolto nel disegno, nell’implementazione e nell’evoluzione delle nostre piattaforme, oltre che nello sviluppo di soluzioni E2E innovative in ambito Data & Analytics per il settore assicurativo.


Competenze richieste:

  • RDBMS: SQL Server, PostgreSQL
  • ETL: Pentaho Data Integration, Microsoft SSIS, Datastage
  • Modellazione dati: Erwin Data Modeler
  • Strumenti di analisi e reporting: Power BI, Report Builder, Birt


Requisiti del candidato ideale

  • Passione per le tematiche legate al mondo Data & Analytics.
  • Esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni nel ruolo.
  • Buona conoscenza dei linguaggi SQL e PL/SQL.
  • Familiarità con DBMS relazionali e integrazione dati.
  • Competenze in architetture di warehousing e tecniche di reporting.
  • Capacità di lavorare in team in un’ottica collaborativa e innovativa.


Competenze aggiuntive che saranno considerate un plus:

  • Capacità di analizzare requisiti di Business e tradurli in specifiche tecniche.
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo di strutture dati per la contabilità (es. XBRL).
  • Conoscenze funzionali in ambito assicurativo.


Cosa offriamo

  • Contratto di assunzione a tempo indeterminato.
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale in un contesto innovativo e stimolante.
  • Modalità di lavoro ibrido

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ATON IT eroga consulenza altamente qualificata in ambito ICT.




Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst che avrà l’opportunità di partecipare ad un progetto con lunga visibilità per un nostro strategico cliente.




Il contratto, il livello e la retribuzione saranno definiti in fase di colloquio. Accettiamo candidature di consulenti interessati a lavorare a Partita Iva.




Competenze del candidato:




Pentaho (sia modulo di ETL Data Integration che modulo di Reporting\Interactive Report)




Completano il profilo:

Laurea e/o Diploma in discipline tecnico-scientifiche,
buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.




Sede: Milano e Roma, con possibilità di smartworking.




Se interessati, inviate il Vostro Curriculum Vitae aggiornato e dettagliato a livia.prettico@atoninformatica.it, che dovrà contenere autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati secondo l'articolo 13 GDPR679/16.
